author: @SBousseaden (detection), Thomas Patzke (rule)
description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 8, u'SourceImage|endswith': [u'\System32\cscript.exe', u'\System32\wscript.exe', u'\System32\mshta.exe', u'\winword.exe', u'\excel.exe'], u'TargetImage|contains': u'\SysWOW64\', u'StartModule': None}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1093, attack.t1055.012, attack.execution, attack.t1064, attack.t1059.005, attack.t1059.007, attack.t1218.005]
title: CACTUSTORCH Remote Thread Creation

author: Olaf Hartong, Florian Roth, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community
description: Detects a possible remote threat creation with certain characteristics which are typical for Cobalt Strike beacons
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetProcessAddress|endswith': [u'0B80', u'0C7C', u'0C88']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CobaltStrike Process Injection

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects potential use of CreateRemoteThread api and LoadLibrary function to inject DLL into a process
detection: {u'selection': {u'StartFunction': u'LoadLibraryA', u'StartModule|endswith': u'\kernel32.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CreateRemoteThread API and LoadLibrary

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'StartModule': u''}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detecting Code injection with PowerShell in another process
detection: {u'selection': {u'SourceImage|endswith': u'\powershell.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'create_remote_thread', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for CreateRemoteThread in Symson config', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Accessing WinAPI in PowerShell. Code Injection.

author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community
description: Offensive tradecraft is switching away from using APIs like "CreateRemoteThread", however, this is still largely observed in the wild. This rule aims to detect suspicious processes (those we would not expect to behave in this way like word.exe or outlook.exe) creating remote threads on other processes. It is a generalistic rule, but it should have a low FP ratio due to the selected range of processes.
detection: {u'filter': {u'SourceImage|contains': u'Visual Studio'}, u'selection': {u'SourceImage|endswith': [u'\bash.exe', u'\cvtres.exe', u'\defrag.exe', u'\dnx.exe', u'\esentutl.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\expand.exe', u'\explorer.exe', u'\find.exe', u'\findstr.exe', u'\forfiles.exe', u'\git.exe', u'\gpupdate.exe', u'\hh.exe', u'\iexplore.exe', u'\installutil.exe', u'\lync.exe', u'\makecab.exe', u'\mDNSResponder.exe', u'\monitoringhost.exe', u'\msbuild.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'\msiexec.exe', u'\mspaint.exe', u'\outlook.exe', u'\ping.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\provtool.exe', u'\python.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\robocopy.exe', u'\runonce.exe', u'\sapcimc.exe', u'\schtasks.exe', u'\smartscreen.exe', u'\spoolsv.exe', u'\tstheme.exe', u'\userinit.exe', u'\vssadmin.exe', u'\vssvc.exe', u'\w3wp.exe', u'\winlogon.exe', u'\winscp.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\word.exe', u'\wscript.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Remote Thread Created
notes: [MonitoringHost.exe is a process that loads .NET CLR by default and thus a favorite for process injection for .NET in-memory offensive tools.]

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects PowerShell remote thread creation in Rundll32.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 8, u'SourceImage|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell Rundll32 Remote Thread Creation

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)
detection: {u'sysmon_pipecreated': {u'PipeName': u'\PSEXESVC'}, u'condition': u'sysmon_pipecreated'}
fields: [EventID, CommandLine, ParentCommandLine, ServiceName, ServiceFileName, TargetFilename, PipeName]
title: PsExec Tool Execution

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\powershell_ise.exe']}, u'selection': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\PSHost'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Programs using PowerShell directly without invocation of a dedicated interpreter.]
title: Alternate PowerShell Hosts Pipe

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects a named pipe used by Turla group samples
detection: {u'selection': {u'PipeName': [u'\atctl', u'\userpipe', u'\iehelper', u'\sdlrpc', u'\comnap']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for PipeEvents in Symson config', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Turla Group Named Pipes

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via specific named pipes
detection: {u'selection': {u'PipeName|contains': [u'\lsadump', u'\cachedump', u'\wceservicepipe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator using tool for password recovery]
title: Cred Dump-Tools Named Pipes

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the pattern of a pipe name as used by the tool EfsPotato
detection: {u'selection': {u'PipeName|contains': [u'\pipe\', u'\pipe\srvsvc']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for PipeEvents in Sysmon config', u'product': u'windows'}
title: EfsPotato Named Pipe

author: Florian Roth, Wojciech Lesicki
description: Detects the creation of a named pipe as used by CobaltStrike
detection: {u'selection_MSSE': {u'PipeName|contains|all': [u'\MSSE-', u'-server']}, u'selection_status': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\status_'}, u'selection_postex': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\postex_'}, u'selection_msagent': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\msagent_'}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection_postex_ssh': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\postex_ssh_'}}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular', u'product': u'windows'}
title: CobaltStrike Named Pipe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the creation of a named pipe matching a pattern used by CobaltStrike Malleable C2 profiles
detection: {u'selection': [{u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\mojo\.5688\.8052\.(?:183894939787088877|35780273329370473)[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\wkssvc_?[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\ntsvcs[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\DserNamePipe[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\SearchTextHarvester[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\mypipe\-(?:f|h)[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\windows\.update\.manager[0-9a-f]{2,3}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\ntsvcs_[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\scerpc_?[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\PGMessagePipe[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\MsFteWds[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\f4c3[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\fullduplex_[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\msrpc_[0-9a-f]{4}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\win\\\\msrpc_[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\f53f[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\rpc_[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\spoolss_[0-9a-f]{2}'}, {u'PipeName|re': u'\\\\Winsock2\\\\CatalogChangeListener-[0-9a-f]{3}-0,'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular', u'product': u'windows'}
title: CobaltStrike Named Pipe Pattern Regex

author: Florian Roth, blueteam0ps
description: Detects the creation of a named pipe used by known APT malware
detection: {u'selection': {u'PipeName': [u'\isapi_http', u'\isapi_dg', u'\isapi_dg2', u'\sdlrpc', u'\ahexec', u'\winsession', u'\lsassw', u'\46a676ab7f179e511e30dd2dc41bd388', u'\9f81f59bc58452127884ce513865ed20', u'\e710f28d59aa529d6792ca6ff0ca1b34', u'\rpchlp_3', u'\NamePipe_MoreWindows', u'\pcheap_reuse', u'\gruntsvc', u'\583da945-62af-10e8-4902-a8f205c72b2e', u'\bizkaz', u'\svcctl', u'\Posh*', u'\jaccdpqnvbrrxlaf', u'\csexecsvc', u'\6e7645c4-32c5-4fe3-aabf-e94c2f4370e7']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for PipeEvents in Sysmon config', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Malicious Named Pipe

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects execution of PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\PSHost'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: T1086 PowerShell Execution

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detecting use PsExec via Pipe Creation/Access to pipes
detection: {u'selection': {u'PipeName|startswith': [u'psexec', u'paexec', u'remcom', u'csexec']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for PipeEvents in Symson config', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PsExec Pipes Artifacts

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects suspicious local connections via a named pipe to the AD FS configuration database (Windows Internal Database). Used to access information such as the AD FS configuration settings which contains sensitive information used to sign SAML tokens.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'Microsoft.IdentityServer.ServiceHost.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.PshSurrogate.exe', u'AzureADConnect.exe', u'Microsoft.Tri.Sensor.exe', u'wsmprovhost.exe', u'mmc.exe', u'sqlservr.exe']}, u'selection': {u'PipeName': u'\MICROSOFT##WID\tsql\query'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: ADFS Database Named Pipe Connection

author: Florian Roth, Christian Burkard
description: Detects the creation of a named pipe with a pattern found in CobaltStrike malleable C2 profiles
detection: {u'filter': {u'PipeName': [u'\wkssvc', u'\spoolss', u'\scerpc', u'\ntsvcs', u'\SearchTextHarvester', u'\PGMessagePipe', u'\MsFteWds']}, u'selection_malleable_profiles': [{u'PipeName|startswith': ['\\mojo.5688.8052.183894939787088877', '\\mojo.5688.8052.35780273329370473', '\\mypipe-f', '\\mypipe-h', '\\ntsvcs', '\\scerpc', '\\win_svc', '\\spoolss', '\\msrpc_', '\\win\\msrpc_', '\\wkssvc', '\\f53f', '\\windows.update.manager', '\\SearchTextHarvester', '\\DserNamePipe', '\\PGMessagePipe', '\\MsFteWds', '\\f4c3', '\\fullduplex_', '\\rpc_']}, {u'PipeName': ['\\demoagent_11', '\\demoagent_22']}], u'condition': u'1 of selection_malleable_profile* and not filter', u'selection_malleable_profile_CatalogChangeListener': {u'PipeName|startswith': u'\Winsock2\CatalogChangeListener-', u'PipeName|endswith': u'-0,'}}
falsepositives: [Chrome instances using the exactly same name pipe named mojo.something]
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular', u'product': u'windows'}
title: CobaltStrike Named Pipe Patterns

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the WMI Event Consumer service scrcons.exe creating a named pipe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\scrcons.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'pipe_created', u'definition': u'Note that you have to configure logging for Named Pipe Events in Sysmon config (Event ID 17 and Event ID 18). The basic configuration is in popular sysmon configuration (https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config), but it is worth verifying. You can also use other repo, e.g. https://github.com/Neo23x0/sysmon-config, https://github.com/olafhartong/sysmon-modular', u'product': u'windows'}
title: WMI Event Consumer Created Named Pipe

author: Austin Songer (@austinsonger)
description: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'ParentImage|startswith': [u'c:\windows\system32\', u'c:\windows\syswow64\']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\schtasks.exe', u'\systeminfo.exe', u'\fltmc.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\stordiag.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Execution via stordiag.exe

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'HostApplication|startswith': u'C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe'}, u'selection': {u'HostApplication': u'*'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Programs using PowerShell directly without invocation of a dedicated interpreter, MSP Detection Searcher, Citrix ConfigSync.ps1]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Alternate PowerShell Hosts

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
detection: {u'selection': {u'HostApplication|contains': [u'powercat ', u'powercat.ps1']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Netcat The Powershell Version

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions
detection: {u'selection': {u'HostName': u'ServerRemoteHost', u'HostApplication|contains': u'wsmprovhost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Remote PowerShell Session

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
detection: {u'downloadfile': {u'HostApplication|contains|all': [u'System.Net.WebClient', u'.DownloadFile(']}, u'downloadstring': {u'HostApplication|contains|all': [u'System.Net.WebClient', u'.DownloadString(']}, u'condition': u'downloadfile or downloadstring'}
falsepositives: [PowerShell scripts that download content from the Internet]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Download

author: frack113
description: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe is an abusable, signed PowerShell host executable that was introduced in Windows 10 and Server 2019 (OS Build 17763.1339).
detection: {u'selection_cmd': {u'HostApplication|contains': u'Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand '}, u'selection_opt': {u'HostApplication|contains': [u'-ModuleName ', u'-ModulePath ', u'-ScriptBlock ', u'-RemoteFXvGPUDisablementFilePath']}, u'condition': u'selection_cmd and selection_opt'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'powershell-classic'}
title: Abusable Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand

author: frack113
description: Use living off the land tools to zip a file and stage it in the Windows temporary folder for later exfiltration
detection: {u'selection': {u'HostApplication|contains|all': [u'Compress-Archive ', u' -Path ', u' -DestinationPath ', u'$env:TEMP\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'powershell-classic'}
title: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp

author: frack113
description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities via PowerShell
detection: {u'selection_del': {u'HostApplication|contains': [u'Delete()', u'Remove-WmiObject']}, u'selection_obj': {u'HostApplication|contains|all': [u'Get-WmiObject', u' Win32_Shadowcopy']}, u'condition': u'selection_obj and selection_del'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator deletes Shadow Copies using operating systems utilities for legitimate reason]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Delete Volume Shadow Copies Via WMI With PowerShell

author: Florian Roth (rule), Lee Holmes (idea), Harish Segar (improvements)
description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0
detection: {u'filter': {u'HostVersion|startswith': u'2.'}, u'selection': {u'EngineVersion|startswith': u'2.'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Downgrade Attack

author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects PowerShell called from an executable by the version mismatch method
detection: {u'selection1': {u'HostVersion|startswith': u'3.', u'EngineVersion|startswith': [u'2.', u'4.', u'5.']}, u'condition': u'selection1'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Called from an Executable Version Mismatch

author: Harish Segar, frack113
description: Detects renamed powershell
detection: {u'filter': {u'HostApplication|startswith': [u'powershell.exe', u'C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe']}, u'selection': {u'HostName': u'ConsoleHost'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Renamed Powershell Under Powershell Channel

author: frack113
description: Attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of windows defender atp.
detection: {u'tamper_ps_action': {u'HostApplication|contains': u'Set-MpPreference'}, u'condition': u'tamper_ps_action and  tamper_ps_option', u'tamper_ps_option': {u'HostApplication|contains': [u'-DisableRealtimeMonitoring 1', u'-DisableBehaviorMonitoring 1', u'-DisableScriptScanning 1', u'-DisableBlockAtFirstSeen 1']}}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_provider_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Tamper Windows Defender

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects suspicious use of the WSMAN provider without PowerShell.exe as the host application.
detection: {u'filter': {u'HostApplication|contains': u'powershell'}, u'selection': {u'ProviderName': u'WSMan'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'powershell-classic'}
title: Suspicious Non PowerShell WSMAN COM Provider

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Harish Segar (rule)
description: Detects suspicious powershell process which includes bxor command, alternative obfuscation method to b64 encoded commands.
detection: {u'filter': {u'HostApplication|contains': [u'bxor', u'join', u'char']}, u'selection': {u'HostName': u'ConsoleHost'}, u'condition': u'selection and filter'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_classic_start', u'definition': u'fields have to be extract from event', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command Line

author: Kiran kumar s, oscd.community
description: Detects a possible remote connections to Silenttrinity c2
detection: {u'filter': {u'DestinationPort': [u'80', u'443'], u'Initiated': u'true'}, u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\msbuild.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and filter'}
title: Silenttrinity Stager Msbuild Activity

author: bartblaze
description: Detects Dllhost that communicates with public IP addresses
falsepositives: [Communication to other corporate systems that use IP addresses from public address spaces]
title: Dllhost Internet Connection

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects programs that connect to typical malware back connect ports based on statistical analysis from two different sandbox system databases
logsource: {u'category': u'network_connection', u'definition': u'Use the following config to generate the necessary Event ID 10 Process Access events: <ProcessAccess onmatch="include"><CallTrace condition="contains">VBE7.DLL</CallTrace></ProcessAccess><ProcessAccess onmatch="exclude"><CallTrace condition="excludes">UNKNOWN</CallTrace></ProcessAccess>', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious Typical Malware Back Connect Ports

author: EagleEye Team
description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad
detection: {u'filter': {u'DestinationPort': u'9100'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\notepad.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Notepad Making Network Connection

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a Powershell process that opens network connections - check for suspicious target ports and target systems - adjust to your environment (e.g. extend filters with company's ip range')
detection: {u'filter': {u'DestinationIp|startswith': [u'10.', u'192.168.', u'172.16.', u'172.17.', u'172.18.', u'172.19.', u'172.20.', u'172.21.', u'172.22.', u'172.23.', u'172.24.', u'172.25.', u'172.26.', u'172.27.', u'172.28.', u'172.29.', u'172.30.', u'172.31.', u'127.0.0.1'], u'User|contains|all': [u'AUT', u' NT'], u'DestinationIsIpv6': u'false', u'User': u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'DestinationIsIpv6': u'false', u'Initiated': u'true'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: PowerShell Network Connections

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address and on TCP port 3389
detection: {u'selection': {u'SourcePort': 3389, u'Image|endswith': u'\svchost.exe', u'Initiated': u'true'}, u'selection2': [{u'DestinationIp|startswith': ['127.']}, {u'DestinationIp': ['::1']}], u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
title: RDP Over Reverse SSH Tunnel

author: Dmitriy Lifanov, oscd.community
description: Detects network connections and DNS queries initiated by Regsvr32.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Regsvr32 Network Activity

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects remote PowerShell connections by monitoring network outbound connections to ports 5985 or 5986 from a non-network service account.
detection: {u'filter': {u'User': u'NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE'}, u'selection': {u'DestinationPort': [5985, 5986]}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate usage of remote PowerShell, e.g. remote administration and monitoring.]
title: Remote PowerShell Session

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a rundll32 that communicates with public IP addresses
falsepositives: [Communication to other corporate systems that use IP addresses from public address spaces]
title: Rundll32 Internet Connection

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\lsass.exe', u'\opera.exe', u'\chrome.exe', u'\firefox.exe']}, u'selection': {u'DestinationPort': 88, u'Initiated': u'true'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects programs with network connections running in suspicious files system locations
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Image|contains': ['\\Users\\All Users\\', '\\Users\\Default\\', '\\Users\\Public\\', '\\Users\\Contacts\\', '\\Users\\Searches\\', '\\config\\systemprofile\\', '\\Windows\\Fonts\\', '\\Windows\\IME\\', '\\Windows\\addins\\']}, {u'Image|endswith': ['\\$Recycle.bin']}, {u'Image|startswith': ['C:\\Perflogs\\']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'network_connection', u'definition': u'Use the following config to generate the necessary Event ID 3 Network Connection events', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious Program Location with Network Connections

author: Markus Neis - Swisscom
description: Detects Non-Standard Tools Connecting to TCP port 3389 indicating possible lateral movement
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\mstsc.exe', u'\RTSApp.exe', u'\RTS2App.exe', u'\RDCMan.exe', u'\ws_TunnelService.exe', u'\RSSensor.exe', u'\RemoteDesktopManagerFree.exe', u'\RemoteDesktopManager.exe', u'\RemoteDesktopManager64.exe', u'\mRemoteNG.exe', u'\mRemote.exe', u'\Terminals.exe', u'\spiceworks-finder.exe', u'\FSDiscovery.exe', u'\FSAssessment.exe', u'\MobaRTE.exe', u'\chrome.exe', u'\thor.exe', u'\thor64.exe']}, u'selection': {u'DestinationPort': 3389, u'Initiated': u'true'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Outbound RDP Connections

author: Michael Haag (idea), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing github.com
detection: {u'selection': {u'Initiated': u'true', u'Image|startswith': u'C:\Windows\', u'DestinationHostname|endswith': [u'.github.com', u'.githubusercontent.com']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Microsoft Binary Github Communication

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing suspicious domains
detection: {u'selection': {u'Initiated': u'true', u'Image|startswith': u'C:\Windows\', u'DestinationHostname|endswith': [u'dl.dropboxusercontent.com', u'.pastebin.com', u'.githubusercontent.com']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Microsoft Binary Suspicious Communication Endpoint

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code and making a network connections. One could easily make the DLL spawn a new process and inject to it to proxy the network connection and bypass this rule.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': u'wuauclt'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of wuauclt.exe over the network.]
title: Wuauclt Network Connection

author: Sreeman
description: Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections. This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run. The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Details|endswith': [u'.sh', u'.exe', u'.dll', u'.bin', u'.bat', u'.cmd', u'.js', u'.ps', u'.vb', u'.jar', u'.hta', u'.msi', u'.vbs'], u'TargetObject|contains': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Abusing Windows Telemetry For Persistence

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018
detection: {u'selection_reg1': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\UMe', u'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\UT']}, u'condition': u'selection_reg1'}
tags: [attack.persistence, attack.g0049, attack.t1053, attack.t1053.005, attack.s0111, attack.t1050, attack.t1543.003, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1112, attack.command_and_control, attack.t1071, attack.t1071.004]
title: Chafer Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Pandemic Windows Implant
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\null\Instance'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Pandemic Registry Key

author: Sittikorn S
description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Windows CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 vulnerability and DevilsTongue malware by threat group Sourgum
detection: {u'keywords': [u'IMJPUEXP.DLL'], u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Software\Classes\CLSID\{CF4CC405-E2C5-4DDD-B3CE-5E7582D8C9FA}\InprocServer32', u'\SOFTWARE\Classes\CLSID\{7C857801-7381-11CF-884D-00AA004B2E24}\InProcServer32']}, u'condition': u'selection and keywords'}
title: CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 Exploits by Sourgum

author: Ján Trenčanský, frack113, AlertIQ
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender threat protection
detection: {u'tamper_registry': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000001)', u'TargetObject': [u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\DisableAntiSpyware', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\DisableAntiVirus']}, u'selection2': {u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000001)', u'TargetObject': [u'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\WinDefend', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender']}, u'condition': u'tamper_registry or selection2'}
title: Windows Defender Threat Detection Disabled

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions
detection: {u'selection2': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions'}, u'condition': u'selection2'}
title: Windows Defender Exclusions Added

author: AlertIQ
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Real-Time Protection by modifying registry
detection: {u'tamper_registry1': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000001)', u'TargetObject': [u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableBehaviorMonitoring', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableIOAVProtection', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableOnAccessProtection', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableRealtimeMonitoring', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableScanOnRealtimeEnable', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\SpyNet\DisableBlockAtFirstSeen']}, u'condition': u'tamper_registry1 or tamper_registry2', u'tamper_registry2': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000000)', u'TargetObject': [u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\SpyNet\SpynetReporting', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\SpyNet\SubmitSamplesConsent']}}
title: Windows Defender Real-Time Protection Disabled

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the installation of a plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)
detection: {u'dnsregmod': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\services\DNS\Parameters\ServerLevelPluginDll'}, u'condition': u'dnsregmod'}
title: DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Install

author: Florian Roth, Tom Ueltschi, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects javaw.exe in AppData folder as used by Adwind / JRAT
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|startswith': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run', u'Details|startswith': u'%AppData%\Roaming\Oracle\bin\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Adwind RAT / JRAT

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the deletion of registry keys containing the MSTSC connection history
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventType': u'DeleteValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Microsoft\Terminal Server Client\Default\MRU'}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'EventType': u'DeleteKey', u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Microsoft\Terminal Server Client\Servers\'}}
title: Terminal Server Client Connection History Cleared

author: Florian Roth, wagga
description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains|all': [u'SYSTEM\', u'ControlSet', u'\Control\Lsa'], u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\lmcompatibilitylevel', u'\NtlmMinClientSec', u'\RestrictSendingNTLMTraffic']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack

author: Florian Roth, @twjackomo, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
detection: {u'selection_registry': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\sethc.exe\Debugger', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\utilman.exe\Debugger', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\osk.exe\Debugger', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\Magnify.exe\Debugger', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\Narrator.exe\Debugger', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\DisplaySwitch.exe\Debugger']}, u'condition': u'selection_registry'}
title: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects the usage of Sysinternals Tools due to accepteula key being added to Registry
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\EulaAccepted'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of SysInternals tools, Programs that use the same Registry Key]
title: Usage of Sysinternals Tools

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer
detection: {u'condition': u'methregistry', u'methregistry': {u'TargetObject|startswith': u'HKCU\', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\mscfile\shell\open\command'}}
title: UAC Bypass via Event Viewer

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Details|endswith': u'\appdata\local\temp\system32\winsat.exe', u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Root\InventoryApplicationFile\winsat.exe|', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\LowerCaseLongPath', u'Details|startswith': u'c:\users\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Registry

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AppCompatFlags\Compatibility Assistant\Store\C:\Program Files\Windows Media Player\osk.exe', u'Details': u'Binary Data'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Registry

author: Aidan Bracher
description: Detects registry key used by Leviathan APT in Malaysian focused campaign
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject': u'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\ntkd'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Leviathan Registry Key Activity

author: megan201296, Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects registry keys created in OceanLotus (also known as APT32) attacks
detection: {u'ioc_2': {u'TargetObject|startswith': [u'HKCU\SOFTWARE\App\', u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\App\'], u'TargetObject|contains': [u'AppXbf13d4ea2945444d8b13e2121cb6b663\', u'AppX70162486c7554f7f80f481985d67586d\', u'AppX37cc7fdccd644b4f85f4b22d5a3f105a\'], u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'Application', u'DefaultIcon']}, u'ioc_1': {u'TargetObject': u'HKCU\SOFTWARE\Classes\CLSID\{E08A0F4B-1F65-4D4D-9A09-BD4625B9C5A1}\Model'}, u'selection2': {u'TargetObject|startswith': [u'HKCU\'], u'TargetObject|contains': [u'Classes\AppXc52346ec40fb4061ad96be0e6cb7d16a\', u'Classes\AppX3bbba44c6cae4d9695755183472171e2\', u'Classes\CLSID\{E3517E26-8E93-458D-A6DF-8030BC80528B}\', u'Classes\CLSID\{E08A0F4B-1F65-4D4D-9A09-BD4625B9C5A1}\Model']}, u'condition': u'ioc_1 or ioc_2 or selection2'}
title: OceanLotus Registry Activity

author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
detection: {u'nt_current_version_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'}, u'wow_current_version_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion'}, u'winsock_parameters_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\WinSock2\Parameters'}, u'office': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Microsoft\Office'}, u'wow_ie': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Internet Explorer'}, u'system_control': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Terminal Server\WinStations\RDP-Tcp\InitialProgram', u'\Terminal Server\Wds\rdpwd\StartupPrograms', u'\SecurityProviders\SecurityProviders', u'\SafeBoot\AlternateShell', u'\Print\Providers', u'\Print\Monitors', u'\NetworkProvider\Order', u'\Lsa\Notification Packages', u'\Lsa\Authentication Packages', u'\BootVerificationProgram\ImagePath']}, u'scripts_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\Scripts'}, u'classes_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Classes'}, u'system_control_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control'}, u'scripts': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Startup', u'\Shutdown', u'\Logon', u'\Logoff']}, u'wow_office_details': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Word\Addins', u'\PowerPoint\Addins', u'\Outlook\Addins', u'\Onenote\Addins', u'\Excel\Addins', u'\Access\Addins', u'test\Special\Perf']}, u'wow_nt_current_version_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'}, u'current_version': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\ShellServiceObjectDelayLoad', u'\Run', u'\Policies\System\Shell', u'\Policies\Explorer\Run', u'\Group Policy\Scripts\Startup', u'\Group Policy\Scripts\Shutdown', u'\Group Policy\Scripts\Logon', u'\Group Policy\Scripts\Logoff', u'\Explorer\ShellServiceObjects', u'\Explorer\ShellIconOverlayIdentifiers', u'\Explorer\ShellExecuteHooks', u'\Explorer\SharedTaskScheduler', u'\Explorer\Browser Helper Objects', u'\Authentication\PLAP Providers', u'\Authentication\Credential Providers', u'\Authentication\Credential Provider Filters']}, u'wow_ie_details': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Toolbar', u'\Extensions', u'\Explorer Bars']}, u'ie': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer'}, u'condition': u'main_selection or session_manager_base and session_manager or current_version_base and current_version or nt_current_version_base and nt_current_version or wow_current_version_base and wow_current_version or wow_nt_current_version_base and wow_nt_current_version or (wow_office or office) and wow_office_details or (wow_ie or ie) and wow_ie_details or wow_classes_base and wow_classes or classes_base and classes or scripts_base and scripts or winsock_parameters_base and winsock_parameters or system_control_base and system_control', u'winsock_parameters': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Protocol_Catalog9\Catalog_Entries', u'\NameSpace_Catalog5\Catalog_Entries']}, u'session_manager': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\SetupExecute', u'\S0InitialCommand', u'\KnownDlls', u'\Execute', u'\BootExecute', u'\AppCertDlls']}, u'current_version_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion'}, u'nt_current_version': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Winlogon\VmApplet', u'\Winlogon\Userinit', u'\Winlogon\Taskman', u'\Winlogon\Shell', u'\Winlogon\GpExtensions', u'\Winlogon\AppSetup', u'\Winlogon\AlternateShells\AvailableShells', u'\Windows\IconServiceLib', u'\Windows\Appinit_Dlls', u'\Image File Execution Options', u'\Font Drivers', u'\Drivers32', u'\Windows\Run', u'\Windows\Load']}, u'session_manager_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager'}, u'wow_nt_current_version': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Windows\Appinit_Dlls', u'\Image File Execution Options', u'\Drivers32']}, u'wow_classes_base': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Wow6432Node\Classes'}, u'classes': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Folder\ShellEx\ExtShellFolderViews', u'\Folder\ShellEx\DragDropHandlers', u'\Folder\Shellex\ColumnHandlers', u'\Filter', u'\Exefile\Shell\Open\Command\(Default)', u'\Directory\Shellex\DragDropHandlers', u'\Directory\Shellex\CopyHookHandlers', u'\CLSID\{AC757296-3522-4E11-9862-C17BE5A1767E}\Instance', u'\CLSID\{ABE3B9A4-257D-4B97-BD1A-294AF496222E}\Instance', u'\CLSID\{7ED96837-96F0-4812-B211-F13C24117ED3}\Instance', u'\CLSID\{083863F1-70DE-11d0-BD40-00A0C911CE86}\Instance', u'\Classes\AllFileSystemObjects\ShellEx\DragDropHandlers', u'\.exe', u'\.cmd', u'\ShellEx\PropertySheetHandlers', u'\ShellEx\ContextMenuHandlers']}, u'main_selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows CE Services\AutoStart', u'\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Command Processor\Autorun', u'\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows CE Services\AutoStartOnDisconnect', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows CE Services\AutoStartOnConnect', u'\SYSTEM\Setup\CmdLine', u'\Software\Microsoft\Ctf\LangBarAddin', u'\Software\Microsoft\Command Processor\Autorun', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components', u'\SOFTWARE\Classes\Protocols\Handler', u'\SOFTWARE\Classes\Protocols\Filter', u'\SOFTWARE\Classes\Htmlfile\Shell\Open\Command\(Default)', u'\Environment\UserInitMprLogonScript', u'\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Control Panel\Desktop\Scrnsave.exe', u'\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\UrlSearchHooks', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Desktop\Components', u'\Software\Classes\Clsid\{AB8902B4-09CA-4bb6-B78D-A8F59079A8D5}\Inprocserver32', u'\Control Panel\Desktop\Scrnsave.exe']}, u'wow_current_version': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\ShellServiceObjectDelayLoad', u'\Run', u'\Explorer\ShellServiceObjects', u'\Explorer\ShellIconOverlayIdentifiers', u'\Explorer\ShellExecuteHooks', u'\Explorer\SharedTaskScheduler', u'\Explorer\Browser Helper Objects']}, u'wow_classes': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Folder\ShellEx\ExtShellFolderViews', u'\Folder\ShellEx\DragDropHandlers', u'\Folder\ShellEx\ColumnHandlers', u'\Directory\Shellex\DragDropHandlers', u'\Directory\Shellex\CopyHookHandlers', u'\CLSID\{AC757296-3522-4E11-9862-C17BE5A1767E}\Instance', u'\CLSID\{ABE3B9A4-257D-4B97-BD1A-294AF496222E}\Instance', u'\CLSID\{7ED96837-96F0-4812-B211-F13C24117ED3}\Instance', u'\CLSID\{083863F1-70DE-11d0-BD40-00A0C911CE86}\Instance', u'\AllFileSystemObjects\ShellEx\DragDropHandlers', u'\ShellEx\PropertySheetHandlers', u'\ShellEx\ContextMenuHandlers']}, u'wow_office': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Office'}}
falsepositives: [Legitimate software automatically (mostly, during installation) sets up autorun keys for legitimate reason, Legitimate administrator sets up autorun keys for legitimate reason]
title: Autorun Keys Modification

author: oscd.community, Dmitry Uchakin
description: Unfixed method for UAC bypass from windows 10. WSReset.exe file associated with the Windows Store. It will run a binary file contained in a low-privilege registry.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\AppX82a6gwre4fdg3bt635tn5ctqjf8msdd2\Shell\open\command']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Via Wsreset

author: Nik Seetharaman
description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\cmmgr32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate CMSTP use (unlikely in modern enterprise environments)]
title: CMSTP Execution Registry Event

author: Wojciech Lesicki
description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement. We can also catch this by system log 7045 (https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/rules/windows/builtin/win_cobaltstrike_service_installs.yml) In some SIEM you can catch those events also in HKLM\System\ControlSet001\Services or HKLM\System\ControlSet002\Services, however, this rule is based on a regular sysmon's events.
detection: {u'selection3': {u'Details|contains|all': [u'%COMSPEC%', u'start', u'powershell']}, u'selection1': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and (selection2 or selection3)', u'selection2': {u'Details|contains|all': [u'ADMIN$', u'.exe']}}
title: CobaltStrike Service Installations in Registry

author: Omkar Gudhate
description: Detects changes to 'HKCU\Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute'
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject': [u'HKCU\Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: COM Hijack via Sdclt

author: EagleEye Team, Florian Roth, NVISO
description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048
detection: {u'selection': {u'Details|contains': [u'.dll', u'.exe', u'.bat', u'.com', u'C:'], u'TargetObject|startswith': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Ports'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)

author: Dimitrios Slamaris
description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\Services\DHCPServer\Parameters\CalloutDlls', u'\Services\DHCPServer\Parameters\CalloutEnabled']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DHCP Callout DLL Installation

author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Exploit Guard Network Protection
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender Security Center\App and Browser protection\DisallowExploitProtectionOverride', u'Details': u'DWORD (00000001)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Disable Exploit Guard Network Protection on Windows Defender

author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender PUA protection
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\PUAProtection', u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000000)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Disable PUA Protection on Windows Defender

author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Tamper Protection
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Features\TamperProtection', u'Details': u'DWORD (0)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Disable Tamper Protection on Windows Defender

author: frack113
description: Disable Microsoft Office Security Features by registry
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\', u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'VBAWarnings', u'DisableInternetFilesInPV', u'DisableUnsafeLocationsInPV', u'DisableAttachementsInPV'], u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000001)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'registry_event', u'definition': u'key must be add to the sysmon configuration to works', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Disable Microsoft Office Security Features

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: Detects the addition of a key 'MiniNt' to the registry. Upon a reboot, Windows Event Log service will stopped write events.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'EventType': u'CreateKey', u'TargetObject': u'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MiniNt'}, {u'NewName': u'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MiniNt'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Disable Security Events Logging Adding Reg Key MiniNt

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of IsCredGuardEnabled from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to disable Cred Guard on a system. This is usually used with UseLogonCredential to manipulate the caching credentials.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\IsCredGuardEnabled'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Wdigest CredGuard Registry Modification

author: Austin Songer
description: Detects when a user enables DNS-over-HTTPS. This can be used to hide internet activity or be used to hide the process of exfiltrating data. With this enabled organization will lose visibility into data such as query type, response and originating IP that are used to determine bad actors.
detection: {u'selection_edge': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\BuiltInDnsClientEnabled', u'Details': u'DWORD (1)'}, u'selection_firefox': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox\DNSOverHTTPS\Enabled', u'Details': u'DWORD (1)'}, u'condition': u'selection_edge or selection_chrome or selection_firefox', u'selection_chrome': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\SOFTWARE\Google\Chrome\DnsOverHttpsMode', u'Details': u'DWORD (secure)'}}
title: DNS-over-HTTPS Enabled by Registry

author: Jose Rodriguez (@Cyb3rPandaH), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: This rule detects cor_enable_profiling and cor_profiler environment variables being set and configured.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\COR_ENABLE_PROFILING', u'\COR_PROFILER']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Enabling COR Profiler Environment Variables

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework\ETWEnabled', u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000000)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: COMPlus_ETWEnabled Registry Modification

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'Services\WCESERVICE\Start'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Credential Editor Registry

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects the installation of the Azure Hybrid Connection Manager service to allow remote code execution from Azure function.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Services\HybridConnectionManager'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'Details|contains': u'Microsoft.HybridConnectionManager.Listener.exe'}}
title: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation

author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure)
description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method
detection: {u'create_keywords_reg': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'UserInitMprLogonScript'}, u'condition': u'create_keywords_reg'}
falsepositives: [exclude legitimate logon scripts, penetration tests, red teaming]
title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript) Registry

author: Bartlomiej Czyz @bczyz1, oscd.community
description: Detects value modification of registry key containing path to binary used as screensaver.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\rundll32.exe', u'\explorer.exe']}, u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\Control Panel\Desktop\SCRNSAVE.EXE'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Path To Screensaver Binary Modified

author: Dmitriy Lifanov, oscd.community
description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator's Feedback-Hub
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventType': u'DeleteValue', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\AppXypsaf9f1qserqevf0sws76dx4k9a5206\Shell\open\command\DelegateExecute'}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\AppXypsaf9f1qserqevf0sws76dx4k9a5206\Shell\open\command\(Default)'}}
title: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for a new application in AppCompat. This indicates an application executing for the first time on an endpoint.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\AppCompatFlags\Compatibility Assistant\Store\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [This rule is to explore new applications on an endpoint. False positives depends on the organization., Newly setup system., Legitimate installation of new application.]
title: New Application in AppCompat

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: Dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) that are specified in the AppCertDLLs value in the Registry key can be abused to obtain persistence and privilege escalation by causing a malicious DLL to be loaded and run in the context of separate processes on the computer.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'TargetObject': u'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\AppCertDlls'}, {u'NewName': u'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\AppCertDlls'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: New DLL Added to AppCertDlls Registry Key

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: DLLs that are specified in the AppInit_DLLs value in the Registry key HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows are loaded by user32.dll into every process that loads user32.dll
detection: {u'selection': [{u'TargetObject|endswith': ['\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Windows\\AppInit_Dlls', '\\SOFTWARE\\Wow6432Node\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Windows\\AppInit_Dlls']}, {u'NewName|endswith': ['\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Windows\\AppInit_Dlls', '\\SOFTWARE\\Wow6432Node\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Windows\\AppInit_Dlls']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: New DLL Added to AppInit_DLLs Registry Key

author: omkar72
description: Detects the addition of office test registry that allows a user to specify an arbitrary DLL that will be executed every time an Office application is started
detection: {u'selection_registry': {u'TargetObject': [u'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office test\Special\Perf', u'HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Office test\Special\Perf']}, u'condition': u'selection_registry'}
title: Office Application Startup - Office Test

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects persistence via Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO) add-ins in Office applications.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\msiexec.exe'}, u'selection': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Software\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\', u'\Software\Microsoft\Office\Word\Addins\', u'\Software\Microsoft\Office\Excel\Addins\', u'\Software\Microsoft\Office\Powerpoint\Addins\', u'\Software\Microsoft\VSTO\Security\Inclusion\']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Stealthy VSTO Persistence

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects that a powershell code is written to the registry as a service.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Details|contains': [u'powershell', u'pwsh'], u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Services\', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\ImagePath'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell as a Service in Registry

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of fDenyTSConnections and UserAuthentication to enable remote desktop connections.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server\WinStations\RDP-Tcp\UserAuthentication', u'\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server\fDenyTSConnections'], u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000000)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: RDP Registry Modification

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects changes to RDP terminal service sensitive settings
detection: {u'selection_reg': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\services\TermService\Parameters\ServiceDll', u'\Control\Terminal Server\fSingleSessionPerUser', u'\Control\Terminal Server\fDenyTSConnections']}, u'condition': u'selection_reg'}
title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed

author: Alexander Rausch
description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\HTMLHelp\data'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Registry Manipulation

author: Christian Burkard
description: Sysmon registry detection of a local hidden user account.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'lsass.exe', u'TargetObject|startswith': u'HKLM\SAM\SAM\Domains\Account\Users\Names\', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Creation of a Local Hidden User Account by Registry

author: Kutepov Anton, oscd.community
description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'CreateKey', u'TargetObject|contains|all': [u'HKU\', u'Classes\CLSID\', u'\TreatAs']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Maybe some system utilities in rare cases use linking keys for backward compatibility]
title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Key Linking

author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut), oscd.community, Cédric Hien
description: Detects potential COM object hijacking leveraging the COM Search Order
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|startswith': [u'HKCR\CLSID\', u'HKCU\Software\Classes\CLSID\'], u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\InprocServer32\(Default)'}, u'filterOneDrive': {u'Details|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Microsoft\OneDrive\'}, u'filter3': {u'Details|contains|all': [u'\AppData\Roaming\Dropbox\', u'\DropboxExt64.*.dll']}, u'filterOneDrive2': {u'Details|contains': [u'\FileCoAuthLib64.dll', u'\FileSyncShell64.dll', u'\FileSyncApi64.dll']}, u'filter2': {u'Details|contains|all': [u'\AppData\Local\Microsoft\TeamsMeetingAddin\', u'\Microsoft.Teams.AddinLoader.dll']}, u'filter1': {u'Details|contains': [u'%%systemroot%%\system32\', u'%%systemroot%%\SysWow64\']}, u'condition': u'selection and not ( filter1 or ( filterOneDrive and filterOneDrive2 ) or filter2 or filter3 )'}
falsepositives: [Some installed utilities (i.e. OneDrive) may serve new COM objects at user-level]
title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Search Order Hijacking

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains|all': [u'\Control\Print\Environments\Windows x64\Drivers', u'\Manufacturer'], u'Details': u'(Empty)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate printer drivers that do not set any more details in the Manufacturer value]
title: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Alerts on trust record modification within the registry, indicating usage of macros
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'TrustRecords'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: Windows Registry Trust Record Modification

author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick)
description: Detects registry changes to Office macro settings
detection: {u'sec_settings': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'\Security\Trusted Documents\TrustRecords', u'\Security\AccessVBOM', u'\Security\VBAWarnings']}, u'condition': u'sec_settings'}
title: Office Security Settings Changed

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to monitor the exit of another process
detection: {u'selection': {u'Details|contains': u'MonitorProcess', u'TargetObject|contains': u'Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\SilentProcessExit'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SilentProcessExit Monitor Registrytion

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to dump process memory of the lsass.exe process memory
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\SilentProcessExit\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SilentProcessExit Monitor Registrytion for LSASS

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects VBScript content stored into registry keys as seen being used by UNC2452 group
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run'}, u'selection': {u'Details|contains': [u'vbscript', u'jscript', u'mshtml', u'mshtml,', u'mshtml ', u'RunHTMLApplication', u'Execute(', u'CreateObject', u'RegRead', u'window.close'], u'TargetObject|contains': u'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: VBScript Payload Stored in Registry

author: frack113
description: Remove the AMSI Provider registry key in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\AMSI to disable AMSI inspection
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'DeleteKey', u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'{2781761E-28E0-4109-99FE-B9D127C57AFE}', u'{A7C452EF-8E9F-42EB-9F2B-245613CA0DC9}']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'registry_event', u'definition': u'key must be add to the sysmon configuration to works', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Removal Amsi Provider Reg Key

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection to trigger for processes removing .*\shell\open\command registry keys. Registry keys that might have been used for COM hijacking activities.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'DeleteKey', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\shell\open\command'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Removal of Potential COM Hijacking Registry Keys

author: omkar72
description: Detects potential malicious modification of run keys by winekey or team9 backdoor
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\Backup Mgr']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WINEKEY Registry Modification

author: Avneet Singh @v3t0_, oscd.community
description: Rule to detect the configuration of Run Once registry key. Configured payload can be run by runonce.exe /AlternateShellStartup
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|startswith': u'HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\StubPath'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate modification of the registry key by legitimate program]
title: Run Once Task Configuration in Registry

author: iwillkeepwatch
description: Detects the addition of a SSP to the registry. Upon a reboot or API call, SSP DLLs gain access to encrypted and plaintext passwords stored in Windows.
detection: {u'selection_registry': {u'TargetObject': [u'HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\Security Packages', u'HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\OSConfig\Security Packages']}, u'exclusion_images': [{u'Image': u'C:\Windows\system32\msiexec.exe'}, {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\syswow64\MsiExec.exe'}], u'condition': u'selection_registry and not exclusion_images'}
title: Security Support Provider (SSP) Added to LSA Configuration

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the keyboard preload installation with a suspicious keyboard layout, e.g. Chinese, Iranian or Vietnamese layout load in user session on systems maintained by US staff only
detection: {u'selection_registry': {u'Details|contains': [u'00000429', u'00050429', u'0000042a'], u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Keyboard Layout\Preload\', u'\Keyboard Layout\Substitutes\']}, u'condition': u'selection_registry'}
falsepositives: [Administrators or users that actually use the selected keyboard layouts (heavily depends on the organisation's user base)]
logsource: {u'category': u'registry_event', u'definition': u'Requirements: Sysmon config that monitors \Keyboard Layout\Preload subkey of the HKLU hives - see https://github.com/SwiftOnSecurity/sysmon-config/pull/92/files', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious Keyboard Layout Load

author: Mateusz Wydra, oscd.community
description: Detects creation/modification of Assisitive Technology applications and persistence with usage of ATs
detection: {u'creation': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Accessibility\ATs'}, u'persistence': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Accessibility\Configuration'}, u'condition': u'creation or persistence'}
title: Atbroker Registry Change

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': [u'\Downloads\', u'\Temporary Internet Files\Content.Outlook\', u'\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files\'], u'TargetObject|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Software installers downloaded and used by users]
title: Suspicious Run Key from Download

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\DirectoryServiceExtPt', u'\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\LsaDbExtPt']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DLL Load via LSASS

author: Den Iuzvyk
description: Detects Processes accessing the camera and microphone from suspicious folder
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'TargetObject|contains|all': [u'\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\', u'\NonPackaged']}, u'selection_2': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'microphone', u'webcam']}, u'selection_3': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u':#Windows#Temp#', u':#$Recycle.bin#', u':#Temp#', u':#Users#Public#', u':#Users#Default#', u':#Users#Desktop#']}, u'condition': u'all of selection_*'}
falsepositives: [Unlikely, there could be conferencing software running from a Temp folder accessing the devices]
title: Suspicious Camera and Microphone Access

author: Florian Roth, oscd.community
description: Detects a possible persistence mechanism using RUN key for Windows Explorer and pointing to a suspicious folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run'}, u'selection2': [{u'Details|startswith': ['C:\\Windows\\Temp\\', 'C:\\ProgramData\\', 'C:\\$Recycle.bin\\', 'C:\\Temp\\', 'C:\\Users\\Public\\', 'C:\\Users\\Default\\']}, {u'Details|contains': ['\\AppData\\']}], u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
title: Registry Persistence via Explorer Run Key

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing
description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\', u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce\']}, u'selection2': [{u'Details|contains': ['C:\\Windows\\Temp\\', 'C:\\$Recycle.bin\\', 'C:\\Temp\\', 'C:\\Users\\Public\\', 'C:\\Users\\Default\\', 'C:\\Users\\Desktop\\']}, {u'Details|startswith': ['%Public%\\', 'wscript', 'cscript']}], u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder

author: xknow (@xknow_infosec), xorxes (@xor_xes)
description: Detects installation of NalDrv or PROCEXP152 services via registry-keys to non-system32 folders. Both services are used in the tool Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU)
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'TargetObject': [u'HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\NalDrv\ImagePath', u'HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\PROCEXP152\ImagePath']}, u'selection_2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\procexp64.exe', u'\procexp.exe', u'\procmon64.exe', u'\procmon.exe']}, u'selection_3': {u'Details|contains': [u'\WINDOWS\system32\Drivers\PROCEXP152.SYS']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and not selection_2 and not selection_3'}
falsepositives: [Other legimate tools using this service names and drivers. Note - clever attackers may easily bypass this detection by just renaming the services. Therefore just Medium-level and don't rely on it.]
title: Suspicious Service Installed

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection to trigger for the creation or modification of .*\Software\Sysinternals\SDelete registry keys. Indicators of the use of Sysinternals SDelete tool.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\Sysinternals\SDelete'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Sysinternals SDelete Registry Keys

author: Syed Hasan (@syedhasan009)
description: Monitor the creation of a new key under 'TaskCache' when a new scheduled task is registered
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventType': u'SetValue', u'TargetObject|contains': u'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Schedule\TaskCache\Tree\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: New TaskCache Entry

author: Omer Yampel, Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using registry key manipulation of sdclt.exe (e.g. UACMe 53)
detection: {u'selection1': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'Software\Classes\exefile\shell\runas\command\isolatedCommand'}, u'condition': u'1 of selection*', u'selection2': {u'Details|contains': u'-1???\Software\Classes\', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\SymbolicLinkValue'}}
title: UAC Bypass via Sdclt

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using fodhelper.exe, computerdefaults.exe, slui.exe via registry keys (e.g. UACMe 33 or 62)
detection: {u'selection2': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'Classes\ms-settings\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute'}, u'selection3': {u'TargetObject|endswith': [u'Classes\ms-settings\shell\open\command\(Default)', u'Classes\exefile\shell\open\command\(Default)']}, u'filter_sel3': {u'Details': u'(Empty)'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2 or (selection3 and not filter_sel3)', u'selection1': {u'Details|contains': u'\Software\Classes\{', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'Classes\ms-settings\shell\open\command\SymbolicLinkValue'}}
title: UAC Bypass Using Registry Shell Open Keys

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects the volume shadow copy service initialization and processing. Registry keys such as HKLM\\System\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\VSS\\Diag\\VolSnap\\Volume are captured.
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\VSS\Start'}, u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\VSS'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Other services accessing that key or sub keys]
title: Volume Shadow Copy Service Keys

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: This rule detects that the path to the DLL written in the registry is different from the default one. Launched WAB.exe tries to load the DLL from Registry.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Details': u'%CommonProgramFiles%\System\wab32.dll'}, u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\Software\Microsoft\WAB\DLLPath'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Execution DLL of Choice Using WAB.EXE

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of UseLogonCredential from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to enable clear-text credentials
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'WDigest\UseLogonCredential'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Wdigest Enable UseLogonCredential

author: Karneades, Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects persistence registry keys
detection: {u'selection_reg1': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion']}, u'selection_reg2': [{u'TargetObject|contains|all': ['\\Image File Execution Options\\', '\\GlobalFlag']}, {u'TargetObject|contains|all': ['SilentProcessExit\\', '\\ReportingMode']}, {u'TargetObject|contains|all': ['SilentProcessExit\\', '\\MonitorProcess']}], u'condition': u'selection_reg1 and selection_reg2'}
title: Registry Persistence Mechanisms

author: Lednyov Alexey, oscd.community
description: Detects persistence method using windows telemetry
detection: {u'filter': {u'Details|contains': [u'\system32\CompatTelRunner.exe', u'\system32\DeviceCensus.exe']}, u'selection': {u'Details|contains': u'.exe', u'TargetObject|contains|all': [u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController\', u'\Command']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'category': u'registry_event', u'definition': u'Requirements: Sysmon config that monitors \SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController subkey of the HKLU hives', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Registry Persistence Mechanism via Windows Telemetry

author: @ScoubiMtl
description: Detects the modification of Outlook Security Setting to allow unprompted execution. Goes with win_outlook_c2_macro_creation.yml and is particularly interesting if both events occur near to each other.
detection: {u'selection_registry': {u'Details|contains': u'0x00000001', u'TargetObject': u'HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\16.0\Outlook\Security\Level'}, u'condition': u'selection_registry'}
title: Outlook C2 Registry Key

author: Tobias Michalski
description: Detects the manipulation of persistent URLs which could execute malicious code
detection: {u'selectionStamp': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'Stamp', u'Details': u'DWORD (0x00000001)'}, u'selectionUserDefined': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'UserDefinedUrl'}, u'selection1': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'Software\Microsoft\Office\', u'\Outlook\Today\']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and (selectionStamp or selectionUserDefined)'}
title: Persistent Outlook Landing Pages

author: Tobias Michalski
description: Detects the manipulation of persistent URLs which can be malicious
detection: {u'selection1': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'Software\Microsoft\Office\', u'Outlook\WebView\'], u'TargetObject|endswith': u'URL'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'Calendar', u'Inbox']}}
title: Persistent Outlook Landing Pages

author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)
description: Detects the modification of PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding. For command execution see rule win_netsh_port_fwd.yml.
detection: {u'selection_registry': {u'TargetObject': u'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\PortProxy\v4tov4\tcp'}, u'condition': u'selection_registry'}
falsepositives: [WSL2 network bridge PowerShell script used for WSL/Kubernetes/Docker (e.g. https://github.com/microsoft/WSL/issues/4150#issuecomment-504209723), Synergy Software KVM (https://symless.com/synergy)]
title: PortProxy Registry Key

author: Markus Neis, @markus_neis, Florian Roth
description: Detects static QMS 810 and mimikatz driver name used by Mimikatz as exploited in CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Control\Print\Environments\Windows x64\Drivers\Version-3\QMS 810\', u'\Control\Print\Environments\Windows x64\Drivers\Version-3\mimikatz']}, u'selection_print': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'\Control\Print\Environments', u'\CurrentVersion\Print\Printers']}, u'selection_kiwi': {u'TargetObject|contains': [u'Gentil Kiwi', u'mimikatz printer', u'Kiwi Legit Printer']}, u'condition': u'selection or selection_alt or (selection_print and selection_kiwi)', u'selection_alt': {u'TargetObject|contains|all': [u'legitprinter', u'\Control\Print\Environments\Windows']}}
falsepositives: [Legitimate installation of printer driver QMS 810, Texas Instruments microLaser printer (unlikely)]
title: PrinterNightmare Mimimkatz Driver Name

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects Azure Hybrid Connection Manager services querying the Azure service bus service
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': u'HybridConnectionManager', u'QueryName|contains': u'servicebus.windows.net'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of Azure Hybrid Connection Manager and the Azure Service Bus service]
title: DNS HybridConnectionManager Service Bus

author: Aaron Greetham (@beardofbinary) - NCC Group
description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains used for upload to MEGA.io
detection: {u'dns_request': {u'QueryName|contains': u'userstorage.mega.co.nz'}, u'condition': u'dns_request'}
title: DNS Query for MEGA.io Upload Domain

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: Detects several different DNS-answers by one domain with IPs from internal and external networks. Normally, DNS-answer contain TTL >100. (DNS-record will saved in host cache for a while TTL).
detection: {u'filter_int_ip': {u'QueryResults|startswith': [u'(::ffff:)?10.', u'(::ffff:)?192.168.', u'(::ffff:)?172.16.', u'(::ffff:)?172.17.', u'(::ffff:)?172.18.', u'(::ffff:)?172.19.', u'(::ffff:)?172.20.', u'(::ffff:)?172.21.', u'(::ffff:)?172.22.', u'(::ffff:)?172.23.', u'(::ffff:)?172.24.', u'(::ffff:)?172.25.', u'(::ffff:)?172.26.', u'(::ffff:)?172.27.', u'(::ffff:)?172.28.', u'(::ffff:)?172.29.', u'(::ffff:)?172.30.', u'(::ffff:)?172.31.', u'(::ffff:)?127.']}, u'dns_answer': {u'QueryStatus': u'0', u'QueryName': u'*'}, u'condition': u'(dns_answer and filter_int_ip) and (dns_answer and not filter_int_ip) | count(QueryName) by ComputerName > 3', u'timeframe': u'30s'}
title: Possible DNS Rebinding

author: Dmitriy Lifanov, oscd.community
description: Detects network connections and DNS queries initiated by Regsvr32.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Regsvr32 Network Activity

author: Florian Roth, @0xrawsec
description: Detects the creation of an ADS data stream that contains an executable (non-empty imphash)
detection: {u'filter1': {u'Imphash': u'00000000000000000000000000000000'}, u'condition': u'not 1 of filter*', u'filter2': {u'Imphash': None}}
logsource: {u'category': u'create_stream_hash', u'definition': u'Requirements: Sysmon config with Imphash logging activated', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Executable in ADS

author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Exports the target Registry key and hides it in the specified alternate data stream.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regedit.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Exports Registry Key To an Alternate Data Stream

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
detection: {u'download': [u'.DownloadFile(', u'.DownloadString('], u'webclient': [u'System.Net.WebClient'], u'condition': u'webclient and download'}
