falsepositives: [PowerShell scripts that download content from the Internet]
title: Suspicious PowerShell Download

author: Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
detection: {u'encoded': [u' -enc ', u' -EncodedCommand '], u'hidden': [u' -w hidden ', u' -window hidden ', u' -windowstyle hidden '], u'condition': u'all of them', u'noninteractive': [u' -noni ', u' -noninteractive ']}
falsepositives: [Penetration tests, Very special / sneaky PowerShell scripts]
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic

author: Florian Roth (rule), Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
detection: {u'iex_webclient': [u'iex', u'New-Object', u'Net.WebClient', u'.Download'], u'enc_selection': [u' -w ', u'hidden', u'-ep', u'bypass', u'-Enc'], u'reg_selection': [u'powershell', u'reg', u'add', u'HKCU\software\microsoft\windows\currentversion\run'], u'iex_selection': [u' -w ', u'hidden', u'-noni', u'-nop', u' -c ', u'iex', u'New-Object'], u'webclient_selection': [u'bypass', u'-noprofile', u'-windowstyle', u'hidden', u'new-object', u'system.net.webclient', u'.download'], u'condition': u'all of convert_b64 or all of iex_selection or all of enc_selection or all of reg_selection or all of webclient_selection or all of iex_webclient', u'convert_b64': [u'-nop', u' -w ', u'hidden', u' -c ', u'[Convert]::FromBase64String']}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled for 4104, Module Logging must be enabled for 4103', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'powershell'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, OSCD Community
description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
detection: {u'selection': [u'SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe'], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, OSCD Community
description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction

author: Sherif Eldeeb
description: Detects process access to LSASS which is typical for Mimikatz (0x1000 PROCESS_QUERY_ LIMITED_INFORMATION, 0x0400 PROCESS_QUERY_ INFORMATION "only old versions", 0x0010 PROCESS_VM_READ)
detection: {u'selection': {u'GrantedAccess': [u'0x1410', u'0x1010'], u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Some security products access LSASS in this way.]
title: Mimikatz Detection LSASS Access

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' /vss ', u' /y ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Esentutl Use

author: Florian Roth, Michael Haag
description: Detects suspicious commands that could be related to activity that uses volume shadow copy to steal and retrieve hashes from the NTDS.dit file remotely
detection:
{u'selection': {u'CommandLine': [u'vssadmin.exe Delete Shadows', u'vssadmin create shadow /for=C:', u'copy \?\GLOBALROOT\Device\*\windows
tds
tds.dit', u'copy \?\GLOBALROOT\Device\*\config\SAM', u'vssadmin delete shadows /for=C:', u'reg SAVE HKLM\SYSTEM ', u'esentutl.exe /y /vss *
tds.dit*', u'esentutl.exe /y /vss *\SAM', u'esentutl.exe /y /vss *\SYSTEM']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Activity Related to NTDS.dit Domain Hash Retrieval

author: Nik Seetharaman
description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains': u'cmlua.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate CMSTP use (unlikely in modern enterprise environments)]
tags: [attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1218.003, attack.t1191, attack.execution, attack.t1559.001, attack.t1175, attack.g0069, attack.g0080, car.2019-04-001]
title: CMSTP Execution Process Access

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects a typical pattern of a CobaltStrike BOF which inject into other processes
detection: {u'selection': {u'GrantedAccess': [u'0x1028', u'0x1fffff'], u'CallTrace|re': u'^C:\\\\Windows\\\\SYSTEM32\\\\ntdll\\.dll\+[a-z0-9]{4,6}\|C:\\\\Windows\\\\System32\\\\KERNELBASE\\.dll\+[a-z0-9]{4,6}\|UNKNOWN\([A-Z0-9]{16}\)$'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CobaltStrike BOF Injection Pattern

author: Florian Roth, Roberto Rodriguez, Dimitrios Slamaris, Mark Russinovich, Thomas Patzke, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Sherif Eldeeb, James Dickenson, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community (update)
description: Detects process access LSASS memory which is typical for credentials dumping tools
detection: {u'filter': {u'SourceImage|endswith': [u'\wmiprvse.exe', u'\taskmgr.exe', u'\procexp64.exe', u'\procexp.exe', u'\lsm.exe', u'\MsMpEng.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\vmtoolsd.exe']}, u'selection': {u'GrantedAccess|contains': [u'0x40', u'0x1000', u'0x1400', u'0x100000', u'0x1410', u'0x1010', u'0x1438', u'0x143a', u'0x1418', u'0x1f0fff', u'0x1f1fff', u'0x1f2fff', u'0x1f3fff'], u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate software accessing LSASS process for legitimate reason; update the whitelist with it]
title: Credentials Dumping Tools Accessing LSASS Memory

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the usage of the direct syscall of NtOpenProcess which might be done from a CobaltStrike BOF.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|startswith': u'UNKNOWN'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Direct Syscall of NtOpenProcess

author: Tim Burrell
description: Detects suspect access to svchost process memory such as that used by Invoke-Phantom to kill the winRM windows event logging service.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains': u'UNKNOWN', u'GrantedAccess': u'0x1F3FFF', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\WINDOWS\System32\svchost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspect Svchost Memory Asccess

author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects the access to processes by other suspicious processes which have reflectively loaded libraries in their memory space. An example is SilentTrinity C2 behaviour. Generally speaking, when Sysmon EventID 10 cannot reference a stack call to a dll loaded from disk (the standard way), it will display "UNKNOWN" as the module name. Usually this means the stack call points to a module that was reflectively loaded in memory. Adding to this, it is not common to see such few calls in the stack (ntdll.dll --> kernelbase.dll --> unknown) which essentially means that most of the functions required by the process to execute certain routines are already present in memory, not requiring any calls to external libraries. The latter should also be considered suspicious.
detection: {u'filter': {u'SourceImage|endswith': [u'\Windows\System32\sdiagnhost.exe']}, u'selection3': {u'CallTrace|contains': u'UNKNOWN', u'GrantedAccess': [u'0x1F0FFF', u'0x1F1FFF', u'0x143A', u'0x1410', u'0x1010', u'0x1F2FFF', u'0x1F3FFF', u'0x1FFFFF']}, u'selection1': {u'CallTrace|contains|all': [u'C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\ntdll.dll+', u'|C:\WINDOWS\System32\KERNELBASE.dll+', u'|UNKNOWN(', u')']}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2 or selection3 and not filter', u'selection2': {u'CallTrace|contains|all': [u'UNKNOWN(', u')|UNKNOWN('], u'CallTrace|endswith': u')'}}
title: Suspicious In-Memory Module Execution

author: Bhabesh Raj, Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects LSASS process access by LaZagne for credential dumping.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains|all': [u'C:\\Windows\\SYSTEM32\\ntdll.dll+', u'|C:\\Windows\\System32\\KERNELBASE.dll+', u'_ctypes.pyd+', u'python27.dll+'], u'GrantedAccess': u'0x1FFFFF', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Credential Dumping by LaZagne

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the process injection of a LittleCorporal generated Maldoc.
detection: {u'selection': {u'SourceImage|endswith': u'winword.exe', u'CallTrace|contains|all': [u':\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v2.', u'UNKNOWN']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: LittleCorporal Generated Maldoc Injection

author: oscd.community, Dmitry Uchakin
description: COM interface (EditionUpgradeManager) that is not used by standard executables.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains': u'editionupgrademanagerobj.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Load Undocumented Autoelevated COM Interface

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects adversaries leveraging the MiniDump export function from comsvcs.dll via rundll32 to perform a memory dump from lsass.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains': u'comsvcs.dll', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'SourceImage': u'C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Lsass Memory Dump via Comsvcs DLL

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects process LSASS memory dump using procdump or taskmgr based on the CallTrace pointing to dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll for win10
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains': [u'dbghelp.dll', u'dbgcore.dll'], u'GrantedAccess': u'0x1fffff', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: LSASS Memory Dump

author: John Lambert (tech), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects a process access to verclsid.exe that injects shellcode from a Microsoft Office application / VBA macro
detection: {u'combination2': {u'CallTrace|contains': u'|UNKNOWN', u'SourceImage|contains': u'\Microsoft Office\'}, u'combination1': {u'CallTrace|contains|all': [u'|UNKNOWN(', u'VBE7.DLL']}, u'selection': {u'GrantedAccess': u'0x1FFFFF', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\verclsid.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and 1 of combination*'}
logsource: {u'category': u'process_access', u'definition': u'Use the following config to generate the necessary Event ID 10 Process Access events: <ProcessAccess onmatch="include"><CallTrace condition="contains">VBE7.DLL</CallTrace></ProcessAccess><ProcessAccess onmatch="exclude"><CallTrace condition="excludes">UNKNOWN</CallTrace></ProcessAccess>', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Malware Shellcode in Verclsid Target Process

author: Patryk Prauze - ING Tech
description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'SourceImage': u'C:\Windows\system32\wsmprovhost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.credential_access, attack.execution, attack.t1003.001, attack.t1003, attack.t1059.001, attack.t1086, attack.lateral_movement, attack.t1021.006, attack.t1028, attack.s0002]
title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects LSASS process access by pypykatz for credential dumping.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CallTrace|contains|all': [u'C:\Windows\SYSTEM32\ntdll.dll+', u'C:\Windows\System32\KERNELBASE.dll+', u'libffi-7.dll', u'_ctypes.pyd+', u'python3*.dll+'], u'GrantedAccess': u'0x1FFFFF', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Credential Dumping by Pypykatz

author: Florent Labouyrie
description: Detects when a process, such as mimikatz, accesses the memory of svchost to dump credentials
detection: {u'filter_trusted_process_access': {u'SourceImage|endswith': [u'*\services.exe', u'*\msiexec.exe']}, u'selection_process': {u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\svchost.exe'}, u'selection_memory': {u'GrantedAccess': u'0x143a'}, u'condition': u'selection_process and selection_memory and not filter_trusted_process_access'}
title: SVCHOST Credential Dump

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a WoW64 logger DLL hijack (UACMe 30)
detection: {u'selection': {u'SourceImage|contains': u':\Windows\SysWOW64\', u'GrantedAccess': u'0x1fffff', u'CallTrace|startswith': u'UNKNOWN(0000000000000000)|UNKNOWN(0000000000000000)|'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using WOW64 Logger DLL Hijack

author: Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades), Markus Neis
description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from WinRM host process
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': [u'*\cmd.exe', u'*\sh.exe', u'*\bash.exe', u'*\powershell.exe', u'*\schtasks.exe', u'*\certutil.exe', u'*\whoami.exe', u'*\bitsadmin.exe'], u'ParentImage': u'*\wsmprovhost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by WinRM

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects Accessing to lsass.exe by Powershell
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [8, 10], u'SourceImage|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'TargetImage|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Accessing WinAPI in PowerShell for Credentials Dumping

author: frack113
description: Someone try to hide from Sysmon
detection: {u'selection_error': {u'Description|contains': [u'Failed to open service configuration with error', u'Failed to connect to the driver to update configuration']}, u'condition': u'selection_error'}
title: Sysmon Configuration Error

author: frack113
description: Someone try to hide from Sysmon
detection: {u'selection_conf': [u'Sysmon config state changed'], u'condition': u'selection_stop or selection_conf', u'selection_stop': {u'State': u'Stopped'}}
title: Sysmon Configuration Modification

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR), wagga
description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `iertutil.dll` in the `C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\` directory over the network and loading it for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.
detection: {u'selection_two': {u'EventID': 7, u'Image|endswith': u'\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\Internet Explorer\iertutil.dll'}, u'selection_one': {u'EventID': 11, u'Image': u'System', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\Internet Explorer\iertutil.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection_one or selection_two'}
title: T1021 DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'msdtc.exe', u'ImageLoaded': u'C:\Windows\oci.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Pingback Backdoor

author: Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community
description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use
detection: {u'selection': {u'Description|contains': u'st2stager'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wmiprvse.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\wbem\wbemcomn.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative
description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\tttracer.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage

author: Den Iuzvyk
description: Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser. An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user.
detection: {u'filter_legit': {u'Image|endswith': [u'BackgroundTaskHost.exe', u'devenv.exe', u'iexplore.exe', u'MicrosoftEdge.exe']}, u'selection_dll': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'MicrosoftAccountTokenProvider.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection_dll and not filter_legit'}
title: Abusing Azure Browser SSO

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe'}, u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': u'System.Management.Automation', u'Description': u'System.Management.Automation'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Alternate PowerShell Hosts

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects DLL image load activity as used by FoggyWeb backdoor loader
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\ADFS\version.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: FoggyWeb Backdoor DLL Loading

author: Tom Kern, oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects loading of essential DLL used by PowerShell, but not by the process powershell.exe. Detects meterpreter's "load powershell" extension.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\powershell_ise.exe', u'\WINDOWS\System32\sdiagnhost.exe', u'\mscorsvw.exe', u'\WINDOWS\System32\RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe', u'\sqlps.exe', u'\wsmprovhost.exe', u'\winrshost.exe', u'\syncappvpublishingserver.exe', u'\runscripthelper.exe', u'\ServerManager.exe']}, u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\System.Management.Automation.Dll', u'\System.Management.Automation.ni.Dll']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Used by some .NET binaries, minimal on user workstation.]
title: In-memory PowerShell

author: sigma
description: Detects certain DLL loads when Mimikatz gets executed
detection: {u'dllload1': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\vaultcli.dll'}, u'dllload2': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\wlanapi.dll'}, u'exclusion': {u'ImageLoaded': [u'ntdsapi.dll', u'netapi32.dll', u'imm32.dll', u'samlib.dll', u'combase.dll', u'srvcli.dll', u'shcore.dll', u'ntasn1.dll', u'cryptdll.dll', u'logoncli.dll']}, u'timeframe': u'30s', u'condition': u'selector | near dllload1 and dllload2 and not exclusion', u'selector': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe'}}
title: Mimikatz In-Memory

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects processes loading modules related to PCRE.NET package
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\ba9ea7344a4a5f591d6e5dc32a13494b\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PCRE.NET Package Image Load

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects execution of PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': u'System.Management.Automation', u'Description': u'System.Management.Automation'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell Execution

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects signs of the WMI script host process %SystemRoot%\system32\wbem\scrcons.exe functionality being used via images being loaded by a process.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\scrcons.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\vbscript.dll', u'\wbemdisp.dll', u'\wshom.ocx', u'\scrrun.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WMI Script Host Process Image Loaded

author: FPT.EagleEye, Thomas Patzke (improvements)
description: Detect DLL Load from Spooler Service backup folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'spoolsv.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'.dll', u'ImageLoaded|contains': u'\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\x64\3\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious Binary Load

author: Perez Diego (@darkquassar), oscd.community, Ecco
description: Detects the load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL (used to make memory dumps) by suspicious processes. Tools like ProcessHacker and some attacker tradecract use MiniDumpWriteDump API found in dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll. As an example, SilentTrynity C2 Framework has a module that leverages this API to dump the contents of Lsass.exe and transfer it over the network back to the attacker's machine.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|contains': u'Visual Studio'}, u'signedprocess': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\msbuild.exe', u'\cmd.exe', u'\svchost.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\word.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\outlook.exe', u'\monitoringhost.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\bash.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\schtasks.exe', u'\dnx.exe', u'\regsvcs.exe', u'\sc.exe', u'\scriptrunner.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\dbghelp.dll', u'\dbgcore.dll']}, u'unsignedprocess': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\dbghelp.dll', u'\dbgcore.dll'], u'Signed': u'FALSE'}, u'condition': u'(signedprocess and not filter) or (unsignedprocess and not filter)'}
title: Load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL from Suspicious Process

author: NVISO
description: The Fax service attempts to load ualapi.dll, which is non-existent. An attacker can then (side)load their own malicious DLL using this service.
detection: {u'filter': {u'ImageLoaded|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\WinSxS\']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'fxssvc.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'ualapi.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Fax Service DLL Search Order Hijack

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects Loading of samlib.dll, WinSCard.dll from untypical process e.g. through process hollowing by Mimikatz
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\notepad.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\samlib.dll', u'\WinSCard.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Possible Process Hollowing Image Loading

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Detects any assembly DLL being loaded by an Office Product
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\assembly\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: dotNET DLL Loaded Via Office Applications

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an Office Product
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|contains': [u'\clr.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: CLR DLL Loaded Via Office Applications

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Detects any GAC DLL being loaded by an Office Product
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\assembly\GAC_MSIL']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: GAC DLL Loaded Via Office Applications

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Detects DSParse DLL being loaded by an Office Product
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|contains': [u'\dsparse.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: Active Directory Parsing DLL Loaded Via Office Applications

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Detects Kerberos DLL being loaded by an Office Product
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\kerberos.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: Active Directory Kerberos DLL Loaded Via Office Applications

author: Patrick St. John, OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects the image load of Python Core indicative of a Python script bundled with Py2Exe.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Description': u'Python Core'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Python Py2Exe Image Load

author: omkar72, oscd.community
description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an scripting applications
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\mshta.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\clr.dll', u'\mscoree.dll', u'\mscorlib.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CLR DLL Loaded Via Scripting Applications

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for processes loading System.Drawing.ni.dll. This could be an indicator of potential Screen Capture.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\WmiPrvSE.exe'}, u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\System.Drawing.ni.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious System.Drawing Load

author: Antonlovesdnb
description: Detects DLL's Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\VBE7.DLL', u'\VBEUI.DLL', u'\VBE7INTL.DLL']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Alerts on legitimate macro usage as well, will need to filter as appropriate]
title: VBA DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word

author: Michael R. (@nahamike01)
description: Detects DLL's Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros Executing WMI Commands
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\outlook.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\wmiutils.dll', u'\wbemcomn.dll', u'\wbemprox.dll', u'\wbemdisp.dll', u'\wbemsvc.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Management Instrumentation DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word

author: SBousseaden
description: IKEEXT and SessionEnv service, as they call LoadLibrary on files that do not exist within C:\Windows\System32\ by default. An attacker can place their malicious logic within the PROCESS_ATTACH block of their library and restart the aforementioned services "svchost.exe -k netsvcs" to gain code execution on a remote machine.
detection: {u'filter': {u'ImageLoaded|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\WinSxS\']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\svchost.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\tsmsisrv.dll', u'\tsvipsrv.dll', u'\wlbsctrl.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Svchost DLL Search Order Hijack

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative
description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\ttdrecord.dll', u'\ttdwriter.dll', u'\ttdloader.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage

author: oscd.community, Dmitry Uchakin
description: Attempts to load dismcore.dll after dropping it
detection: {u'filter': {u'ImageLoaded': [u'C:\Windows\System32\Dism\dismcore.dll']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\dism.exe'], u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\dismcore.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Pentests, Actions of a legitimate telnet client]
title: UAC Bypass With Fake DLL

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects potential use of UIPromptForCredentials functions by looking for some of the DLLs needed for it.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'ImageLoaded|endswith': ['\\credui.dll', '\\wincredui.dll']}, {u'OriginalFileName': ['credui.dll', 'wincredui.dll']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [other legitimate processes loading those DLLs in your environment.]
title: UIPromptForCredentials DLLs

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'Signed': u'false'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects threat actors proxy executing code and bypassing application controls by leveraging wmic and the `/FORMAT` argument switch to download and execute an XSL file (i.e js, vbs, etc).
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wmic.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\jscript.dll', u'\vbscript.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Apparently, wmic os get lastboottuptime loads vbscript.dll]
title: WMIC Loading Scripting Libraries

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects non wmiprvse loading WMI modules
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\WmiPrvSE.exe', u'\WmiApSrv.exe', u'\svchost.exe', u'\DeviceCensus.exe', u'\CompatTelRunner.exe', u'\sdiagnhost.exe', u'\SIHClient.exe', u'\ngentask.exe', u'\windows\system32\taskhostw.exe', u'\windows\system32\MoUsoCoreWorker.exe', u'\windows\system32\wbem\WMIADAP.exe']}, u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\wmiclnt.dll', u'\WmiApRpl.dll', u'\wmiprov.dll', u'\wmiutils.dll', u'\wbemcomn.dll', u'\wbemprox.dll', u'\WMINet_Utils.dll', u'\wbemsvc.dll', u'\fastprox.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: WMI Modules Loaded

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects WMI command line event consumers
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\wbemcons.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unknown (data set is too small; further testing needed)]
title: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects signs of potential use of the WSMAN provider from uncommon processes locally and remote execution.
detection: {u'filter_ps': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe'}, u'respond_server': {u'Image|endswith': u'\svchost.exe', u'OriginalFileName': u'WsmWmiPl.dll'}, u'condition': u'(request_client and not filter_ps) or respond_server', u'request_client': [{u'ImageLoaded|endswith': ['\\WsmSvc.dll', '\\WsmAuto.dll', '\\Microsoft.WSMan.Management.ni.dll']}, {u'OriginalFileName': ['WsmSvc.dll', 'WSMANAUTOMATION.DLL', 'Microsoft.WSMan.Management.dll']}]}
title: Suspicious WSMAN Provider Image Loads

author: Markus Neis, @markus_neis
description: Detects the image load of vss_ps.dll by uncommon executables using OriginalFileName datapoint
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|contains': u'c:\windows\', u'Image|endswith': [u'\svchost.exe', u'\msiexec.exe', u'\vssvc.exe', u'\srtasks.exe', u'\tiworker.exe', u'\dllhost.exe', u'\searchindexer.exe', u'dismhost.exe', u'taskhostw.exe', u'\clussvc.exe']}, u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|endswith': [u'\vss_ps.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Image Load of VSS_PS.dll by Uncommon Executable

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects an image load pattern as seen when a tool named PRIVATELOG is used and rarely observed under legitimate circumstances
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\svchost.exe', u'ImageLoaded|endswith': u'\clfsw32.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: APT PRIVATELOG Image Load Pattern

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Raw disk access using illegitimate tools, possible defence evasion
detection: {u'filter_1': {u'Device|contains': u'floppy'}, u'filter_2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\wmiprvse.exe', u'\sdiagnhost.exe', u'\searchindexer.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\defrag.exe', u'\smss.exe', u'\vssvc.exe', u'\compattelrunner.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\autochk.exe', u'\taskhost.exe', u'\dfsrs.exe', u'\vds.exe', u'\lsass.exe']}, u'condition': u'not filter_1 and not filter_2'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator using tool for raw access or ongoing forensic investigation]
title: Raw Disk Access Using Illegitimate Tools

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC
description:
This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key of Azure AD Health monitoring agent.
This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Online\Reporting\MonitoringAgent.
detection: {u'filter': {u'ProcessName|contains': [u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.DiagnosticsAgent.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.InsightsService.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.MonitoringAgent.Startup.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.PshSurrogate.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Common.Clients.ResourceMonitor.exe']}, u'selection': {u'EventID': [4656, 4663], u'ObjectName': u'\REGISTRY\MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Online\Reporting\MonitoringAgent', u'ObjectType': u'Key'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Azure AD Health Monitoring Agent Registry Keys Access

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC
description:
This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key values and sub-keys of Azure AD Health service agents (e.g AD FS).
Information from AD Health service agents can be used to potentially abuse some of the features provided by those services in the cloud (e.g. Federation).
This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object: HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\ADHealthAgent.
Make sure you set the SACL to propagate to its sub-keys.
detection: {u'filter': {u'ProcessName|contains': [u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.DiagnosticsAgent.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.InsightsService.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.MonitoringAgent.Startup.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Adfs.PshSurrogate.exe', u'Microsoft.Identity.Health.Common.Clients.ResourceMonitor.exe']}, u'selection': {u'EventID': [4656, 4663], u'ObjectName': u'\REGISTRY\MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\ADHealthAgent', u'ObjectType': u'Key'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Azure AD Health Service Agents Registry Keys Access

author: Samir Bousseaden; Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g; oscd.community
description: backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5136, u'AttributeValue|contains': [u'1131f6ad-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2', u'1131f6aa-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2', u'89e95b76-444d-4c62-991a-0facbeda640c'], u'AttributeLDAPDisplayName': u'ntSecurityDescriptor'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [New Domain Controller computer account, check user SIDs within the value attribute of event 5136 and verify if it's a regular user or DC computer account.]
title: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs
detection: {u'selection_object': [{u'ObjectName|endswith': ['-512', '-502', '-500', '-505', '-519', '-520', '-544', '-551', '-555']}, {u'ObjectName|contains': u'admin'}], u'selection': {u'EventID': 4661, u'ObjectType': [u'SAM_USER', u'SAM_GROUP']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_object'}
falsepositives: [if source account name is not an admin then its super suspicious]
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: enable Object Access SAM on your Domain Controllers', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance

author: juju4
description: Detect remote login by Administrator user (depending on internal pattern).
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4624, u'LogonType': 10, u'AuthenticationPackageName': u'Negotiate', u'TargetUserName|startswith': u'Admin'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Identifiable administrators usernames (pattern or special unique character. ex: "Admin-*"), internal policy mandating use only as secondary account', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Admin User Remote Logon

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects access to $ADMIN share
detection: {u'filter': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 5140, u'ShareName': u'Admin$'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Access to ADMIN$ Share

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects WRITE_DAC access to a domain object
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4662, u'ObjectServer': u'DS', u'AccessMask': u'0x40000', u'ObjectType': [u'19195a5b-6da0-11d0-afd3-00c04fd930c9', u'domainDNS']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: AD Object WriteDAC Access

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects potential abuse of Active Directory Replication Service (ADRS) from a non machine account to request credentials.
detection: {u'filter': [{u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, {u'SubjectUserName|startswith': u'MSOL_'}], u'selection': {u'EventID': 4662, u'AccessMask': u'0x100', u'Properties|contains': [u'1131f6aa-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2', u'1131f6ad-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2', u'89e95b76-444d-4c62-991a-0facbeda640c']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Active Directory Replication from Non Machine Account

author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut)
description: Detects access to a domain user from a non-machine account
detection: {u'filter': [{u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, {u'SubjectUserName|startswith': u'MSOL_'}], u'selection': {u'EventID': 4662, u'ObjectType|contains': u'bf967aba-0de6-11d0-a285-00aa003049e2'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requires the "Read all properties" permission on the user object to be audited for the "Everyone" principal', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: AD User Enumeration

author: @neu5ron
description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.
detection: {u'keywords': {u'PrivilegeList|contains': [u'SeEnableDelegationPrivilege']}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4704}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Policy Change > Audit Authorization Policy Change, Group Policy : Computer Configuration\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\Audit Policies\Policy Change\Audit Authorization Policy Change', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects

author: @neu5ron
description: Detects scenarios where one can control another users or computers account without having to use their credentials.
detection: {u'selection4': {u'EventID': 5136, u'AttributeLDAPDisplayName': u'msDS-AllowedToActOnBehalfOfOtherIdentity'}, u'filter1': {u'AllowedToDelegateTo': u'-'}, u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4738}, u'selection2': {u'EventID': 5136, u'AttributeLDAPDisplayName': u'msDS-AllowedToDelegateTo'}, u'selection3': {u'EventID': 5136, u'ObjectClass': u'user', u'AttributeLDAPDisplayName': u'servicePrincipalName'}, u'condition': u'(selection1 and not filter1 and not filter_null) or selection2 or selection3 or selection4', u'filter_null': {u'AllowedToDelegateTo': None}}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Account Management > Audit User Account Management, Group Policy : Computer Configuration\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\Audit Policies\Account Management\Audit User Account Management, DS Access > Audit Directory Service Changes, Group Policy : Computer Configuration\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\Audit Policies\DS Access\Audit Directory Service Changes', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Active Directory User Backdoors

author: @neu5ron
description: Detects scenario where weak encryption is enabled for a user profile which could be used for hash/password cracking.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4738}, u'newuac_des': {u'NewUacValue|endswith': [u'8???', u'9???', u'A???', u'B???', u'C???', u'D???', u'E???', u'F???']}, u'newuac_encrypted': {u'NewUacValue|endswith': [u'8??', u'9??', u'A??', u'B??', u'C??', u'D??', u'E??', u'F??']}, u'olduac_preauth': {u'OldUacValue|endswith': [u'1????', u'3????', u'5????', u'7????', u'9????', u'B????', u'D????', u'F????']}, u'olduac_des': {u'OldUacValue|endswith': [u'8???', u'9???', u'A???', u'B???', u'C???', u'D???', u'E???', u'F???']}, u'olduac_encrypted': {u'OldUacValue|endswith': [u'8??', u'9??', u'A??', u'B??', u'C??', u'D??', u'E??', u'F??']}, u'newuac_preauth': {u'NewUacValue|endswith': [u'1????', u'3????', u'5????', u'7????', u'9????', u'B????', u'D????', u'F????']}, u'condition': u'selection and ((newuac_des and not olduac_des) or (newuac_preauth and not olduac_preauth) or (newuac_encrypted and not olduac_encrypted))'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Account Management > Audit User Account Management, Group Policy : Computer Configuration\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\Audit Policies\Account Management\Audit User Account Management', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Weak Encryption Enabled and Kerberoast

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects Access to LSASS Process
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1121, u'Path|endswith': u'\lsass.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Google Chrome GoogleUpdate.exe, Some Taskmgr.exe related activity]
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements:Enabled Block credential stealing from the Windows local security authority subsystem (lsass.exe) from Attack Surface Reduction (GUID: 9e6c4e1f-7d60-472f-ba1a-a39ef669e4b2)', u'product': u'windows_defender'}
title: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction

author: Florian Roth
description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)
detection: {u'keywords': [u'\mimikatz', u'mimikatz.exe', u'\mimilib.dll', u'<3 eo.oe', u'eo.oe.kiwi', u'privilege::debug', u'sekurlsa::logonpasswords', u'lsadump::sam', u'mimidrv.sys', u' p::d ', u' s::l ', u'gentilkiwi.com', u'Kiwi Legit Printer'], u'condition': u'keywords'}
falsepositives: [Naughty administrators, Penetration test, AV Signature updates, Files with Mimikatz in their filename]
tags: [attack.s0002, attack.t1003, attack.lateral_movement, attack.credential_access, car.2013-07-001, car.2019-04-004, attack.t1003.002, attack.t1003.004, attack.t1003.001, attack.t1003.006]
title: Mimikatz Use

author: Florian Roth
description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4776, u'Workstation': u'RULER'}, u'condition': u'(1 of selection*)', u'selection2': {u'EventID': [4624, 4625], u'WorkstationName': u'RULER'}}
falsepositives: [Go utilities that use staaldraad awesome NTLM library]
tags: [attack.discovery, attack.execution, attack.t1087, attack.t1075, attack.t1114, attack.t1059, attack.t1550.002]
title: Hacktool Ruler

author: Pushkarev Dmitry
description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [8004, 8007]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [need tuning applocker or add exceptions in SIEM]
fields: [PolicyName, RuleId, RuleName, TargetUser, TargetProcessId, FilePath, FileHash, Fqbn]
tags: [attack.execution, attack.t1086, attack.t1064, attack.t1204, attack.t1035, attack.t1204.002, attack.t1059.001, attack.t1059.003, attack.t1059.005, attack.t1059.006, attack.t1059.007]
title: File Was Not Allowed To Run

author: Florian Roth
description: This method detects a service install of malicious services mentioned in Carbon Paper - Turla report by ESET
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceName': [u'srservice', u'ipvpn', u'hkmsvc']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Turla Service Install

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018
detection: {u'selection_service': {u'EventID': 4698, u'TaskName': [u'SC Scheduled Scan', u'UpdatMachine']}, u'condition': u'selection_service'}
tags: [attack.persistence, attack.g0049, attack.t1053, attack.t1053.005, attack.s0111, attack.t1050, attack.t1543.003, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1112, attack.command_and_control, attack.t1071, attack.t1071.004]
title: Chafer Activity

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018
detection: {u'selection_service': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceName': [u'SC Scheduled Scan', u'UpdatMachine']}, u'condition': u'selection_service'}
tags: [attack.persistence, attack.g0049, attack.t1053, attack.t1053.005, attack.s0111, attack.t1050, attack.t1543.003, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1112, attack.command_and_control, attack.t1071, attack.t1071.004]
title: Chafer Activity

author: Tim Burrell
description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.
detection: {u'c2_selection': {u'EventID': 257, u'QNAME': [u'asyspy256.ddns.net', u'hotkillmail9sddcc.ddns.net', u'rosaf112.ddns.net', u'cvdfhjh1231.myftp.biz', u'sz2016rose.ddns.net', u'dffwescwer4325.myftp.biz', u'cvdfhjh1231.ddns.net']}, u'condition': u'c2_selection'}
title: GALLIUM Artefacts

author: Florian Roth, Bartlomiej Czyz (@bczyz1)
description: Detects the deactivation and disabling of the Scheduled defragmentation task as seen by Slingshot APT group
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4701, u'TaskName': u'\Microsoft\Windows\Defrag\ScheduledDefrag'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Audit Other Object Access Events > Success', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Defrag Deactivation

author: Florian Roth
description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceFileName|endswith': u' LocalService', u'ServiceName': u'NtsSrv'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: StoneDrill Service Install

author: Florian Roth
description: This method detects malicious services mentioned in Turla PNG dropper report by NCC Group in November 2018
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceName': u'WerFaultSvc'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Turla PNG Dropper Service

author: Florian Roth, frack113
description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4799, u'TargetUserName|startswith': u'Administr', u'CallerProcessName|endswith': u'\checkadmin.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrators that use checkadmin.exe tool to enumerate local administrators]
tags: [attack.discovery, attack.t1012, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1036.004, attack.t1036, attack.t1027, attack.execution, attack.t1053.005, attack.t1053, attack.t1059.001, attack.t1086]
title: Operation Wocao Activity

author: Sreeman
description: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.
detection: {u'filter': {u'FilePath|contains': u'immersivecontrolpanel'}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'.SettingContent-ms'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms

author: Sreeman
description: Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office.We are able to abuse “AppVLP” to execute shell commands. Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but we can use it as an abuse binary to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder or to mark a file as a system file
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|re': u'(?i).*appvlp.exe.*(cmd.exe|powershell.exe).*(.sh|.exe|.dll|.bin|.bat|.cmd|.js|.msh|.reg|.scr|.ps|.vb|.jar|.pl|.inf)'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Using AppVLP To Circumvent ASR File Path Rule

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName': u'atsvc', u'Accesses|contains': u'WriteData'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-Audit-CVE'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.execution, attack.t1203, attack.privilege_escalation, attack.t1068, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1211, attack.credential_access, attack.t1212, attack.lateral_movement, attack.t1210, attack.impact, attack.t1499.004]
title: Audit CVE Event

author: Florian Roth
description: This detection method points out highly relevant Antivirus events
detection: {u'keywords': [u'HTool-', u'Hacktool', u'ASP/Backdoor', u'JSP/Backdoor', u'PHP/Backdoor', u'Backdoor.ASP', u'Backdoor.JSP', u'Backdoor.PHP', u'Webshell', u'Portscan', u'Mimikatz', u'WinCred', u'PlugX', u'Korplug', u'Pwdump', u'Chopper', u'WmiExec', u'Xscan', u'Clearlog', u'ASPXSpy'], u'filter': [u'Keygen', u'Crack'], u'condition': u'keywords and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Some software piracy tools (key generators, cracks) are classified as hack tools]
title: Relevant Anti-Virus Event

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Potential adversaries accessing the microphone and webcam in an endpoint.
detection: {u'selection3': {u'ObjectName|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\webcam\NonPackaged'}, u'selection1': {u'EventID': [4657, 4656, 4663]}, u'condition': u'selection1 and (selection2 or selection3)', u'selection2': {u'ObjectName|contains': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\CapabilityAccessManager\ConsentStore\microphone\NonPackaged'}}
title: Processes Accessing the Microphone and Webcam

author: Florian Roth, Wojciech Lesicki
description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement
detection: {u'selection4': {u'ImagePath|base64offset|contains': u'IEX (New-Object Net.Webclient).DownloadString('http://127.0.0.1:'}, u'selection_id': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'selection1': {u'ImagePath|contains|all': [u'ADMIN$', u'.exe']}, u'selection2': {u'ImagePath|contains|all': [u'%COMSPEC%', u'start', u'powershell']}, u'selection3': {u'ImagePath|contains': u'powershell -nop -w hidden -encodedcommand'}, u'condition': u'selection_id and (selection1 or selection2 or selection3 or selection4)'}
title: CobaltStrike Service Installations

author: OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName': u'spoolss'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Domain Controllers acting as printer servers too? :)]
title: DCERPC SMB Spoolss Named Pipe

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)
description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `iertutil.dll` in the `C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\` directory over the network for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.
detection: {u'filter': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName|endswith': u'\Internet Explorer\iertutil.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: T1021 DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack

author: Benjamin Delpy, Florian Roth, Scott Dermott
description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4662, u'Properties|contains': [u'Replicating Directory Changes All', u'1131f6ad-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2']}, u'filter1': {u'SubjectDomainName': u'Window Manager'}, u'filter3': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter1 and not filter2 and not filter3', u'filter2': {u'SubjectUserName|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY', u'MSOL_']}}
falsepositives: [Valid DC Sync that is not covered by the filters; please report, Local Domain Admin account used for Azure AD Connect]
title: Mimikatz DC Sync

author: @neu5ron
description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off "Local Group Policy Object Processing" via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as "gpedit.msc". Please note, that disabling "Local Group Policy Object Processing" may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications -- however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4719, u'AuditPolicyChanges|contains': [u'%%8448', u'%%8450']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Computer Management > Audit Policy Configuration, Group Policy : Computer Configuration\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\Audit Policies\Policy Change\Audit Authorization Policy Change', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Disabling Windows Event Auditing

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4662, u'AccessMask': u'0x2', u'ObjectName': u'BCKUPKEY', u'ObjectType': u'SecretObject'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4692}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4657, u'ObjectName|endswith': u'\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework', u'ObjectValueName': u'ETWEnabled', u'NewValue': u'0'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: COMPlus_ETWEnabled Registry Modification

author: Saw Winn Naung
description: Checks for event id 1102 which indicates the security event log was cleared.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1102, u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-Eventlog'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Security Event Log Cleared

author: Tobias Michalski
description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent
detection: {u'selection': [u'Install-TransportAgent'], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [legitimate installations of exchange TransportAgents. AssemblyPath is a good indicator for this.]
title: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation

author: Florian Roth, KevTheHermit, fuzzyf10w
description: Detects events of driver load errors in print service logs that could be a sign of successful exploitation attempts of print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675
detection: {u'keywords': [u'The print spooler failed to load a plug-in module', u'MyExploit.dll', u'evil.dll', u'\addCube.dll', u'\rev.dll', u'\rev2.dll', u'\main64.dll', u'\mimilib.dll', u'\mimispool.dll'], u'selection': {u'EventID': [808, 4909], u'ErrorCode': [u'0x45A', u'0x7e']}, u'condition': u'selection or keywords'}
title: Possible CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects driver load events print service operational log that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675
detection: {u'keywords': [u'UNIDRV.DLL, kernelbase.dll, ', u' 123 ', u' 1234 ', u'mimispool'], u'selection': {u'EventID': u'316'}, u'condition': u'selection and keywords'}
title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation

author: INIT_6
description: Detects remote printer driver load from Detailed File Share in Security logs that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': u'5145', u'ShareName': u'\\\*\IPC$', u'AccessMask': u'0x3', u'RelativeTargetName': u'spoolss', u'ObjectType': u'File'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation IPC Access

author: Keith Wright
description: Detects external diskdrives or plugged in USB devices , EventID 6416 on windows 10 or later
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 6416, u'ClassName': u'DiskDrive'}, u'selection2': {u'DeviceDescription': u'USB Mass Storage Device'}, u'condition': u'selection or selection2'}
title: External Disk Drive Or USB Storage Device

author: Chakib Gzenayi (@Chak092), Hosni Mribah
description: Detects enumeration of the global catalog (that can be performed using BloodHound or others AD reconnaissance tools). Adjust Threshold according to domain width.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5156, u'DestinationPort': [3268, 3269]}, u'condition': u'selection | count() by SourceAddress > 2000', u'timeframe': u'1h'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Windows Filtering Platform > Filtering Platform Connection" must be configured for Success', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Enumeration via the Global Catalog

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\SYSVOL', u'Accesses|contains': [u'WriteData', u'%%4417'], u'RelativeTargetName|endswith': u'ScheduledTasks.xml'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [if the source IP is not localhost then it's super suspicious, better to monitor both local and remote changes to GPO scheduledtasks]
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task

author: Omer Faruk Celik
description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation
detection: {u'service_installation': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceFileName|endswith': u'\execute.bat', u'ServiceName': u'BTOBTO'}, u'condition': u'service_installation'}
title: smbexec.py Service Installation

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the creation of a local hidden user account which should not happen for event ID 4720.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4720, u'TargetUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Hidden Local User Creation

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service installation.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697, u'ServiceFileName|contains': u'HybridConnectionManager', u'ServiceName': u'HybridConnectionManager'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of Hybrid Connection Manager via Azure function apps.]
title: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service running on an endpoint.
detection: {u'keywords': [u'HybridConnection', u'sb://', u'servicebus.windows.net', u'HybridConnectionManage'], u'selection': {u'EventID': [40300, 40301, 40302]}, u'condition': u'selection and keywords'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of Hybrid Connection Manager via Azure function apps.]
title: HybridConnectionManager Service Running

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects execution of Impacket's psexec.py.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName|contains': [u'RemCom_stdint', u'RemCom_stdoutt', u'RemCom_stderrt']}, u'condition': u'selection1'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Impacket PsExec Execution

author: Samir Bousseaden, wagga
description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\ADMIN$', u'RelativeTargetName|contains|all': [u'SYSTEM32\', u'.tmp']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+clip(?:\.exe)?.{0,4}&&.+clipboard]::\(\s\\\"\{\d\}.+\-f.+\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+clip(?:\.exe)?.{0,4}&&.+clipboard]::\(\s\\\"\{\d\}.+\-f.+\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher

author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community
description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block — https://github.com/danielbohannon/Invoke-Obfuscation/blob/master/Out-ObfuscatedStringCommand.ps1#L873-L888
detection: {u'selection_1': [{u'ImagePath|re': u'\$PSHome\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$PSHome\['}, {u'ImagePath|re': u'\$ShellId\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$ShellId\['}, {u'ImagePath|re': u'\$env:Public\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$env:Public\['}, {u'ImagePath|re': u'\$env:ComSpec\[(\s*\d{1,3}\s*,){2}'}, {u'ImagePath|re': u'\\*mdr\*\W\s*\)\.Name'}, {u'ImagePath|re': u'\$VerbosePreference\.ToString\('}, {u'ImagePath|re': u'\String\]\s*\$VerbosePreference'}], u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_1'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation

author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community
description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block — https://github.com/danielbohannon/Invoke-Obfuscation/blob/master/Out-ObfuscatedStringCommand.ps1#L873-L888
detection: {u'selection_1': [{u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\$PSHome\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$PSHome\['}, {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\$ShellId\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$ShellId\['}, {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\$env:Public\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$env:Public\['}, {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\$env:ComSpec\[(\s*\d{1,3}\s*,){2}'}, {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\\*mdr\*\W\s*\)\.Name'}, {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\$VerbosePreference\.ToString\('}, {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'\String\]\s*\$VerbosePreference'}], u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_1'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+powershell.+(?:\$\{?input\}?|noexit).+\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+powershell.+(?:\$\{?input\}?|noexit).+\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r)(?:\s|)\"set\s[a-zA-Z]{3,6}.*(?:\{\d\}){1,}\\\"\s+?\-f(?:.*\)){1,}.*\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r)(?:\s|)\"set\s[a-zA-Z]{3,6}.*(?:\{\d\}){1,}\\\"\s+?\-f(?:.*\)){1,}.*\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*new-object.*(?:system\.io\.compression\.deflatestream|system\.io\.streamreader).*text\.encoding\]::ascii.*readtoend'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*new-object.*(?:system\.io\.compression\.deflatestream|system\.io\.streamreader).*text\.encoding\]::ascii.*readtoend'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*rundll32(?:\.exe)?(?:\s+)?shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*powershell.*\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*rundll32(?:\.exe)?(?:\s+)?shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*powershell.*\"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*(set).*&&\s?set.*(environment|invoke|\${?input).*&&.*"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*(set).*&&\s?set.*(environment|invoke|\${?input).*&&.*"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*?echo.*clip.*&&.*(Clipboard|i`?n`?v`?o`?k`?e`?).*'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*?echo.*clip.*&&.*(Clipboard|i`?n`?v`?o`?k`?e`?).*'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*(set).*(&&).*(mshta).*(vbscript:createobject).*(\.run).*\(window\.close\).*"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*(set).*(&&).*(mshta).*(vbscript:createobject).*(\.run).*\(window\.close\).*"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*&&.*rundll32.*shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*(value|invoke|comspec|iex).*"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*&&.*rundll32.*shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*(value|invoke|comspec|iex).*"'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|re': u'(?i).*&&set.*(\{\d\}){2,}\\\"\s+?\-f.*&&.*cmd.*\/c'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection': {u'ServiceFileName|re': u'(?i).*&&set.*(\{\d\}){2,}\\\"\s+?\-f.*&&.*cmd.*\/c'}, u'selection_eventid': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_eventid'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION

author: Syed Hasan (@syedhasan009)
description: Detects the mount of ISO images on an endpoint
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4663, u'ObjectServer': u'Security', u'ObjectName': u'\Device\CdRom*', u'ObjectType': u'File'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Removable Storage" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: ISO Image Mount

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and not selection2', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName': [u'atsvc', u'samr', u'lsarpc', u'winreg', u'netlogon', u'srvsvc', u'protected_storage', u'wkssvc', u'browser', u'netdfs', u'svcctl', u'spoolss', u'ntsvcs', u'LSM_API_service', u'HydraLsPipe', u'TermSrv_API_service', u'MsFteWds']}}
falsepositives: [update the excluded named pipe to filter out any newly observed legit named pipe]
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe

author: Arun Chauhan
description: The attacker might use LOLBAS nltest.exe for discovery of domain controllers, domain trusts, parent domain and the current user permissions.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4689, u'Status': u'0x0', u'ProcessName|endswith': u'nltest.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Red team activity, rare legitimate use by an administrator]
title: Correct Execution of Nltest.exe

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4663, 4656], u'ObjectName|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'AccessMask': [u'0x40', u'0x1400', u'0x1000', u'0x100000', u'0x1410', u'0x1010', u'0x1438', u'0x143a', u'0x1418', u'0x1f0fff', u'0x1f1fff', u'0x1f2fff', u'0x1f3fff', u'40', u'1400', u'1000', u'100000', u'1410', u'1010', u'1438', u'143a', u'1418', u'1f0fff', u'1f1fff', u'1f2fff', u'1f3fff'], u'ObjectType': u'Process'}, u'filter1': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter1 and not filter2', u'filter2': {u'ProcessName|startswith': u'C:\Program Files'}}
title: LSASS Access from Non System Account

author: Florian Roth, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ImagePath|contains': [u'fgexec', u'dumpsvc', u'cachedump', u'mimidrv', u'gsecdump', u'servpw', u'pwdump']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator using credential dumping tool for password recovery]
tags: [attack.credential_access, attack.execution, attack.t1003, attack.t1003.001, attack.t1003.002, attack.t1003.004, attack.t1003.005, attack.t1003.006, attack.t1035, attack.t1569.002, attack.s0005]
title: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4656, 4658, 4660, 4663], u'ObjectName|endswith': u'\wceaux.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WCE wceaux.dll Access

author: Chakib Gzenayi (@Chak092), Hosni Mribah
description: Alerts on Metasploit host's authentications on the domain.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': [4625, 4624], u'LogonType': 3, u'AuthenticationPackageName': u'NTLM', u'WorkstationName|re': u'^[A-Za-z0-9]{16}$'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 4776, u'ProcessName': None, u'Workstation|re': u'^[A-Za-z0-9]{16}$'}}
title: Metasploit SMB Authentication

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation
detection: {u'selection': [{u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['cmd', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['%COMSPEC%', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['cmd.exe', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['rundll32', '.dll,a', '/p:']}], u'selection_id': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection_id and selection'}
title: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation

author: @2xxeformyshirt (Security Risk Advisors) - rule; Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea)
description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of "-Embedding" as a child of svchost.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\mmc.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\svchost.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'-Embedding'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: MMC20 Lateral Movement

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects the use of Moriya rootkit as described in the securelist's Operation TunnelSnake report
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceName': u'ZzNetSvc'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Moriya Rootkit

author: Florian Roth, wagga
description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4657, u'ObjectName|contains|all': [u'\REGISTRY\MACHINE\SYSTEM', u'ControlSet', u'\Control\Lsa'], u'ObjectValueName': [u'LmCompatibilityLevel', u'NtlmMinClientSec', u'RestrictSendingNTLMTraffic']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Object Access > Audit Registry (Success)', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack

author: oscd.community, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, Zach Stanford @svch0st, wagga
description: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\net.exe', u'\net1.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' use ', u'\\\*\\*$']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Mounted Windows Admin Shares with net.exe

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: Detects possible bypass EDR and SIEM via abnormal user account name.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4720, 4781], u'SamAccountName|contains': u'$'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: New or Renamed User Account with '$' in Attribute 'SamAccountName'.

author: Pushkarev Dmitry
description: This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop. Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4825}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Valid user was not added to RDP group]
title: Denied Access To Remote Desktop

author: Florian Roth
description: This the exploitation of a NTFS vulnerability as reported without many details via Twitter
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 55, u'Origin': u'File System Driver', u'Description|contains|all': [u'contains a corrupted file record', u'The name of the file is "\"']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: NTFS Vulnerability Exploitation

author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Dominik Schaudel (rule)
description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4624, u'LogonType': 9, u'AuthenticationPackageName': u'Negotiate', u'LogonProcessName': u'seclogo'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt

author: Ilias el Matani (rule), The Information Assurance Directorate at the NSA (method)
description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
