detection: {u'filter': {u'AccountName': u'ANONYMOUS LOGON'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': [4624, 4625], u'LogonType': u'3', u'ComputerName': u'%Workstations%', u'LogonProcessName': u'NtLmSsp', u'WorkstationName': u'%Workstations%'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The successful use of PtH for lateral movement between workstations would trigger event ID 4624, a failed logon attempt would trigger an event ID 4625', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Pass the Hash Activity

author: Dave Kennedy, Jeff Warren (method) / David Vassallo (rule)
description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network
detection: {u'filter': {u'AccountName': u'ANONYMOUS LOGON'}, u'selection': [{u'EventID': 4624, u'SubjectUserSid': u'S-1-0-0', u'LogonType': u'3', u'KeyLength': u'0', u'LogonProcessName': u'NtLmSsp'}, {u'EventID': 4624, u'LogonType': u'9', u'LogonProcessName': u'seclogo'}], u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The successful use of PtH for lateral movement between workstations would trigger event ID 4624', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Pass the Hash Activity 2

author: Mauricio Velazco, Michael Haag
description: Detect PetitPotam coerced authentication activity.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName|endswith': u'\IPC$', u'ShareName|startswith': u'\\', u'RelativeTargetName': u'lsarpc', u'SubjectUserName': u'ANONYMOUS LOGON'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Possible PetitPotam Coerce Authentication Attempt

author: Mauricio Velazco, Michael Haag
description: Detect suspicious Kerberos TGT requests. Once an attacer obtains a computer certificate by abusing Active Directory Certificate Services in combination with PetitPotam, the next step would be to leverage the certificate for malicious purposes. One way of doing this is to request a Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket using a tool like Rubeus. This request will generate a 4768 event with some unusual fields depending on the environment. This analytic will require tuning, we recommend filtering Account_Name to the Domain Controller computer accounts.
detection: {u'filter_thumbprint': {u'CertThumbprint': u''}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4768, u'TargetUserName|endswith': u'$', u'CertThumbprint': u'*'}, u'filter_local': {u'IpAddress': u'::1'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter_local and not filter_thumbprint'}
falsepositives: [False positives are possible if the environment is using certificates for authentication. We recommend filtering Account_Name to the Domain Controller computer accounts.]
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Account Logon > Kerberos Authentication Service" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: PetitPotam Suspicious Kerberos TGT Request

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community, Chakib Gzenayi (@Chak092), Hosni Mribah
description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4742, u'ServicePrincipalNames|contains': u'GC/'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 5136, u'AttributeValue|startswith': u'GC/', u'AttributeLDAPDisplayName': u'servicePrincipalName'}}
title: Possible DC Shadow

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service
detection: {u'powershell_as_service': {u'ImagePath|contains': [u'powershell', u'pwsh']}, u'condition': u'service_creation and powershell_as_service', u'service_creation': {u'EventID': 7045}}
title: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services

author: Aleksandr Akhremchik, @aleqs4ndr, ocsd.community
description: Detects Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472)
detection: {u'filter': {u'PasswordLastSet': u'-'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4742, u'TargetUserName': u'%DC-MACHINE-NAME%', u'SubjectUserName': u'ANONYMOUS LOGON'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [automatic DC computer account password change, legitimate DC computer account password change]
title: Possible Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) Exploitation

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName': u'protected_storage', u'ShareName|contains': u'IPC'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Protected Storage Service Access

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects QuarksPwDump clearing access history in hive
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 16, u'HiveName|endswith': u'.dmp', u'HiveName|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\SAM'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: QuarksPwDump Clearing Access History

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects rare scheduled tasks creations that only appear a few times per time frame and could reveal password dumpers, backdoor installs or other types of malicious code
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4698}, u'condition': u'selection | count() by TaskName < 5', u'timeframe': u'7d'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The Advanced Audit Policy setting Object Access > Audit Other Object Access Events has to be configured to allow this detection (not in the baseline recommendations by Microsoft). We also recommend extracting the Command field from the embedded XML in the event data.', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Rare Schtasks Creations

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects rare service installs that only appear a few times per time frame and could reveal password dumpers, backdoor installs or other types of malicious services
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045}, u'condition': u'selection | count() by ServiceFileName < 5', u'timeframe': u'7d'}
title: Rare Service Installs

author: Florian Roth (rule), Adam Bradbury (idea)
description: Detects the use of a scanner by zerosum0x0 that discovers targets vulnerable to  CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE aka BlueKeep
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4625, u'AccountName': u'AAAAAAA'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Scanner PoC for CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE Vuln

author: Thomas Patzke
description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4624, u'LogonType': 10, u'IpAddress': [u'::1', u'127.0.0.1']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: RDP Login from Localhost

author: Lionel PRAT, Christophe BROCAS, @atc_project (improvements)
description: Detect suspicious error on protocol RDP, potential CVE-2019-0708
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [56, 50], u'Provider_Name': u'TermDD'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Potential RDP Exploit CVE-2019-0708

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address
detection: {u'destinationRDP': {u'SourceAddress': [u'127.*', u'::1'], u'DestPort': 3389}, u'sourceRDP': {u'SourcePort': 3389, u'DestAddress': [u'127.*', u'::1']}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 5156}, u'condition': u'selection and ( sourceRDP or destinationRDP )'}
tags: [attack.defense_evasion, attack.command_and_control, attack.lateral_movement, attack.t1076, attack.t1090, attack.t1090.001, attack.t1090.002, attack.t1021.001, car.2013-07-002]
title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP

author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Ilyas Ochkov (rule), oscd.community
description: Detects potential use of Rubeus via registered new trusted logon process
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4611, u'LogonProcessName': u'User32LogonProcesss'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Register new Logon Process by Rubeus

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting (WinRM) by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5156, u'LayerRTID': 44, u'DestPort': [5985, 5986]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Remote PowerShell Sessions Network Connections (WinRM)

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName|contains': u'\winreg'}, u'selection_2': {u'IpAddress': u'%Admins_Workstations%'}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and not selection_2'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate usage of remote registry management by administrator]
tags: [attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1112, attack.discovery, attack.t1012, attack.credential_access, attack.t1552.002, attack.s0075]
title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility

author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4104, u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Move-Item', u'Cert:\LocalMachine\Root']}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 4104, u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Import-Certificate', u'Cert:\LocalMachine\Root']}}
falsepositives: [Help Desk or IT may need to manually add a corporate Root CA on occasion. Need to test if GPO push doesn't trigger FP]
title: Root Certificate Installed

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4656, u'ObjectName|endswith': u'\SAM', u'ObjectType': u'Key'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request

author: David Strassegger
description: Detects scheduled task deletion events. Scheduled tasks are likely to be deleted if not used for persistence. Malicious Software often creates tasks directly under the root node e.g. \TASKNAME
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4699}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The Advanced Audit Policy setting Object Access > Audit Other Object Access Events has to be configured to allow this detection. We also recommend extracting the Command field from the embedded XML in the event data.', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Scheduled Task Deletion

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.
detection: {u'filter': {u'SubjectLogonId': u'0x3e4'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4656, u'Keywords': u'Audit Failure', u'ObjectName': u'servicesactive', u'ObjectType': u'SC_MANAGER OBJECT'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: SCM Database Handle Failure

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects non-system users performing privileged operation os the SCM database
detection: {u'filter': {u'SubjectLogonId': u'0x3e4'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4674, u'PrivilegeList': u'SeTakeOwnershipPrivilege', u'ObjectName': u'servicesactive', u'ObjectType': u'SC_MANAGER OBJECT'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: SCM Database Privileged Operation

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detect potential adversaries leveraging WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers remotely to move laterally in a network
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetLogonId': u'0x3e7'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4624, u'LogonType': 3, u'ProcessName|endswith': u'scrcons.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Remote WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers

author: Florian Roth, Wojciech Lesicki
description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement
detection: {u'selection4': {u'ServiceFileName|base64offset|contains': u'IEX (New-Object Net.Webclient).DownloadString('http://127.0.0.1:'}, u'selection_id': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'selection1': {u'ServiceFileName|contains|all': [u'ADMIN$', u'.exe']}, u'selection2': {u'ServiceFileName|contains|all': [u'%COMSPEC%', u'start', u'powershell']}, u'selection3': {u'ServiceFileName|contains': u'powershell -nop -w hidden -encodedcommand'}, u'condition': u'selection_id and (selection1 or selection2 or selection3 or selection4)'}
title: CobaltStrike Service Installations

author: Florian Roth, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697, u'ServiceFileName|contains': [u'fgexec', u'dumpsvc', u'cachedump', u'mimidrv', u'gsecdump', u'servpw', u'pwdump']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator using credential dumping tool for password recovery]
tags: [attack.credential_access, attack.execution, attack.t1003, attack.t1003.001, attack.t1003.002, attack.t1003.004, attack.t1003.005, attack.t1003.006, attack.t1035, attack.t1569.002, attack.s0005]
title: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution

author: Florian Roth, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community (update)
description: Detects known malicious service installs that only appear in cases of lateral movement, credential dumping, and other suspicious activities.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and 1 of malsvc_*', u'malsvc_apt29': {u'ServiceName': u'javamtsup'}}
tags: [attack.persistence, attack.privilege_escalation, attack.t1003, attack.t1035, attack.t1050, car.2013-09-005, attack.t1543.003, attack.t1569.002]
title: Malicious Service Installations

author: Bartlomiej Czyz, Relativity
description: Detects usage of Metasploit SMB PsExec (exploit/windows/smb/psexec) and Impacket psexec.py by triggering on specific service installation
detection: {u'filter': {u'ServiceName': u'PSEXESVC'}, u'selection_1': {u'ServiceName|re': u'(^[a-zA-Z]{4}$)|(^[a-zA-Z]{8}$)|(^[a-zA-Z]{16}$)', u'ServiceType': u'0x10', u'ServiceFileName|re': u'^%systemroot%\\[a-zA-Z]{8}\.exe$', u'ServiceStartType': u'3'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_1 and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Possible, different agents with a 8 character binary and a 4, 8 or 16 character service name]
title: Metasploit Or Impacket Service Installation Via SMB PsExec

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation
detection: {u'selection': [{u'ServiceFileName|contains|all': ['cmd', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ServiceFileName|contains|all': ['%COMSPEC%', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ServiceFileName|contains|all': ['cmd.exe', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ServiceFileName|contains|all': ['rundll32', '.dll,a', '/p:']}], u'selection_id': {u'EventID': 4697}, u'condition': u'selection_id and selection'}
title: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service
detection: {u'powershell_as_service': {u'ServiceFileName|contains': [u'powershell', u'pwsh']}, u'condition': u'service_creation and powershell_as_service', u'service_creation': {u'EventID': 4697}}
title: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services

author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Ian Davis, oscd.community
description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697, u'ServiceFileName|contains': u'tap0901'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Tap Driver Installation

author: Jose Rodriguez @Cyb3rPandaH
description: Rule to detect an adversary setting OabVirtualDirectory External URL property to a script
detection: {u'selection': [u'Set-OabVirtualDirectory', u'ExternalUrl', u'Page_Load', u'script'], u'condition': u'all of selection'}
title: Set OabVirtualDirectory ExternalUrl Property

author: Jose Rodriguez (@Cyb3rPandaH), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).
detection: {u'filter': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName|endswith': u'C$', u'AccessMask': u'0x2'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: SMB Create Remote File Admin Share

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects successful installation of Atera Remote Monitoring & Management (RMM) agent as recently found to be used by Conti operators
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1033, u'Provider_Name': u'MsiInstaller', u'Message|contains': u'AteraAgent'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Atera Agent Installation

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4104, u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'get-itemProperty', u'\software\', u'select-object', u'format-table']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'powershell'}
title: Detected Windows Software Discovery

author: Ilyas Ochkov, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\lsass.exe', u'\opera.exe', u'\chrome.exe', u'\firefox.exe']}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 5156, u'DestinationPort': 88}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection

author: Sreeman
description: Adversaries can migrate cobalt strike/metasploit/C2 beacons on compromised systems to legitimate werfault.exe process to avoid detection.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'werfault.exe'}, u'filter1': {u'ParentImage': u'svchost.exe'}, u'filter3': {u'DestinationHostname|contains': [u'*.windowsupdate.com', u'*.microsoft.com']}, u'condition': u'selection and not ( filter1 and filter2 and filter3 )', u'filter2': {u'DestinationIp': [u'104.42.151.234', u'104.43.193.48', u'52.255.188.83', u'13.64.90.137', u'168.61.161.212', u'13.88.21.125', u'40.88.32.150', u'52.147.198.201', u'52.239.207.100', u'52.176.224.96', u'2607:7700:0:24:0:1:287e:1894', u'10.*', u'192.168.*', u'127.*']}}
falsepositives: [Communication to other corporate systems that use IP addresses from public address spaces and Microsoft IP spaces]
title: Suspicious Werfault.exe Network Connection Outbound

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4706}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Addition of Domain Trusts

author: Thomas Patzke, @atc_project (improvements)
description: An attacker can use the SID history attribute to gain additional privileges.
detection: {u'selection2': {u'EventID': 4738}, u'selection3': {u'SidHistory': [u'-', u'%%1793']}, u'filter_null': {u'SidHistory': None}, u'condition': u'selection1 or (selection2 and not selection3 and not filter_null)', u'selection1': {u'EventID': [4765, 4766]}}
falsepositives: [Migration of an account into a new domain]
title: Addition of SID History to Active Directory Object

author: Florian Roth (rule), Tom U. @c_APT_ure (collection)
description: Detects backup catalog deletions
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 524, u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-Backup'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Backup Catalog Deleted

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Code integrity failures may indicate tampered executables.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [5038, 6281]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Failed Code Integrity Checks

author: Dimitrios Slamaris
description: This rule detects a DHCP server in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) was loaded
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1033, u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-DHCP-Server'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DHCP Server Loaded the CallOut DLL

author: Dimitrios Slamaris, @atc_project (fix)
description: This rule detects a DHCP server error in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) could not be loaded
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [1031, 1032, 1034], u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-DHCP-Server'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DHCP Server Error Failed Loading the CallOut DLL

author: Florian Roth
description: This rule detects a DNS server error in which a specified plugin DLL (in registry) could not be loaded
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [150, 770]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DNS Server Error Failed Loading the ServerLevelPluginDLL

author: Thomas Patzke
description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4794}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account

author: Florian Roth
description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [517, 1102], u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-Eventlog'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Rollout of log collection agents (the setup routine often includes a reset of the local Eventlog), System provisioning (system reset before the golden image creation)]
title: Eventlog Cleared

author: Florian Roth, KevTheHermit, fuzzyf10w
description: Detect Attempt PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675) Remote code execution in Windows Spooler Service
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 31017, u'Description|contains': u'Rejected an insecure guest logon', u'ServerName|startswith': u'\1', u'UserName': u''}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Account fallback reasons (after failed login with specific account)]
title: Suspicious Rejected SMB Guest Logon From IP

author: Mauricio Velazco
description: Detects a source user failing to authenticate with multiple users using explicit credentials on a host.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4648}, u'condition': [u'selection1 | count(Account_Name) by ComputerName > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Multiple Users Attempting To Authenticate Using Explicit Credentials

author: Mauricio Velazco
description: Detects failed logins with multiple accounts from a single process on the system.
detection: {u'filter': {u'ProcessName': u'-'}, u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4625, u'LogonType': 2}, u'condition': [u'selection1 and not filter | count(TargetUserName) by ProcessName > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Multiple Users Failing to Authenticate from Single Process

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': [529, 4625], u'TargetUserName': u'*', u'WorkstationName': u'*'}, u'condition': u'selection1 | count(TargetUserName) by WorkstationName > 3'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system
detection: {u'selection2': {u'EventID': 4776, u'TargetUserName': u'*', u'Workstation': u'*'}, u'condition': u'selection2 | count(TargetUserName) by Workstation > 3', u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System

author: Mauricio Velazco, frack113
description: Detects multiple failed logins with multiple valid domain accounts from a single source system using the Kerberos protocol.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4771, u'Status': u'0x18'}, u'filter_computer': {u'TargetUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': [u'selection and not filter_computer | count(TargetUserName) by IpAddress > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Vulnerability scanners, Misconfigured systems, Remote administration tools, VPN terminators, Multiuser systems like Citrix server farms]
title: Valid Users Failing to Authenticate From Single Source Using Kerberos

author: Mauricio Velazco, frack113
description: Detects failed logins with multiple disabled domain accounts from a single source system using the Kerberos protocol.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4768, u'Status': u'0x12'}, u'filter_computer': {u'TargetUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': [u'selection and not filter_computer | count(TargetUserName) by IpAddress > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Vulnerability scanners, Misconfigured systems, Remote administration tools, VPN terminators, Multiuser systems like Citrix server farms]
title: Disabled Users Failing To Authenticate From Source Using Kerberos

author: Mauricio Velazco, frack113
description: Detects failed logins with multiple invalid domain accounts from a single source system using the Kerberos protocol.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4768, u'Status': u'0x6'}, u'filter_computer': {u'TargetUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'condition': [u'selection and not filter_computer | count(TargetUserName) by IpAddress > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Vulnerability scanners, Misconfigured systems, Remote administration tools, VPN terminators, Multiuser systems like Citrix server farms]
title: Invalid Users Failing To Authenticate From Source Using Kerberos

author: Mauricio Velazco
description: Detects failed logins with multiple valid domain accounts from a single source system using the NTLM protocol.
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetUserName': u'*$'}, u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4776, u'Status': u'*0xC000006A'}, u'condition': [u'selection1 and not filter | count(TargetUserName) by Workstation > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Valid Users Failing to Authenticate from Single Source Using NTLM

author: Mauricio Velazco
description: Detects failed logins with multiple invalid domain accounts from a single source system using the NTLM protocol.
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetUserName': u'*$'}, u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4776, u'Status': u'*0xC0000064'}, u'condition': [u'selection1 and not filter | count(TargetUserName) by Workstation > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Invalid Users Failing To Authenticate From Single Source Using NTLM

author: Florian Roth
description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4625, 4776], u'Status': [u'0xC0000072', u'0xC000006F', u'0xC0000070', u'0xC0000413', u'0xC000018C', u'0xC000015B']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons

author: NVISO
description: A login from a public IP can indicate a misconfigured firewall or network boundary.
detection: {u'privatev6': [{u'IpAddress': u'::1'}, {u'IpAddress|startswith': ['fe80::', 'fc00::']}], u'unknown': {u'IpAddress|contains': u'-'}, u'privatev4': {u'IpAddress|startswith': [u'10.', u'192.168.', u'172.16.', u'172.17.', u'172.18.', u'172.19.', u'172.20.', u'172.21.', u'172.22.', u'172.23.', u'172.24.', u'172.25.', u'172.26.', u'172.27.', u'172.28.', u'172.29.', u'172.30.', u'172.31.', u'127.', u'169.254.']}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4625}, u'condition': u'selection and not (unknown or privatev4 or privatev6)'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate logon attempts over the internet, IPv4-to-IPv6 mapped IPs]
title: Failed Logon From Public IP

author: Mauricio Velazco
description: Detects a source system failing to authenticate against a remote host with multiple users.
detection: {u'filter': {u'IpAddress': u'-'}, u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4625, u'LogonType': 3}, u'condition': [u'selection1 and not filter | count(TargetUserName) by IpAddress > 10'], u'timeframe': u'24h'}
falsepositives: [Terminal servers, Jump servers, Other multiuser systems like Citrix server farms, Workstations with frequently changing users]
title: Multiple Users Remotely Failing To Authenticate From Single Source

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects interactive console logons to Server Systems
detection: {u'filter': {u'LogonProcessName': u'Advapi', u'ComputerName': u'%Workstations%'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': [528, 529, 4624, 4625], u'LogonType': 2, u'ComputerName': [u'%ServerSystems%', u'%DomainControllers%']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Administrative activity via KVM or ILO board]
title: Interactive Logon to Server Systems

author: Florian Roth
description: This method triggers on rare Kerberos Failure Codes caused by manipulations of Kerberos messages
title: Kerberos Manipulation

author: xknow @xknow_infosec
description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5136, u'AttributeValue': u'*', u'AttributeLDAPDisplayName': [u'primaryInternationalISDNNumber', u'otherFacsimileTelephoneNumber', u'primaryTelexNumber']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Companies, who may use these default LDAP-Attributes for personal information]
title: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used

author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573
description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts similar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4720, u'SamAccountName|contains|all': [u'ANONYMOUS', u'LOGON']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created

author: oscd.community, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Detects suspicious processes logging on with explicit credentials
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetServerName': u'localhost'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4648, u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\pwsh.exe', u'\winrs.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\net.exe', u'\net1.exe', u'\reg.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Administrators that use the RunAS command or scheduled tasks]
title: Suspicious Remote Logon with Explicit Credentials

author: sigma
description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4656, u'ProcessName|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'AccessMask': u'0x705', u'ObjectType': u'SAM_DOMAIN'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS

author: Roberto Rodriguez, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Dimitrios Slamaris, Mark Russinovich, Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community (update)
description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'EventID': 4656, u'ObjectName|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'AccessMask|contains': [u'0x40', u'0x1400', u'0x1000', u'0x100000', u'0x1410', u'0x1010', u'0x1438', u'0x143a', u'0x1418', u'0x1f0fff', u'0x1f1fff', u'0x1f2fff', u'0x1f3fff']}, u'selection_2': {u'EventID': 4663, u'ObjectName|endswith': u'\lsass.exe', u'AccessList|contains': [u'4484', u'4416']}, u'filter1': {u'ProcessName|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWow64\', u'C:\Windows\SysNative\', u'C:\Program Files\', u'C:\Windows\Temp\asgard2-agent\'], u'ProcessName|endswith': [u'\wmiprvse.exe', u'\taskmgr.exe', u'\procexp64.exe', u'\procexp.exe', u'\lsm.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\vmtoolsd.exe', u'\minionhost.exe', u'\VsTskMgr.exe', u'\thor64.exe']}, u'condition': u'( selection_1 or selection_2 ) and not filter1 and not filter2', u'filter2': {u'ProcessName|startswith': [u'C:\Program Files']}}
falsepositives: [Legitimate software accessing LSASS process for legitimate reason; update the whitelist with it]
title: Generic Password Dumper Activity on LSASS

author: Diego Perez (@darkquassar), Markus Neis, Swisscom (Improve Rule)
description: Detection for mshta.exe suspicious execution patterns sometimes involving file polyglotism
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\mshta.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'vbscript', u'.jpg', u'.png', u'.lnk', u'.xls', u'.doc', u'.zip']}, u'condition': u'selection1'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: MSHTA Suspicious Execution 01

author: Florian Roth
description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine
detection: {u'keywords': [u'MsMpEng.exe', u'mpengine.dll'], u'selection1': {u'EventID': 1000, u'Provider_Name': u'Application Error'}, u'condition': u'1 of selection* and all of keywords', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 1001, u'Provider_Name': u'Windows Error Reporting'}}
falsepositives: [MsMpEng.exe can crash when C:\ is full]
title: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash

author: Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community
description: Detects multiple file rename or delete events occurrence within a specified period of time by a same user (these events may signalize about ransomware activity).
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4663, u'AccessList': u'%%1537', u'Keywords': u'0x8020000000000000', u'ObjectType': u'File'}, u'condition': u'selection | count() by SubjectLogonId > 10', u'timeframe': u'30s'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Policies/Windows Settings/Security Settings/Local Policies/Audit Policy/Audit object access, Policies/Windows Settings/Security Settings/Advanced Audit Policy Configuration/Object Access', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Suspicious Multiple File Rename Or Delete Occurred

author: Florian Roth (rule), Jack Croock (method), Jonhnathan Ribeiro (improvements), oscd.community
description: Detects activity as "net user administrator /domain" and "net group domain admins /domain"
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4661, u'AccessMask': u'0x2d', u'ObjectName|startswith': u'S-1-5-21-', u'ObjectType': [u'SAM_USER', u'SAM_GROUP']}, u'selection2': {u'ObjectName|endswith': [u'-500', u'-512']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The volume of Event ID 4661 is high on Domain Controllers and therefore "Audit SAM" and "Audit Kernel Object" advanced audit policy settings are not configured in the recommendations for server systems', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Reconnaissance Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects logons using NTLM, which could be caused by a legacy source or attackers
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 8002, u'CallingProcessName': u'*'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requires events from Microsoft-Windows-NTLM/Operational', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'ntlm'}
title: NTLM Logon

author: James Pemberton
description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 8001, u'TargetName|startswith': u'TERMSRV'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Host connections to valid domains, exclude these., Host connections not using host FQDN., Host connections to external legitimate domains.]
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requires events from Microsoft-Windows-NTLM/Operational', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'ntlm'}
title: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a ProcessHacker tool that elevated privileges to a very high level
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceName|startswith': u'ProcessHacker', u'AccountName': u'LocalSystem'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: ProcessHacker Privilege Elevation

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName|endswith': [u'-stdin', u'-stdout', u'-stderr']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and not selection2', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName|startswith': u'PSEXESVC'}}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Suspicious PsExec Execution

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects known sensitive file extensions accessed on a network share
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName|endswith': [u'.pst', u'.ost', u'.msg', u'.nst', u'.oab', u'.edb', u'.nsf', u'.bak', u'.dmp', u'.kirbi', u'\groups.xml', u'.rdp']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Help Desk operator doing backup or re-imaging end user machine or pentest or backup software, Users working with these data types or exchanging message files]
title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects service ticket requests using RC4 encryption type
detection: {u'reduction': {u'ServiceName|startswith': u'$'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4769, u'TicketOptions': u'0x40810000', u'TicketEncryptionType': u'0x17'}, u'condition': u'selection and not reduction'}
falsepositives: [Service accounts used on legacy systems (e.g. NetApp), Windows Domains with DFL 2003 and legacy systems]
title: Suspicious Kerberos RC4 Ticket Encryption

author: @SBousseaden, Florian Roth
description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4624, u'LogonType': 3, u'IpAddress': u'127.0.0.1', u'TargetUserName': u'ANONYMOUS_LOGON', u'WorkstationName': u'-'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern

author: Dimitrios Slamaris
description: Detects a possible remote NTLM hash change through SAMR API SamiChangePasswordUser() or SamSetInformationUser(). "Audit User Account Management" in "Advanced Audit Policy Configuration" has to be enabled in your local security policy / GPO to see this events.
detection: {u'passwordchanged_filter': {u'PasswordLastSet': None}, u'samrpipe': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName': u'samr'}, u'passwordchanged': {u'EventID': 4738}, u'condition': u'( passwordchanged and not passwordchanged_filter ) | near samrpipe', u'timeframe': u'15s'}
title: Possible Remote Password Change Through SAMR

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious SAM dump activity as cause by QuarksPwDump and other password dumpers
detection: {u'keywords': [u'\AppData\Local\Temp\SAM-', u'.dmp'], u'selection': {u'EventID': 16}, u'condition': u'selection and all of keywords'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The source of this type of event is Kernel-General', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'system'}
title: SAM Dump to AppData

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects renaming of file while deletion with SDelete tool.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4656, 4663, 4658], u'ObjectName|endswith': [u'.AAA', u'.ZZZ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.impact, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1107, attack.t1070.004, attack.t1066, attack.t1027.005, attack.t1485, attack.t1553.002, attack.s0195]
title: Secure Deletion with SDelete

author: @neu5ron
description: Detect scenarios where a potentially unauthorized application or user is modifying the system time.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4616}, u'filter1': {u'ProcessName': u'C:\Program Files\VMware\VMware Tools\vmtoolsd.exe'}, u'filter3': {u'ProcessName': u'C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe', u'SubjectUserSid': u'S-1-5-19'}, u'condition': u'selection and not ( filter1 or filter2 or filter3 )', u'filter2': {u'ProcessName': u'C:\Windows\System32\VBoxService.exe'}}
falsepositives: [HyperV or other virtualization technologies with binary not listed in filter portion of detection]
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : System > Audit Security State Change, Group Policy : Computer Configuration\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\Audit Policies\System\Audit Security State Change', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
references: [Private Cuckoo Sandbox (from many years ago, no longer have hash, NDA as well), Live environment caused by malware, https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/auditing/event-4616]
title: Unauthorized System Time Modification

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detection of logins performed with WMI
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4624, u'ProcessName|endswith': u'\WmiPrvSE.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Login with WMI

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'ShareName': u'\\*\IPC$', u'RelativeTargetName': u'svcctl', u'Accesses|contains': u'WriteData'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'The advanced audit policy setting "Object Access > Audit Detailed File Share" must be configured for Success/Failure', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4656, 4663], u'ObjectName|endswith': [u'lsa\JD', u'lsa\GBG', u'lsa\Skew1', u'lsa\Data'], u'ObjectType': u'key'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SysKey Registry Keys Access

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Potential threat actor tampering with Sysmon manifest and eventually disabling it
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4657, u'ObjectName|contains': [u'WINEVT\Publishers\{5770385f-c22a-43e0-bf4c-06f5698ffbd9}', u'WINEVT\Channels\Microsoft-Windows-Sysmon/Operational'], u'ObjectValueName': u'Enabled', u'NewValue': u'0'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'EventID': 4663, u'ObjectName|contains': [u'WINEVT\Publishers\{5770385f-c22a-43e0-bf4c-06f5698ffbd9}', u'WINEVT\Channels\Microsoft-Windows-Sysmon/Operational'], u'AccessMask': 65536}}
title: Sysmon Channel Reference Deletion

author: Florian Roth
description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 104, u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-Eventlog'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Rollout of log collection agents (the setup routine often includes a reset of the local Eventlog), System provisioning (system reset before the golden image creation)]
related: [{u'type': u'obsoletes', u'id': u'f2f01843-e7b8-4f95-a35a-d23584476423'}, {u'type': u'derived', u'id': u'd99b79d2-0a6f-4f46-ad8b-260b6e17f982'}]
title: Eventlog Cleared

author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Ian Davis, oscd.community
description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ImagePath|contains': u'tap0901'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Tap Driver Installation

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName|contains': [u'\mimidrv', u'\lsass', u'\windows\minidump\', u'\hiberfil', u'\sqldmpr', u'\sam', u'\ntds.dit', u'\security']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Transferring sensitive files for legitimate administration work by legitimate administrator]
title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects plugged USB devices
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [2003, 2100, 2102]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: USB Device Plugged

author: Florian Roth
description: This rule triggers on user accounts that are added to the local Administrators group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity
detection: {u'selection_group2': {u'TargetSid': u'S-1-5-32-544'}, u'filter': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'selection_group1': {u'TargetUserName|startswith': u'Administr'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 4732}, u'condition': u'selection and (1 of selection_group*) and not filter'}
title: User Added to Local Administrators

author: Roberto Rodriguez (source), Ilyas Ochkov (rule), oscd.community
description: The 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess' function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4673, u'Keywords': u'0x8010000000000000', u'Service': u'LsaRegisterLogonProcess()'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: User Couldn't Call a Privileged Service 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess'

author: Patrick Bareiss
description: Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4720}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Domain Controller Logs, Local accounts managed by privileged account management tools]
title: Local User Creation

author: xknow (@xknow_infosec), xorxes (@xor_xes)
description: Detects the loading of drivers via 'SeLoadDriverPrivilege' required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'EventID': 4673, u'PrivilegeList': u'SeLoadDriverPrivilege', u'Service': u'-'}, u'selection_2': {u'ProcessName|endswith': [u'\Windows\System32\Dism.exe', u'\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe', u'\Windows\System32\fltMC.exe', u'\Windows\HelpPane.exe', u'\Windows\System32\mmc.exe', u'\Windows\System32\svchost.exe', u'\Windows\System32\wimserv.exe', u'\procexp64.exe', u'\procexp.exe', u'\procmon64.exe', u'\procmon.exe', u'\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and not selection_2'}
falsepositives: [Other legimate tools loading drivers. There are some: Sysinternals, CPU-Z, AVs etc. - but not much. You have to baseline this according to your used products and allowed tools. Also try to exclude users, which are allowed to load drivers.]
title: Suspicious Driver Loaded By User

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)
description: Detects volume shadow copy mount
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 98, u'DeviceName|contains': u'HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy', u'Provider_Name': u'Microsoft-Windows-Ntfs'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of volume shadow copy mounts (backups maybe).]
title: Volume Shadow Copy Mount

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)
description: Detects the registration of the security event source VSSAudit. It would usually trigger when volume shadow copy operations happen.
detection: {u'selection_two': {u'EventID': 4905, u'AuditSourceName': u'VSSAudit'}, u'selection_one': {u'EventID': 4904, u'AuditSourceName': u'VSSAudit'}, u'condition': u'selection_one or selection_two'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of VSSVC. Maybe backup operations. It would usually be done by C:\Windows\System32\VSSVC.exe.]
title: VSSAudit Security Event Source Registration

author: Florian Roth, wagga
description: Detects the exploitation of Microsoft Exchange vulnerability as described in CVE-2020-0688
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 4, u'Provider_Name': u'MSExchange Control Panel', u'Level': u'Error'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': [u'&__VIEWSTATE=']}
title: CVE-2020-0688 Exploitation via Eventlog

author: NVISO
description: Detects that a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection was allowed, which could be an indicator of CVE-2020-1472.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 5829}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Vulnerable Netlogon Secure Channel Connection Allowed

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Open Threat Research (OTR)
description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.
detection: {u'filter': {u'SubjectUserName|endswith': u'$'}, u'selection': {u'EventID': 5145, u'RelativeTargetName|endswith': u'\wbem\wbemcomn.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects triggering of AMSI by Windows Defender.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1116, u'Source_Name': u'AMSI'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Defender AMSI Trigger Detected

author: @BarryShooshooga
description: Detects scenarios where an windows defender exclusion was added in registry where an entity would want to bypass antivirus scanning from windows defender
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [4657, 4656, 4660, 4663], u'ObjectName|contains': u'\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements: Audit Policy : Security Settings/Local Policies/Audit Policy, Registry System Access Control (SACL): Auditing/User', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'security'}
title: Windows Defender Exclusion Set

author: Ján Trenčanský, frack113
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender threat protection
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [5001, 5010, 5012, 5101]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Defender Threat Detection Disabled

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventID': 5007, u'New_Value|contains': u'\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions'}, u'condition': u'selection1'}
title: Windows Defender Exclusions Added

author: Cian Heasley
description: Windows Defender logs when the history of detected infections is deleted. Log file will contain the message "Windows Defender Antivirus has removed history of malware and other potentially unwanted software".
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1013, u'EventType': 4}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Deletion of Defender malware detections history for legitimate reasons]
title: Windows Defender Malware Detection History Deletion

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 1121, u'ProcessName|endswith': [u'\wmiprvse.exe', u'\psexesvc.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'definition': u'Requirements:Enabled Block process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands from Attack Surface Reduction (GUID: d1e49aac-8f56-4280-b9ba-993a6d77406c)', u'product': u'windows_defender'}
title: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects block of attempt to disable real time protection of Microsoft Defender by tamper protection
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [5013], u'Value|endswith': [u'\Windows Defender\DisableAntiSpyware = 0x1()', u'\Real-Time Protection\DisableRealtimeMonitoring = (Current)']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Microsoft Defender Tamper Protection Trigger

author: Ján Trenčanský
description: Detects all actions taken by Windows Defender malware detection engines
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [1006, 1116, 1015, 1117]}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Defender Threat Detected

author: Max Altgelt
description: Detects a write of an Exchange CSR to an untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell
detection: {u'export_command': [u'New-ExchangeCertificate', u' -GenerateRequest', u' -BinaryEncoded', u' -RequestFile'], u'export_params': [u'\\\\localhost\\C$', u'\\\\127.0.0.1\\C$', u'C:\\inetpub', u'.aspx'], u'condition': u'all of export_command and export_params'}
title: Certificate Request Export to Exchange Webserver

author: Florian Roth, Rich Warren, Christian Burkard
description: Detects a successful export of an Exchange mailbox to untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell or the needed role assignment for it
detection: {u'export_command': [u'New-MailboxExportRequest', u' -Mailbox '], u'export_params': [u'-FilePath "\\localhost\C$', u'-FilePath "\\127.0.0.1\C$', u'.aspx'], u'condition': u'(all of export_command and export_params) or all of role_assignment', u'role_assignment': [u'New-ManagementRoleAssignment', u' -Role "Mailbox Import Export"', u' -User ']}
title: Mailbox Export to Exchange Webserver

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects removal of an exported Exchange mailbox which could be to cover tracks from ProxyShell exploit
detection: {u'command': [u'Remove-MailboxExportRequest', u' -Identity ', u' -Confirm "False"'], u'condition': u'all of command'}
title: Remove Exported Mailbox from Exchange Webserver

author: Tobias Michalski
description: Detects a failed installation of a Exchange Transport Agent
detection: {u'keywords': [u'Install-TransportAgent'], u'selection': {u'EventID': 6}, u'condition': u'selection and keywords'}
falsepositives: [legitimate installations of exchange TransportAgents. AssemblyPath is a good indicator for this.]
title: Failed MSExchange Transport Agent Installation

author: Janantha Marasinghe
description: This event was observed on the target host during lateral movement. The process name within the event contains the process spawned post compromise. Account Name within the event contains the compromised user account name. This event should to be correlated with 4624 and 4688 for further intrusion context.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4674, u'ObjectServer': u'Security', u'ObjectName': u'\Device\ConDrv', u'ObjectType': u'File'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Penetration tests where lateral movement has occurred. This event will be created on the target host.]
title: Lateral Movement Indicator ConDrv

author: Adeem Mawani
description: Detects possible Active Directory enumeration via LDAP
detection: {u'narrow_down_filter': {u'EventID': 30, u'SearchFilter|contains': [u'(domainSid=*)', u'(objectSid=*)']}, u'generic_search': {u'EventID': 30, u'SearchFilter|contains': [u'(groupType:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=2147483648)', u'(groupType:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=2147483656)', u'(groupType:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=2147483652)', u'(groupType:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=2147483650)', u'(sAMAccountType=805306369)', u'(sAMAccountType=805306368)', u'(sAMAccountType=536870913)', u'(sAMAccountType=536870912)', u'(sAMAccountType=268435457)', u'(sAMAccountType=268435456)', u'(objectCategory=groupPolicyContainer)', u'(objectCategory=organizationalUnit)', u'(objectCategory=Computer)', u'(objectCategory=nTDSDSA)', u'(objectCategory=server)', u'(objectCategory=domain)', u'(objectCategory=person)', u'(objectCategory=group)', u'(objectCategory=user)', u'(objectClass=trustedDomain)', u'(objectClass=computer)', u'(objectClass=server)', u'(objectClass=group)', u'(objectClass=user)', u'(primaryGroupID=521)', u'(primaryGroupID=516)', u'(primaryGroupID=515)', u'(primaryGroupID=512)', u'Domain Admins']}, u'suspicious_flag': {u'EventID': 30, u'SearchFilter|contains': [u'(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=4194304)', u'(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=2097152)', u'!(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=1048574)', u'(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=524288)', u'(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=65536)', u'(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=8192)', u'(userAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=544)', u'!(UserAccountControl:1.2.840.113556.1.4.803:=2)', u'msDS-AllowedToActOnBehalfOfOtherIdentity', u'msDS-AllowedToDelegateTo', u'(accountExpires=9223372036854775807)', u'(accountExpires=0)', u'(adminCount=1)', u'ms-MCS-AdmPwd']}, u'condition': u'(generic_search and not narrow_down_filter) or (suspicious_flag)'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ldap_query', u'definition': u'Requires Microsoft-Windows-LDAP-Client/Debug ETW logging', u'product': u'windows'}
title: LDAP Reconnaissance / Active Directory Enumeration

author: Cian Heasley
description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 4697, u'ServiceFileName|contains': [u'pcap', u'npcap', u'npf', u'nm3', u'ndiscap', u'nmnt', u'windivert', u'USBPcap', u'pktmon']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Pcap Drivers

author: Demyan Sokolin @_drd0c, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, oscd.community
description: This rule is designed to detect attempts to exploit Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) vulnerability using mimikatz zerologon module or other exploits from machine with "kali" hostname.
detection: {u'keywords': [u'kali', u'mimikatz'], u'selection': {u'EventID': [u'5805', u'5723']}, u'condition': u'selection and keywords'}
title: Zerologon Exploitation Using Well-known Tools

author: Florian Roth
description: This rule detects rare scheduled task creations. Typically software gets installed on multiple systems and not only on a few. The aggregation and count function selects tasks with rare names.
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': 106}, u'condition': u'selection | count() by TaskName < 5', u'timeframe': u'7d'}
title: Rare Scheduled Task Creations

author: Florian Roth, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.
detection: {u'condition': u'wmi_subscription', u'wmi_subscription': {u'EventID': 4662, u'ObjectName|contains': u'subscription', u'ObjectType': u'WMI Namespace'}}
falsepositives: [Unknown (data set is too small; further testing needed)]
title: WMI Persistence

author: Ján Trenčanský, frack113
description: Detects disabling Windows Defender threat protection
detection: {u'keywords': [u'Windows Defender Antivirus Service', u'stopped'], u'condition': u'selection3 and all of keywords', u'selection3': {u'EventID': 7036}}
title: Windows Defender Threat Detection Disabled

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)
detection: {u'service_installation': {u'EventID': 7045, u'ServiceFileName|endswith': u'\PSEXESVC.exe', u'ServiceName': u'PSEXESVC'}, u'condition': u'service_installation or service_execution', u'service_execution': {u'EventID': 7036, u'ServiceName': u'PSEXESVC'}}
fields: [EventID, CommandLine, ParentCommandLine, ServiceName, ServiceFileName, TargetFilename, PipeName]
title: PsExec Tool Execution

author: Florian Roth, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.
detection: {u'wmi_filter_to_consumer_binding': {u'EventID': 5861}, u'consumer_keywords': [u'ActiveScriptEventConsumer', u'CommandLineEventConsumer', u'CommandLineTemplate'], u'wmi_filter_registration': {u'EventID': 5859}, u'condition': u'(wmi_filter_to_consumer_binding and consumer_keywords) or (wmi_filter_registration)'}
falsepositives: [Unknown (data set is too small; further testing needed)]
logsource: {u'definition': u'WMI Namespaces Auditing and SACL should be configured, EventID 5861 and 5859 detection requires Windows 10, 2012 and higher', u'product': u'windows', u'service': u'wmi'}
title: WMI Persistence

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects alternate PowerShell hosts potentially bypassing detections looking for powershell.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'ContextInfo|contains': u'powershell.exe'}, u'selection': {u'ContextInfo': u'*'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Programs using PowerShell directly without invocation of a dedicated interpreter, MSP Detection Searcher, Citrix ConfigSync.ps1]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Alternate PowerShell Hosts

author: ok @securonix invrep_de, oscd.community
description: Focuses on trivial artifacts observed in variants of prevalent offensive ps1 payloads, including Cobalt Strike Beacon, PoshC2, Powerview, Letmein, Empire, Powersploit, and other attack payloads that often undergo minimal changes by attackers due to bad opsec.
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|contains': [u'$DoIt', u'harmj0y', u'mattifestation', u'_RastaMouse', u'tifkin_', u'0xdeadbeef']}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
falsepositives: [Moderate-to-low; Despite the shorter length/lower entropy for some of these, because of high specificity, fp appears to be fairly limited in many environments.]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Bad Opsec Powershell Code Artifacts

author: Ilyas Ochkov, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history
detection: {u'selection_payload_1': {u'Payload|contains|all': [u'(Get-PSReadlineOption).HistorySavePath'], u'Payload|contains': [u'del', u'Remove-Item', u'rm']}, u'selection_payload_2': {u'Payload|contains|all': [u'Set-PSReadlineOption', u'–HistorySaveStyle', u'SaveNothing']}, u'condition': u'selection_payload_1 or selection_payload_2'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Clear PowerShell History

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for specific decompress commands in PowerShell logs. This could be an adversary decompressing files.
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|contains': u'Expand-Archive'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Decompress Commands

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for the Get-Clipboard commands in PowerShell logs. This could be an adversary capturing clipboard contents.
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|contains': u'Get-Clipboard'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Get Clipboard

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+clip(?:\.exe)?.{0,4}&&.+clipboard]::\(\s\\\"\{\d\}.+\-f.+\"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher

author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community
description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block — https://github.com/danielbohannon/Invoke-Obfuscation/blob/master/Out-ObfuscatedStringCommand.ps1#L873-L888
detection: {u'selection_payload': [{u'Payload|re': u'\$PSHome\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$PSHome\['}, {u'Payload|re': u'\$ShellId\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$ShellId\['}, {u'Payload|re': u'\$env:Public\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$env:Public\['}, {u'Payload|re': u'\$env:ComSpec\[(\s*\d{1,3}\s*,){2}'}, {u'Payload|re': u'\\\\*mdr\\\\*\W\s*\)\.Name'}, {u'Payload|re': u'\$VerbosePreference\.ToString\('}, {u'Payload|re': u'\String\]\s*\$VerbosePreference'}], u'condition': u'selection_payload'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+powershell.+(?:\$\{?input\}?|noexit).+\"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*new-object.*(?:system\.io\.compression\.deflatestream|system\.io\.streamreader).*text\.encoding\]::ascii.*readtoend'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*rundll32(?:\.exe)?(?:\s+)?shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*powershell.*\"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*(set).*&&\s?set.*(environment|invoke|\${?input).*&&.*"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*?echo.*clip.*&&.*(Clipboard|i`?n`?v`?o`?k`?e`?).*'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*(set).*(&&).*(mshta).*(vbscript:createobject).*(\.run).*\(window\.close\).*"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabledd', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*&&.*rundll32.*shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*(value|invoke|comspec|iex).*"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'Payload|re': u'(?i).*&&set.*(\{\d\}){2,}\\\"\s+?\-f.*&&.*cmd.*\/c'}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabledd', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
detection: {u'selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains': [u'powercat ', u'powercat.ps1']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Netcat The Powershell Version

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions
detection: {u'selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u' = ServerRemoteHost ', u'wsmprovhost.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Remote PowerShell Session

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
detection: {u'download': {u'ContextInfo|contains': [u'.DownloadFile(', u'.DownloadString(']}, u'webclient': {u'ContextInfo|contains': u'System.Net.WebClient'}, u'condition': u'webclient and download'}
falsepositives: [PowerShell scripts that download content from the Internet]
title: Suspicious PowerShell Download

author: Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
detection: {u'encoded': {u'ContextInfo|contains': [u' -enc ', u' -EncodedCommand ']}, u'hidden': {u'ContextInfo|contains': [u' -w hidden ', u' -window hidden ', u' -windowstyle hidden ']}, u'condition': u'all of them', u'noninteractive': {u'ContextInfo|contains': [u' -noni ', u' -noninteractive ']}}
falsepositives: [Penetration tests, Very special / sneaky PowerShell scripts]
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic

author: Florian Roth (rule), Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
detection: {u'iex_webclient': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u'iex', u'New-Object', u'Net.WebClient', u'.Download']}, u'enc_selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u' -w ', u'hidden', u'-ep', u'bypass', u'-Enc']}, u'reg_selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u'powershell', u'reg', u'add', u'HKCU\software\microsoft\windows\currentversion\run']}, u'iex_selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u' -w ', u'hidden', u'-noni', u'-nop', u' -c ', u'iex', u'New-Object']}, u'webclient_selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u'bypass', u'-noprofile', u'-windowstyle', u'hidden', u'new-object', u'system.net.webclient', u'.download']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'convert_b64': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u'-nop', u' -w ', u'hidden', u' -c ', u'[Convert]::FromBase64String']}}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific

author: frack113
description: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe is an abusable, signed PowerShell host executable that was introduced in Windows 10 and Server 2019 (OS Build 17763.1339).
detection: {u'selection_cmd': {u'ContextInfo|contains': u'Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand '}, u'selection_opt': {u'ContextInfo|contains': [u'-ModuleName ', u'-ModulePath ', u'-ScriptBlock ', u'-RemoteFXvGPUDisablementFilePath']}, u'condition': u'selection_cmd and selection_opt'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabledd', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Abusable Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand

author: frack113
description: Use living off the land tools to zip a file and stage it in the Windows temporary folder for later exfiltration
detection: {u'selection_4103': {u'ContextInfo|contains|all': [u'Compress-Archive ', u' -Path ', u' -DestinationPath ', u'$env:TEMP\']}, u'condition': u'selection_4103'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_module', u'definition': u'PowerShell Module Logging must be enabledd', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, OSCD Community
description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ContextInfo|contains': u'SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
related: [{u'type': u'derived', u'id': u'fde7929d-8beb-4a4c-b922-be9974671667'}, {u'type': u'derived', u'id': u'9f7aa113-9da6-4a8d-907c-5f1a4b908299'}]
title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction

author: Florian Roth, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImagePath|contains': [u'fgexec', u'dumpsvc', u'cachedump', u'mimidrv', u'gsecdump', u'servpw', u'pwdump']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator using credential dumping tool for password recovery]
tags: [attack.credential_access, attack.execution, attack.t1003, attack.t1003.001, attack.t1003.002, attack.t1003.004, attack.t1003.005, attack.t1003.006, attack.t1035, attack.t1569.002, attack.s0005]
title: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Ecco, Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation
detection: {u'selection': [{u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['cmd', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['%COMSPEC%', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['cmd.exe', '/c', 'echo', '\\pipe\\']}, {u'ImagePath|contains|all': ['rundll32', '.dll,a', '/p:']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service
detection: {u'powershell_as_service': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': [u'powershell', u'pwsh']}, u'condition': u'powershell_as_service'}
title: PowerShell Scripts Run by a Services

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': u'\Temp\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [there is a relevant set of false positives depending on applications in the environment]
title: Suspicious Driver Load from Temp

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the load of the vulnerable Dell BIOS update driver as reported in CVE-2021-21551
detection: {u'selection_image': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': u'\DBUtil_2_3.Sys'}, u'condition': u'selection_image or selection_hash', u'selection_hash': {u'Hashes|contains': [u'0296e2ce999e67c76352613a718e11516fe1b0efc3ffdb8918fc999dd76a73a5', u'c948ae14761095e4d76b55d9de86412258be7afd', u'c996d7971c49252c582171d9380360f2', u'ddbf5ecca5c8086afde1fb4f551e9e6400e94f4428fe7fb5559da5cffa654cc1', u'10b30bdee43b3a2ec4aa63375577ade650269d25', u'd2fd132ab7bbc6bbb87a84f026fa0244']}}
title: Vulnerable Dell BIOS Update Driver Load

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the load of the Windiver driver, a powerful user-mode capture/sniffing/modification/blocking/re-injection package for Windows
detection: {u'selection': {u'ImageLoaded|contains': [u'\WinDivert.sys', u'\WinDivert64.sys']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WinDivert Driver Load

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework
detection: {u'selection': {u'Signature|contains': [u'MeteTool', u'MPreter', u'Meterpreter', u'Metasploit', u'PowerSploit', u'CobaltSrike', u'Swrort', u'Rozena', u'Backdoor.Cobalt', u'CobaltStr', u'COBEACON', u'Cometer', u'Razy']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a hack tool or other attack tool
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Signature|startswith': ['HTOOL', 'HKTL', 'SecurityTool', 'ATK/']}, {u'Signature|contains': ['Hacktool']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Antivirus Hacktool Detection

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a password dumper
detection: {u'selection': {u'Signature|contains': [u'DumpCreds', u'Mimikatz', u'PWCrack', u'HTool/WCE', u'PSWtool', u'PWDump', u'SecurityTool', u'PShlSpy', u'Rubeus', u'Kekeo', u'LsassDump', u'Outflank']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Antivirus Password Dumper Detection

author: Sittikorn S, Nuttakorn T
description: Detects the suspicious file that is created from PoC code against Windows Print Spooler Remote Code Execution Vulnerability CVE-2021-34527 (PrinterNightmare), CVE-2021-1675 .
detection: {u'selection': {u'FileName|contains': u'C:\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\x64\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Antivirus PrinterNightmare CVE-2021-34527 Exploit Detection

author: Florian Roth, Arnim Rupp
description: Detects an Antivirus alert in a highly relevant file path or with a relevant file name
detection: {u'selection': [{u'FileName|startswith': ['C:\\Windows\\', 'C:\\Temp\\', 'C:\\PerfLogs\\', 'C:\\Users\\Public\\', 'C:\\Users\\Default\\']}, {u'FileName|contains': ['\\Client\\', '\\tsclient\\', '\\inetpub\\', '/www/', 'apache', 'tomcat', 'nginx', 'weblogic']}], u'selection2': {u'Filename|endswith': [u'.ps1', u'.psm1', u'.vbs', u'.bat', u'.cmd', u'.sh', u'.chm', u'.xml', u'.txt', u'.jsp', u'.jspx', u'.asp', u'.aspx', u'.ashx', u'.asax', u'.asmx', u'.php', u'.cfm', u'.py', u'.pyc', u'.pl', u'.rb', u'.cgi', u'.war', u'.ear', u'.hta', u'.lnk', u'.scf', u'.sct', u'.vbe', u'.wsf', u'.wsh', u'.gif', u'.png', u'.jpg', u'.jpeg', u'.svg', u'.dat']}, u'condition': u'selection or selection2'}
title: Antivirus Relevant File Paths Alerts

author: Florian Roth, Arnim Rupp
description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a web shell. It's highly recommended to tune this rule to the specific strings used by your anti virus solution by downloading a big webshell repo from e.g. github and checking the matches.
