detection: {u'selection': [{u'Signature|startswith': ['PHP/', 'JSP/', 'ASP/', 'Perl/', 'PHP.', 'JSP.', 'ASP.', 'Perl.', 'VBS/Uxor', 'IIS/BackDoor', 'JAVA/Backdoor', 'Troj/ASP', 'Troj/PHP', 'Troj/JSP']}, {u'Signature|contains': ['Webshell', 'Chopper', 'SinoChoper', 'ASPXSpy', 'Aspdoor', 'filebrowser', 'PHP_', 'JSP_', 'ASP_', 'PHP:', 'JSP:', 'ASP:', 'Perl:', 'PHPShell', 'Trojan.PHP', 'Trojan.ASP', 'Trojan.JSP', 'Trojan.VBS', 'PHP?Agent', 'ASP?Agent', 'JSP?Agent', 'VBS?Agent', 'Backdoor?PHP', 'Backdoor?JSP', 'Backdoor?ASP', 'Backdoor?VBS', 'Backdoor?Java']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Antivirus Web Shell Detection

author: NVISO
description: Detects Octopus Scanner Malware.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Cache134.dat', u'\AppData\Local\Microsoft\ExplorerSync.db']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Octopus Scanner Malware

author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick)
description: Attempts to detect system changes made by Blue Mockingbird
detection: {u'wmic_cmd': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wmic.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': u'COR_PROFILER'}, u'sc_cmd': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'sc config', u'wercplsupporte.dll']}, u'condition': u'sc_cmd or wmic_cmd'}
title: Blue Mockingbird

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects DarkSide Ransomware and helpers
detection: {u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'=[char][byte]('0x'+', u' -work worker0 -path ']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'Image|contains': [u'\AppData\Local\Temp\'], u'ParentCommandLine|contains': [u'DllHost.exe /Processid:{3E5FC7F9-9A51-4367-9063-A120244FBEC7}']}}
falsepositives: [Unknown, UAC bypass method used by other malware]
title: DarkSide Ransomware Pattern

author: Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community
description: Detects LockerGoga Ransomware command line.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'-i SM-tgytutrc -s'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: LockerGoga Ransomware

author: Vasiliy Burov
description: Detects Ryuk Ransomware command lines
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\net.exe', u'\net1.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'samss', u'audioendpointbuilder', u'unistoresvc_?????'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'stop']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Ryuk Ransomware

author: Trent Liffick
description: Detects the presence of a registry key created during Azorult execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'EventID': [12, 13], u'TargetObject|contains': u'SYSTEM\', u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\services\localNETService'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Registry Entries For Azorult Malware

author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick)
description: Attempts to detect system changes made by Blue Mockingbird
detection: {u'mod_reg': {u'TargetObject|endswith': u'\CurrentControlSet\Services\wercplsupport\Parameters\ServiceDll'}, u'condition': u'mod_reg'}
title: Blue Mockingbird

author: NVISO
description: Detects FlowCloud malware from threat group TA410.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'TargetObject': ['HKLM\\HARDWARE\\{804423C2-F490-4ac3-BFA5-13DEDE63A71A}', 'HKLM\\HARDWARE\\{A5124AF5-DF23-49bf-B0ED-A18ED3DEA027}', 'HKLM\\HARDWARE\\{2DB80286-1784-48b5-A751-B6ED1F490303}']}, {u'TargetObject|startswith': ['HKLM\\SYSTEM\\Setup\\PrintResponsor\\']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: FlowCloud Malware

author: Christopher Peacock
description: Attempts to detect registry events for common NetWire key HKCU\Software\NetWire
detection: {u'selection1': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\software\NetWire'}, u'condition': u'selection1'}
title: NetWire RAT Registry Key
Note: You likely will have to change the sysmon configuration file. Per SwiftOnSecurity "Because Sysmon runs as a service, it has no filtering ability for, or concept of, HKCU or HKEY_CURRENT_USER. Use "contains" or "end with" to get around this limitation" Therefore I set <TargetObject condition="contains">netwire</TargetObjecct> in my configuration.

author: megan201296
description: Detects new registry key created by Ursnif malware.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetObject|contains': u'\Software\AppDataLow\Software\Microsoft\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Ursnif

author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure)
description: Detects creation of WMI event subscription persistence method
detection: {u'condition': u'selector', u'selector': {u'EventID': [19, 20, 21]}}
falsepositives: [exclude legitimate (vetted) use of WMI event subscription in your network]
title: WMI Event Subscription

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious encoded payloads in WMI Event Consumers
detection: {u'selection_destination': {u'Destination|base64offset|contains': [u'WriteProcessMemory', u'This program cannot be run in DOS mode', u'This program must be run under Win32']}, u'condition': u'selection_destination'}
title: Suspicious Encoded Scripts in a WMI Consumer

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects suspicious scripting in WMI Event Consumers
detection: {u'selection_destination': [{u'Destination|contains|all': ['new-object', 'net.webclient', '.downloadstring']}, {u'Destination|contains|all': ['new-object', 'net.webclient', '.downloadfile']}, {u'Destination|contains': [' iex(', 'WScript.shell', ' -nop ', ' -noprofile ', ' -decode ', ' -enc ']}, {u'Destination|contains': ['WScript.Shell', 'System.Security.Cryptography.FromBase64Transform']}], u'condition': u'selection_destination'}
title: Suspicious Scripting in a WMI Consumer

author: @ROxPinTeddy
description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\Advanced IP Scanner 2'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Advanced IP Scanner

author: @41thexplorer, Microsoft Defender ATP
description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'ds7002.lnk'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018

author: Sittikorn S
description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Windows CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 vulnerability and DevilsTongue malware by threat group Sourgum
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'C:\Windows\system32\physmem.sys', u'C:\Windows\System32\IME\IMEJP\imjpueact.dll', u'C:\Windows\system32\ime\IMETC\IMTCPROT.DLL', u'C:\Windows\system32\ime\SHARED\imecpmeid.dll', u'C:\Windows\system32\config\spp\ServiceState\Recovery\pac.dat', u'C:\Windows\system32\config\cy-GB\Setup\SKB\InputMethod\TupTask.dat', u'C:\Windows\system32\config\config\startwus.dat', u'C:\Windows\system32\ime\SHARED\WimBootConfigurations.ini', u'C:\Windows\system32\ime\IMEJP\WimBootConfigurations.ini', u'C:\Windows\system32\ime\IMETC\WimBootConfigurations.ini']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 Exploits by Sourgum

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: This rule will monitor executable and script file creation by office applications. Please add more file extensions or magic bytes to the logic of your choice.
detection: {u'selection3': {u'FileMagicBytes|startswith': [u'4D5A']}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and (selection2 or selection3)', u'selection2': {u'FileName|endswith': [u'.exe', u'.dll', u'.ocx', u'.com', u'.ps1', u'.vbs', u'.sys', u'.bat', u'.scr', u'.proj']}}
title: File Creation by Office Applications

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename': u'C:\Windows\Temp\dumpert.dmp'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Dumpert Process Dumper

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker's machine
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\lsass.dmp'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CreateMiniDump Hacktool

author: Florian Roth, Tom Ueltschi, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects javaw.exe in AppData folder as used by Adwind / JRAT
detection: {u'selection': [{u'TargetFilename|contains|all': ['\\AppData\\Roaming\\Oracle\\bin\\java', '.exe']}, {u'TargetFilename|contains|all': ['\\Retrive', '.vbs']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Adwind RAT / JRAT

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects the use of Moriya rootkit as described in the securelist's Operation TunnelSnake report
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename': u'C:\Windows\System32\drivers\MoriyaStreamWatchmen.sys'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Moriya Rootkit

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'updata.exe', u'TargetFilename': u'C:\Windows\oci.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Pingback Backdoor

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: This rule will monitor executable and script file creation by office applications. Please add more file extensions or magic bytes to the logic of your choice.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'TargetFileName|endswith': [u'.exe', u'.dll', u'.ocx', u'.com', u'.ps1', u'.vbs', u'.sys', u'.bat', u'.scr', u'.proj']}}
title: Created Files by Office Applications

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)
detection: {u'sysmon_filecreation': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\PSEXESVC.exe'}, u'condition': u'sysmon_filecreation'}
fields: [EventID, CommandLine, ParentCommandLine, ServiceName, ServiceFileName, TargetFilename, PipeName]
title: PsExec Tool Execution

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Users\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'\AppData\Local\Temp\system32\winsat.exe', u'\AppData\Local\Temp\system32\winmm.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - File

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
detection: {u'selection1': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Users\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\OskSupport.dll'}, u'condition': u'1 of selection*', u'selection2': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\system32\DllHost.exe', u'TargetFilename': u'C:\Program Files\Windows Media Player\osk.exe'}}
title: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - File

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)
detection: {u'system_files': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'WsmPty.xsl', u'WsmTxt.xsl']}, u'in_system_folder': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\']}, u'condition': u'system_files and not in_system_folder'}
title: AWL Bypass with Winrm.vbs and Malicious WsmPty.xsl/WsmTxt.xsl

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'System', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\wbem\wbemcomn.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack

author: Sander Wiebing
description: Detects the creation of a executable with a system process name in a suspicious folder
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\Windows\System32\dism.exe'], u'TargetFilename|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\system32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWow64\', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\', u'C:\Windows\winsxs\', u'C:\Windows\WinSxS\', u'\SystemRoot\System32\']}, u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'\svchost.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\services.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\spoolsv.exe', u'\lsass.exe', u'\smss.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\conhost.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\lsm.exe', u'\winlogon.exe', u'\explorer.exe', u'\taskhost.exe', u'\Taskmgr.exe', u'\taskmgr.exe', u'\sihost.exe', u'\RuntimeBroker.exe', u'\runtimebroker.exe', u'\smartscreen.exe', u'\dllhost.exe', u'\audiodg.exe', u'\wlanext.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [System processes copied outside the default folder]
title: File Created with System Process Name

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Files with well-known filenames (parts of credential dump software or files produced by them) creation
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'\pwdump', u'\kirbi', u'\pwhashes', u'\wce_ccache', u'\wce_krbtkts', u'\fgdump-log'], u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'\test.pwd', u'\lsremora64.dll', u'\lsremora.dll', u'\fgexec.exe', u'\wceaux.dll', u'\SAM.out', u'\SECURITY.out', u'\SYSTEM.out', u'\NTDS.out', u'\DumpExt.dll', u'\DumpSvc.exe', u'\cachedump64.exe', u'\cachedump.exe', u'\pstgdump.exe', u'\servpw.exe', u'\servpw64.exe', u'\pwdump.exe', u'\procdump64.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator using tool for password recovery]
tags: [attack.credential_access, attack.t1003, attack.t1003.001, attack.t1003.002, attack.t1003.003, attack.t1003.004, attack.t1003.005]
title: Cred Dump Tools Dropped Files

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects possible successful exploitation for vulnerability described in CVE-2021-26858 by looking for | creation of non-standard files on disk by Exchange Server’s Unified Messaging service | which could indicate dropping web shells or other malicious content
detection: {u'filter': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'CacheCleanup.bin', u'.txt', u'.LOG', u'.cfg', u'cleanup.bin']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'UMWorkerProcess.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: CVE-2021-26858 Exchange Exploitation

author: Subhash Popuri (@pbssubhash)
description: Powerup tool's Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation. In it's default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command. The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.bat'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Pentest, Any powershell script that creates bat files]
title: Powerup Write Hijack DLL

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects possible SafetyKatz Behaviour
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\Temp\debug.bin'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Detection of SafetyKatz

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: LSASS memory dump creation using operating systems utilities. Procdump will use process name in output file if no name is specified
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'lsass', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'dmp'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Dumping lsass memory for forensic investigation purposes by legitimate incident responder or forensic invetigator, Dumps of another process that contains lsass in its process name (substring)]
title: LSASS Memory Dump File Creation

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Ryan Plas (rule), oscd.community
description: Search for dropping of files to Windows/Program Files fodlers by non-priviledged processes
detection: {u'windows': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'\Windows\'}, u'program_files': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'\Program Files\', u'\Program Files (x86)\']}, u'integrity': {u'IntegrityLevel': u'Medium'}, u'temp': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'temp'}, u'condition': u'integrity and (program_files or windows and not temp)'}
title: Files Dropped to Program Files by Non-Priviledged Process

author: NVISO
description: Detects add-ins that load when Microsoft Word or Excel starts (.wll/.xll are simply .dll fit for Word or Excel).
detection: {u'xlldropped': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Microsoft\Excel\Startup\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.xll'}, u'generic': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Microsoft\Addins\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'.xlam', u'.xla']}, u'wlldropped': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Microsoft\Word\Startup\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.wll'}, u'condition': u'(wlldropped or xlldropped or generic)'}
title: Microsoft Office Add-In Loading

author: Tobias Michalski
description: Detects the creation of new Outlook form which can contain malicious code
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'\outlook.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\appdata\local\microsoft\FORMS\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Outlook Form Installation

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: Detects processes creating temp files related to PCRE.NET package
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\ba9ea7344a4a5f591d6e5dc32a13494b\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PCRE.NET Package Temp Files

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects the creation of known powershell scripts for exploitation
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'\Invoke-DllInjection.ps1', u'\Invoke-WmiCommand.ps1', u'\Get-GPPPassword.ps1', u'\Get-Keystrokes.ps1', u'\Get-VaultCredential.ps1', u'\Invoke-CredentialInjection.ps1', u'\Invoke-Mimikatz.ps1', u'\Invoke-NinjaCopy.ps1', u'\Invoke-TokenManipulation.ps1', u'\Out-Minidump.ps1', u'\VolumeShadowCopyTools.ps1', u'\Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection.ps1', u'\Get-TimedScreenshot.ps1', u'\Invoke-UserHunter.ps1', u'\Find-GPOLocation.ps1', u'\Invoke-ACLScanner.ps1', u'\Invoke-DowngradeAccount.ps1', u'\Get-ServiceUnquoted.ps1', u'\Get-ServiceFilePermission.ps1', u'\Get-ServicePermission.ps1', u'\Invoke-ServiceAbuse.ps1', u'\Install-ServiceBinary.ps1', u'\Get-RegAutoLogon.ps1', u'\Get-VulnAutoRun.ps1', u'\Get-VulnSchTask.ps1', u'\Get-UnattendedInstallFile.ps1', u'\Get-WebConfig.ps1', u'\Get-ApplicationHost.ps1', u'\Get-RegAlwaysInstallElevated.ps1', u'\Get-Unconstrained.ps1', u'\Add-RegBackdoor.ps1', u'\Add-ScrnSaveBackdoor.ps1', u'\Gupt-Backdoor.ps1', u'\Invoke-ADSBackdoor.ps1', u'\Enabled-DuplicateToken.ps1', u'\Invoke-PsUaCme.ps1', u'\Remove-Update.ps1', u'\Check-VM.ps1', u'\Get-LSASecret.ps1', u'\Get-PassHashes.ps1', u'\Show-TargetScreen.ps1', u'\Port-Scan.ps1', u'\Invoke-PoshRatHttp.ps1', u'\Invoke-PowerShellTCP.ps1', u'\Invoke-PowerShellWMI.ps1', u'\Add-Exfiltration.ps1', u'\Add-Persistence.ps1', u'\Do-Exfiltration.ps1', u'\Start-CaptureServer.ps1', u'\Invoke-ShellCode.ps1', u'\Get-ChromeDump.ps1', u'\Get-ClipboardContents.ps1', u'\Get-FoxDump.ps1', u'\Get-IndexedItem.ps1', u'\Get-Screenshot.ps1', u'\Invoke-Inveigh.ps1', u'\Invoke-NetRipper.ps1', u'\Invoke-EgressCheck.ps1', u'\Invoke-PostExfil.ps1', u'\Invoke-PSInject.ps1', u'\Invoke-RunAs.ps1', u'\MailRaider.ps1', u'\New-HoneyHash.ps1', u'\Set-MacAttribute.ps1', u'\Invoke-DCSync.ps1', u'\Invoke-PowerDump.ps1', u'\Exploit-Jboss.ps1', u'\Invoke-ThunderStruck.ps1', u'\Invoke-VoiceTroll.ps1', u'\Set-Wallpaper.ps1', u'\Invoke-InveighRelay.ps1', u'\Invoke-PsExec.ps1', u'\Invoke-SSHCommand.ps1', u'\Get-SecurityPackages.ps1', u'\Install-SSP.ps1', u'\Invoke-BackdoorLNK.ps1', u'\PowerBreach.ps1', u'\Get-SiteListPassword.ps1', u'\Get-System.ps1', u'\Invoke-BypassUAC.ps1', u'\Invoke-Tater.ps1', u'\Invoke-WScriptBypassUAC.ps1', u'\PowerUp.ps1', u'\PowerView.ps1', u'\Get-RickAstley.ps1', u'\Find-Fruit.ps1', u'\HTTP-Login.ps1', u'\Find-TrustedDocuments.ps1', u'\Invoke-Paranoia.ps1', u'\Invoke-WinEnum.ps1', u'\Invoke-ARPScan.ps1', u'\Invoke-PortScan.ps1', u'\Invoke-ReverseDNSLookup.ps1', u'\Invoke-SMBScanner.ps1', u'\Invoke-Mimikittenz.ps1']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlet Names

author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE
description: Attempts to detect PowerShell writing startup shortcuts. This procedure was highlighted in Red Canary Intel Insights Oct. 2021, "We frequently observe adversaries using PowerShell to write malicious .lnk files into the startup directory to establish persistence. Accordingly, this detection opportunity is likely to identify persistence mechanisms in multiple threats. In the context of Yellow Cockatoo, this persistence mechanism eventually launches the command-line script that leads to the installation of a malicious DLL"
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\start menu\programs\startup\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.lnk'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unknown, Depending on your environment accepted applications may leverage this at times. It is recomended to search for anomolies inidicative of malware.]
title: PowerShell Writing Startup Shortcuts

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a dump file written by QuarksPwDump password dumper
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains|all': [u'\AppData\Local\Temp\SAM-', u'.dmp']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: QuarksPwDump Dump File

author: Alexander Rausch
description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'gthread-3.6.dll', u'sigcmm-2.4.dll', u'\Windows\Temp\tmp.bat']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Dropped File

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\StartUp'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Startup Folder File Write

author: HieuTT35
description: Detects a change in profile.ps1 of the Powershell profile
detection: {u'target2': {u'TargetFilename|contains|all': [u'C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\', u'\profile.ps1']}, u'condition': u'target1 or target2', u'target1': {u'TargetFilename|contains|all': [u'\My Documents\PowerShell\', u'\profile.ps1']}}
title: Powershell Profile.ps1 Modification

author: xknow @xknow_infosec
description: Detects the usage of ADSI (LDAP) operations by tools. This may also detect tools like LDAPFragger.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Local\Microsoft\Windows\SchCache\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.sch'}, u'selection_2': {u'Image': [u'C:\windows\system32\svchost.exe', u'C:\windows\system32\dllhost.exe', u'C:\windows\system32\mmc.exe', u'C:\windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe', u'C:\Windows\CCM\CcmExec.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and not selection_2'}
falsepositives: [Other legimate tools, which do ADSI (LDAP) operations, e.g. any remoting activity by MMC, Powershell, Windows etc.]
title: Suspicious ADSI-Cache Usage By Unknown Tool

author: omkar72, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious .NET assembly executions
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'mshta', u'cscript', u'wscript', u'regsvr32', u'wmic'], u'TargetFilename|contains|all': [u'\AppData\Local\Microsoft\CLR', u'\UsageLogs\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspcious CLR Logs Creation

author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut)
description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder's content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image': [u'C:\Windows\explorer.exe', u'C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe', u'C:\Windows\System32\mmc.exe']}, u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\desktop.ini'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Operations performed through Windows SCCM or equivalent]
title: Suspicious desktop.ini Action

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A general detection for processes creating PFX files. This could be an indicator of an adversary exporting a local certificate to a PFX file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.pfx'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious PFX File Creation

author: xknow (@xknow_infosec), xorxes (@xor_xes)
description: Detects the creation of the PROCEXP152.sys file in the application-data local temporary folder. This driver is used by Sysinternals Process Explorer but also by KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU) or Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'PROCEXP152.sys'}, u'selection_2': {u'Image|contains': [u'\procexp64.exe', u'\procexp.exe', u'\procmon64.exe', u'\procmon.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and not selection_2'}
falsepositives: [Other legimate tools using this driver and filename (like Sysinternals). Note - Clever attackers may easily bypass this detection by just renaming the driver filename. Therefore just Medium-level and don't rely on it.]
title: Suspicious PROCEXP152.sys File Created In TMP

author: Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects the usage of tsclient share to place a backdoor on the RDP source machine's startup folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\mstsc.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Hijack Legit RDP Session to Move Laterally

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Windows\System32\consent.exe.@', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\comctl32.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - File

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using .NET Code Profiler and mmc.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 39)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Users\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\pe386.dll'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using .NET Code Profiler on MMC

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\IEInstal.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Users\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'consent.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using IEInstal - File

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Users\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\pkgmgr.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - File

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Users\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\api-ms-win-core-kernel32-legacy-l1.DLL'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - File

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Possible webshell file creation on a static web site
detection: {u'selection_3': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'.asp', u'.ashx', u'.ph']}, u'selection_6': [{u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.jsp'}, {u'TargetFilename|contains|all': ['\\cgi-bin\\', '.pl']}], u'selection_2': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\inetpub\wwwroot\'}, u'false_positives': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'\Windows\Temp\']}, u'selection_4': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'\www\', u'\htdocs\', u'\html\']}, u'selection_5': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'.ph'}, u'condition': u'(selection_2 and selection_3 and not false_positives) or (selection_4 and selection_5 and not false_positives) or (selection_6 and not false_positives)'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate administrator or developer creating legitimate executable files in a web application folder]
title: Windows Webshell Creation

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects file writes of WMI script event consumer
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'C:\WINDOWS\system32\wbem\scrcons.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer File Write

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the default filename used in PoC code against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'C:\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\x64\3\old\1\123', u'C:\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\x64\3\New\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation Filename Pattern

author: Florian Roth, Sittikorn S
description: Detects file creation patterns noticeable during the exploitation of CVE-2021-40444
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'\winword.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Windows\INetCache', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.cab'}, u'selection_inf': {u'Image': u'\winword.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains|all': [u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'.inf']}, u'condition': u'selection or selection_inf'}
title: Suspicious Word Cab File Write CVE-2021-40444

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects files written by the different tools that exploit HiveNightmare
detection: {u'selection': [{u'TargetFilename|contains': ['\\hive_sam_', '\\SAM-2021-', '\\SAM-2022-', '\\SAM-haxx', '\\Sam.save']}, {u'TargetFilename': ['C:\\windows\\temp\\sam']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Typical HiveNightmare SAM File Export

author: @ScoubiMtl
description: Detects the creation of a macro file for Outlook. Goes with win_outlook_c2_registry_key. VbaProject.OTM is explicitly mentioned in T1137. Particularly interesting if both events Registry & File Creation happens at the same time.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'\Microsoft\Outlook\VbaProject.OTM'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [User genuinly creates a VB Macro for their email]
title: Outlook C2 Macro Creation

author: Aaron Greetham (@beardofbinary) - NCC Group
description: Detects Rclone config file being created
detection: {u'file_selection': {u'TargetFilename|contains|all': [u':\Users\', u'\.config\rclone\']}, u'condition': u'file_selection'}
title: Rclone Config File Creation

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr file creation that stores a file to a suspicious location or contains a file with a suspicious extension
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'svchost.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'\Personalization\LockScreenImage\'}, u'filter1': {u'TargetFilename|contains': u'C:\Windows\'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter1 and not filter2', u'filter2': {u'TargetFilename|contains': [u'.jpg', u'.jpeg', u'.png']}}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Target File

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018
detection: {u'selection_process2': {u'Image|contains': u'\Windows\Temp\DB\', u'Image|endswith': u'.exe'}, u'selection_process3': {u'ParentImage|contains': u'\Autoit', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\nslookup.exe', u'-q=TXT']}, u'selection_process0': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'\Service.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': [u'i', u'u']}, u'selection_process1': [{u'CommandLine|endswith': u'\microsoft\Taskbar\autoit3.exe'}, {u'CommandLine|startswith': u'C:\wsc.exe'}], u'condition': u'1 of them'}
tags: [attack.persistence, attack.g0049, attack.t1053, attack.t1053.005, attack.s0111, attack.t1050, attack.t1543.003, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1112, attack.command_and_control, attack.t1071, attack.t1071.004]
title: Chafer Activity

author: Sreeman
description: Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections. This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run. The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|re': u'(?i).*schtasks.*(-|\/)r.*\\\\Application Experience\\\\Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser.*'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Abusing Windows Telemetry For Persistence

author: @ROxPinTeddy
description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': u'\advanced_ip_scanner'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Advanced IP Scanner

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may use NTFS file attributes to hide their malicious data in order to evade detection
detection: {u'selection_tools_esentutl': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'esentutl ', u' /y ', u' /d ', u' /o ']}, u'selection_tools_regedit': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'regedit ', u' /E ']}, u'selection_tools_makecab': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'makecab ', u'.cab']}, u'selection_tools_type': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'type ', u' > ']}, u'selection_stream': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'txt:'}, u'selection_tools_reg': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'reg ', u' export ']}, u'condition': u'selection_stream and (1 of selection_tools_*)'}
title: Execute From Alternate Data Streams

author: Tim Burrell
description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.
detection: {u'legitimate_process_path': {u'Image|contains': [u':\Program Files(x86)\', u':\Program Files\']}, u'condition': u'legitimate_executable and not legitimate_process_path', u'legitimate_executable': {u'sha1': [u'e570585edc69f9074cb5e8a790708336bd45ca0f']}}
title: GALLIUM Artefacts

author: Tim Burrell
description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.
title: GALLIUM Artefacts

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Pandemic Windows Implant
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'loaddll -a '}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Pandemic Registry Key

author: Florian Roth, Bartlomiej Czyz (@bczyz1)
description: Detects the deactivation and disabling of the Scheduled defragmentation task as seen by Slingshot APT group
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\schtasks.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'/delete', u'/change'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/TN', u'\Microsoft\Windows\Defrag\ScheduledDefrag']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Defrag Deactivation

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': [u'net use \\%DomainController%\C$ "P@ssw0rd" *', u'dir c:\\*.doc* /s', u'dir %TEMP%\\*.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.g0010, attack.execution, attack.t1059, attack.lateral_movement, attack.t1077, attack.t1021.002, attack.discovery, attack.t1083, attack.t1135]
title: Turla Group Lateral Movement

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group
detection: {u'netCommand3': {u'CommandLine': u'net share'}, u'netCommand2': {u'CommandLine': u'net session'}, u'netCommand1': {u'CommandLine': u'net view /DOMAIN'}, u'condition': u'netCommand1 | near netCommand2 and netCommand3', u'timeframe': u'1m'}
tags: [attack.g0010, attack.execution, attack.t1059, attack.lateral_movement, attack.t1077, attack.t1021.002, attack.discovery, attack.t1083, attack.t1135]
title: Turla Group Lateral Movement

author: Florian Roth, frack113
description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'checkadmin.exe 127.0.0.1 -all', u'netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name=powershell dir=in', u'cmd /c powershell.exe -ep bypass -file c:\s.ps1', u'/tn win32times /f', u'create win32times binPath=', u'\c$\windows\system32\devmgr.dll', u' -exec bypass -enc JgAg', u'type *keepass\KeePass.config.xml', u'iie.exe iie.txt', u'reg query HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\\*\PuTTY\Sessions\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrators that use checkadmin.exe tool to enumerate local administrators]
tags: [attack.discovery, attack.t1012, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1036.004, attack.t1036, attack.t1027, attack.execution, attack.t1053.005, attack.t1053, attack.t1059.001, attack.t1086]
title: Operation Wocao Activity

author: frack113
description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.
detection: {u'selection_dir': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'dir ', u' /b ', u' /s ']}, u'selection_findstr': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' /e ', u'OriginalFileName': u'FINDSTR.EXE'}, u'condition': u'selection_ext and (selection_dir or selection_findstr)', u'selection_ext': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.doc', u'.docx', u'.xls', u'.xlsx', u'.ppt', u'.pptx', u'.rtf', u'.pdf', u'.txt']}}
title: Automated Collection Command Prompt

author: Alfie Champion (ajpc500)
description: F-Secure C3 produces DLLs with a default exported StartNodeRelay function.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'rundll32.exe', u'.dll', u'StartNodeRelay']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: F-Secure C3 Load by Rundll32

author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\certoc.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-LoadDLL', u'.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Load DLL via CertOC.exe

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may collect data stored in the clipboard from users copying information within or between applications.
detection: {u'selection': {u'OriginalFileName': u'clip.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Use of CLIP

author: Wojciech Lesicki
description: Rundll32 can be use by Cobalt Strike with StartW function to load DLLs from the command line.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'rundll32.exe', u'.dll', u'StartW']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CobaltStrike Load by Rundll32

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: Initial execution of malicious document calls wmic Win32_Process::Create to execute the file with regsvr32
detection: {u'selection1': {u'EventType': u'WMIExecution', u'WMIcommand|contains': u'Win32_Process\:\:Create', u'EventLog': u'EDR'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\excel.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe']}}
title: WMI Command Execution by Office Applications

author: frack113
description: Conti ransomware command line ioc
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-m ', u'-net ', u'-size ', u'-nomutex ', u'-p \\', u'$']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Conti Ransomware Execution

author: frack113
description: Detects a command used by conti to dump database
detection: {u'selection_tools': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'sqlcmd ', u'sqlcmd.exe']}, u'selection_query': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'sys.sysprocesses', u'master.dbo.sysdatabases', u'BACKUP DATABASE']}, u'selection_svr': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -S localhost '}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
title: Conti Backup Database

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may search for private key certificate files on compromised systems for insecurely stored credential
detection: {u'selection_exe': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'dir ', u'findstr ']}, u'condition': u'selection_exe and selection_ext', u'selection_ext': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.key', u'.pgp', u'.gpg', u'.ppk', u'.p12', u'.pem', u'.pfx', u'.cer', u'.p7b', u'.asc']}}
title: Discover Private Keys

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the installation of a plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)
detection: {u'dnsadmin': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dnscmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/config', u'/serverlevelplugindll']}, u'condition': u'dnsadmin'}
title: DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Install

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: dotnet.exe will execute any DLL and execute unsigned code
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\dotnet.exe'], u'CommandLine|endswith': [u'.dll', u'.csproj']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Dotnet.exe Exec Dll and Execute Unsigned Code LOLBIN

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory
detection: {u'selection': {u'Imphash': u'09D278F9DE118EF09163C6140255C690'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Dumpert Process Dumper

author: frack113
description: Executes SCT script using scrobj.dll from a command in entered into a specially prepared INF file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'InfDefaultInstall.exe ', u'.inf']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: InfDefaultInstall.exe .inf Execution

author: Ialle Teixeira @teixeira0xfffff, Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects when a user performs data exfiltration by using DataSvcUtil.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\DataSvcUtil.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/in:', u'/out:']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [DataSvcUtil.exe being used may be performed by a system administrator., Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment., DataSvcUtil.exe being executed from unfamiliar users should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule., Penetration Testing]
title: LOLBAS Data Exfiltration by DataSvcUtil.exe

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: This rule will monitor any office apps that spins up a new LOLBin process. This activity is pretty suspicious and should be investigated.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'regsvr32', u'rundll32', u'msiexec', u'mshta', u'verclsid']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}}
title: New Lolbin Process by Office Applications

author: Hai Vaknin @LuxNoBulIshit, Avihay eldad  @aloneliassaf, Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects when a possible suspicious driver is being installed via pnputil.exe lolbin
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\pnputil.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-i', u'/install', u'-a', u'/add-driver', u'.inf']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Pnputil.exe being used may be performed by a system administrator., Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment., Pnputil.exe being executed from unfamiliar users should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule., Penetration Testing]
title: Suspicious Driver Install by pnputil.exe

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: This rule will monitor LOLBin process creations by wmiprvse. Add more LOLBins to rule logic if needed.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'regsvr32', u'rundll32', u'msiexec', u'mshta', u'verclsid']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe'}}
title: Lolbins Process Creation with WmiPrvse

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Detects file execution using the msdeploy.exe lolbin
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\msdeploy.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'verb:sync', u'-source:RunCommand', u'-dest:runCommand']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Execute Files with Msdeploy.exe

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: Initial execution of malicious document calls wmic to execute the file with regsvr32
detection: {u'selection1': [{u'Image': u'\wbem\WMIC.exe'}, {u'CommandLine|contains': u'wmic '}, {u'OriginalFileName': u'wmic.exe'}, {u'Description': u'WMI Commandline Utility'}], u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'ParentPrcessName|endswith': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}}
title: Office Applications Spawning Wmi Cli

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: Excel called wmic to finally proxy execute regsvr32 with the payload. An attacker wanted to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).But we have command-line in the event which allow us to "restore" this suspicious parent-child chain and detect it. Monitor process creation with "wmic process call create" and LOLBins in command-line with parent Office application processes.
detection: {u'selection4': {u'processCommandLine|contains|all': [u'process', u'create', u'call']}, u'selection3': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}, u'selection1': [{u'Image|endswith': u'\wbem\WMIC.exe'}, {u'ProcessCommandLine|contains': u'wmic '}, {u'OriginalFileName': u'wmic.exe'}, {u'Description': u'WMI Commandline Utility'}], u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2 and selection3 and selection4', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'regsvr32', u'rundll32', u'msiexec', u'mshta', u'verclsid']}}
title: Excel Proxy Executing Regsvr32 With Payload

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: Excel called wmic to finally proxy execute regsvr32 with the payload. An attacker wanted to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).But we have command-line in the event which allow us to "restore" this suspicious parent-child chain and detect it. Monitor process creation with "wmic process call create" and LOLBins in command-line with parent Office application processes.
detection: {u'selection4': {u'processCommandLine|contains|all': [u'process', u'create', u'call']}, u'selection3': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}, u'selection1': {u'ProcessCommandLine': [u'*regsvr32*', u'*rundll32*', u'*msiexec*', u'*mshta*', u'*verclsid*']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2 and selection3 and selection4', u'selection2': [{u'Image|endswith': u'\wbem\WMIC.exe'}, {u'ProcessCommandLine|contains': u'wmic '}]}
title: Excel Proxy Executing Regsvr32 With Payload

author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule)
description: Initial execution of malicious document calls wmic to execute the file with regsvr32
detection: {u'selection1': [{u'Image|endswith': u'\wbem\WMIC.exe'}, {u'ProcessCommandLine|contains': u'wmic '}], u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage': [u'winword.exe', u'excel.exe', u'powerpnt.exe']}}
title: Office Applications Spawning Wmi Cli

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'updata.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'config', u'msdtc', u'start', u'auto']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Pingback Backdoor

author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573
description: Detects the use of various web request methods (including aliases) via Windows PowerShell command
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Invoke-WebRequest', u'iwr ', u'wget ', u'curl ', u'Net.WebClient', u'Start-BitsTransfer']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Use of Get-Command and Get-Help modules to reference Invoke-WebRequest and Start-BitsTransfer.]
title: Windows PowerShell Web Request

author: frack113
description: Emulates attack via documents through protocol handler in Microsoft Office. On successful execution you should see Microsoft Word launch a blank file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\protocolhandler.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'"ms-word', u'.docx"']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: ProtocolHandler.exe Downloaded Suspicious File

author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\certutil.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-addstore', u'root']}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\CertMgr.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/add', u'root']}}
falsepositives: [Help Desk or IT may need to manually add a corporate Root CA on occasion. Need to test if GPO push doesn't trigger FP]
title: Root Certificate Installed

author: frack113
description: Use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -h', u' -c', u' -z', u' /?']}, u'selection': {u'OriginalFileName': u'sdelete.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Sysinternals SDelete Delete File

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\reg.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'query', u'\software\', u'/v', u'svcversion']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Detected Windows Software Discovery

author: Florian Roth, @twjackomo, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
detection: {u'selection_process': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmd.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\winlogon.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'sethc.exe', u'utilman.exe', u'osk.exe', u'Magnify.exe', u'Narrator.exe', u'DisplaySwitch.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection_process'}
title: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage

author: frack113
description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities
detection: {u'selection_7z': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'7z.exe', u'7za.exe']}, u'selection_action': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' a ', u' u ']}, u'selection_password': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -p'}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
falsepositives: [Command line parameter combinations that contain all included strings]
title: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With 7-ZIP

author: frack113
description: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe is an abusable, signed PowerShell host executable that was introduced in Windows 10 and Server 2019 (OS Build 17763.1339).
detection: {u'selection_cmd': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand '}, u'selection_opt': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-ModuleName ', u'-ModulePath ', u'-ScriptBlock ', u'-RemoteFXvGPUDisablementFilePath']}, u'condition': u'selection_cmd and selection_opt'}
title: Abusable Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand

author: frack113
description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.
detection: {u'selection_redirect': {u'ParentCommandLine|contains': u' > %TEMP%\'}, u'condition': u'selection_image and selection_redirect', u'selection_image': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\tree.com', u'\WMIC.exe', u'\doskey.exe', u'\sc.exe']}}
title: Recon Information for Export with Command Prompt

author: frack113
description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities
detection: {u'selection_other': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -min ', u' -a ']}, u'selection_password': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-s"']}, u'selection_winzip': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'winzip.exe', u'winzip64.exe']}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
title: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With WINZIP

author: frack113
description: Use living off the land tools to zip a file and stage it in the Windows temporary folder for later exfiltration
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'Compress-Archive ', u' -Path ', u' -DestinationPath ', u'$env:TEMP\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp

author: frack113
description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'"n; '}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code

author: frack113
description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs
detection: {u'select_vbs': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs', u'"n;']}, u'condition': u'select_vbs'}
title: SyncAppvPublishingServer VBS Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects the usage of Sysinternals Tools due to accepteula key being added to Registry
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -accepteula'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of SysInternals tools, Programs that use the same Registry Key]
title: Usage of Sysinternals Tools

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer
detection: {u'filterprocess': {u'Image|endswith': u'\mmc.exe'}, u'methprocess': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\eventvwr.exe'}, u'condition': u'methprocess and not filterprocess'}
title: UAC Bypass via Event Viewer

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)
detection: {u'sysmon_processcreation': {u'Image|endswith': u'\PSEXESVC.exe', u'User|startswith': u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'}, u'condition': u'sysmon_processcreation'}
fields: [EventID, CommandLine, ParentCommandLine, ServiceName, ServiceFileName, TargetFilename, PipeName]
title: PsExec Tool Execution

author: Tobias Michalski
description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'Install-TransportAgent'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [legitimate installations of exchange TransportAgents. AssemblyPath is a good indicator for this.]
title: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a PowerShell New-MailboxExportRequest that exports a mailbox to a local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'New-MailboxExport', u' -Mailbox ', u' -FilePath \\127.0.0.1\C$']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share

author: sam0x90
description: Conti recommendation to its affiliates to use esentult to access NTDS dumped file. Trickbot also uses this utilities to get MSEdge info via its module pwgrab.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'esentutl', u' /p']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Esentutl Gather Credentials

author: Semanur Guneysu @semanurtg, oscd.community
description: Detection of unusual child processes by different system processes
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' route ', u' ADD ']}, u'selection3': {u'User|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', u'AUTORITE NT\Sys']}, u'selection1': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\winlogon.exe', u'\services.exe', u'\lsass.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\smss.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\spoolsv.exe', u'\searchindexer.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2 and selection3 and not filter', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\cmd.exe']}}
title: Abused Debug Privilege by Arbitrary Parent Processes

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Mangatas Tondang (rule), oscd.community
description: Accesschk is an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being used by attacker to verify if a privilege escalation process successful or not
detection: {u'product': {u'Product|endswith': u'AccessChk'}, u'integrity_level': {u'IntegrityLevel': u'Medium'}, u'condition': u'integrity_level and (product or description)', u'description': {u'Description|contains': u'Reports effective permissions'}}
title: Accesschk Usage After Privilege Escalation

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Mangatas Tondang (rule), oscd.community
description: This rule will looks for Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawned command line and/or powershell
detection: {u'image': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe']}, u'parent_image': {u'ParentImage|contains|all': [u'\Windows\Installer\', u'msi'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'tmp']}, u'condition': u'image and parent_image'}
title: Always Install Elevated MSI Spawned Cmd And Powershell

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Mangatas Tondang (rule), oscd.community
description: This rule will looks for Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) when it tries to install MSI packages with SYSTEM privilege
detection: {u'image_1': {u'Image|contains|all': [u'\Windows\Installer\', u'msi'], u'Image|endswith': [u'tmp']}, u'image_2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\msiexec.exe']}, u'integrity_level': {u'IntegrityLevel': u'System'}, u'condition': u'(image_1 and user) or (image_2 and user and integrity_level)', u'user': {u'User|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', u'AUTORITE NT\Sys']}}
title: Always Install Elevated Windows Installer

author: @caliskanfurkan_
description: Detecting DNS tunnel activity for Muddywater actor
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\excel.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'DataExchange.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: DNS Tunnel Technique from MuddyWater

author: MSTIC, FPT.EagleEye
description: Suspicious behaviours related to an actor tracked by Microsoft as SOURGUM
detection: {u'registry_key': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\software\classes\clsid\{7c857801-7381-11cf-884d-00aa004b2e24}\inprocserver32', u'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\software\classes\clsid\{cf4cc405-e2c5-4ddd-b3ce-5e7582d8c9fa}\inprocserver32']}, u'selection1': {u'Image|contains': u'windows\system32\Physmem.sys'}, u'selection2': {u'Image|contains': [u'Windows\system32\ime\SHARED\WimBootConfigurations.ini', u'Windows\system32\ime\IMEJP\WimBootConfigurations.ini', u'Windows\system32\ime\IMETC\WimBootConfigurations.ini']}, u'selection3': {u'Image|contains': [u'windows\system32\filepath2', u'windows\system32\ime']}, u'registry_command': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'reg add']}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2 or (selection3 and registry_command and registry_key)'}
title: SOURGUM Actor Behaviours

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects spawning of suspicious child processes by Atlassian Confluence server which may indicate successful exploitation of CVE-2021-26084
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\Atlassian\Confluence\jre\bin\java.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'cmd /c', u'cmd /k', u'powershell', u'certutil', u'curl', u'whoami', u'ipconfig']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Atlassian Confluence CVE-2021-26084

author: Nik Seetharaman
description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\cmstp.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate CMSTP use (unlikely in modern enterprise environments)]
title: CMSTP Execution Process Creation

author: frack113
description: Injects arbitrary DLL into running process specified by process ID. Requires Windows 10.
detection: {u'selection': {u'OriginalFileName|contains': u'mavinject', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' /INJECTRUNNING', u'.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Mavinject Inject DLL Into Running Process

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects possible successful exploitation for vulnerability described in CVE-2021-26857 by looking for | abnormal subprocesses spawning by Exchange Server’s Unified Messaging service
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'wermgr.exe', u'WerFault.exe']}, u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'UMWorkerProcess.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: CVE-2021-26857 Exchange Exploitation

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Adversaries can use the inbuilt expand utility to decompress cab files as seen in recent Iranian MeteorExpress attack
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\expand.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.cab', u'/F:', u'-F:', u'C:\ProgramData\', u'C:\Public\', u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'\AppData\Roaming\Temp\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Cabinet File Expansion

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\clussvc.exe'}, u'selection1': {u'Imphash': [u'a53a02b997935fd8eedcb5f7abab9b9f', u'e96a73c7bf33a464c510ede582318bf2']}, u'condition': u'( selection1 or selection2 ) and not filter', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\services.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': u'.exe -S'}}
falsepositives: [Another service that uses a single -s command line switch]
title: Windows Credential Editor

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for sdclt being spawned as an elevated process. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'sdclt.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': u'High'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: High Integrity Sdclt Process

author: Tom Ueltschi (@c_APT_ure)
description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method
detection: {u'exec_selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\userinit.exe'}, u'exec_exclusion2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'netlogon.bat', u'UsrLogon.cmd']}, u'exec_exclusion1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\explorer.exe'}, u'condition': u'( exec_selection and not exec_exclusion1 and not exec_exclusion2 ) or create_keywords_cli', u'create_keywords_cli': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'UserInitMprLogonScript'}}
falsepositives: [exclude legitimate logon scripts, penetration tests, red teaming]
title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript)

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects Too long PowerShell command lines
detection: {u'Length_selection': {u'CommandLine|re': u'.{1000,}'}, u'Powershell_selection': [{u'CommandLine|contains': ['powershell', 'pwsh']}, {u'Description': u'Windows Powershell'}, {u'Product': u'PowerShell Core 6'}], u'condition': u'all of them'}
title: Too Long PowerShell Commandlines

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network
detection: {u'selection_cmdline': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -lvp ', u' -l --proxy-type http ', u' --exec cmd.exe ', u' -vnl --exec ']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\ncat.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection or selection_cmdline'}
title: Ncat Execution

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code.
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /UpdateDeploymentProvider UpdateDeploymentProvider.dll ', u' wuaueng.dll ']}, u'selection_two': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'UpdateDeploymentProvider', u'.dll', u'RunHandlerComServer']}, u'selection_one': [{u'Image|contains': u'wuauclt'}, {u'OriginalFileName': u'wuauclt.exe'}], u'condition': u'selection_one and selection_two and not filter'}
title: Proxy Execution via Wuauclt

author: Bhabesh Raj, Sittikorn S
description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc
detection: {u'selection': {u'Description': u'Rsync for cloud storage'}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'--config ', u'--no-check-certificate ', u' copy ']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection3': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\rclone.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'mega', u'pcloud', u'ftp', u'--progress', u'--ignore-existing', u'--auto-confirm', u'--transfers', u'--multi-thread-streams']}}
title: RClone Execution

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by removing Windows Defender Definition Files
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -RemoveDefinitions', u' -All'], u'OriginalFileName': u'MpCmdRun.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Remove Windows Defender Definition Files

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for sdclt spawning new processes. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\sdclt.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Sdclt Child Processes

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel remote forarding to a local port
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -R ', u'Description': u'Command-line SSH, Telnet, and Rlogin client'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrative activity using a remote port forwarding to a local port]
title: Suspicious Plink Remote Forwarding

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by stopping antivirus service
detection: {u'selection_action': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Stop-Service ', u'Remove-Service ']}, u'condition': u'all of them', u'selection_product': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' McAfeeDLPAgentService', u' Trend Micro Deep Security Manager', u' TMBMServer']}}
title: Stop Or Remove Antivirus Service

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection for svchost.exe spawning rundll32.exe with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server).
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious WebDav Client Execution

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\WindowsSensor.exe', u' /uninstall', u' /quiet']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Uninstall Crowdstrike Falcon

author: behops, Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\VMware\VMware Tools\poweron-vm-default.bat', u'\VMware\VMware Tools\poweroff-vm-default.bat', u'\VMware\VMware Tools\resume-vm-default.bat', u'\VMware\VMware Tools\suspend-vm-default.bat']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\vmtoolsd.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process

author: Janantha Marasinghe (https://github.com/blueteam0ps)
description: AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'domainlist', u'trustdmp', u'dcmodes', u'adinfo', u' dclist ', u'computer_pwdnotreqd', u'objectcategory=', u'-subnets -f', u'name="Domain Admins"', u'-sc u:', u'domainncs', u'dompol', u' oudmp ', u'subnetdmp', u'gpodmp', u'fspdmp', u'users_noexpire', u'computers_active']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: AdFind Usage Detection

author: Ján Trenčanský
description: AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation can be used by attacker to gain remote access.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'--install', u'--start-with-win', u'--silent']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: AnyDesk Silent Installation

author: Florian Roth
description: This method detects a suspicious PowerShell command line combination as used by APT29 in a campaign against U.S. think tanks.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-noni', u'-ep', u'bypass', u'$']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: APT29

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': [u'reg query "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Terminal Server Client\Default"', u'powershell.exe mshta.exe http*', u'cmd.exe /c taskkill /im cmd.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.execution, attack.t1059, attack.t1086, attack.t1059.003, attack.t1059.001, attack.discovery, attack.t1012, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1170, attack.t1218, attack.t1218.005]
title: Baby Shark Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Russian group activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\xcopy.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/S', u'/E', u'/C', u'/Q', u'/H', u'\\']}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\adexplorer.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-snapshot', u'""', u'c:\users\']}}
title: Judgement Panda Credential Access Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious DLL loading from AppData Local path as described in BlueMashroom report
detection: {u'selection': [{u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['\\regsvr32', '\\AppData\\Local\\']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['\\AppData\\Local\\', ',DllEntry']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: BlueMashroom DLL Load

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cscript.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'.vbs', u'/shell']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WMIExec VBS Script

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects CrackMapExecWin Activity as Described by NCSC
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\crackmapexec.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: CrackMapExecWin

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Elise backdoor acitivty as used by APT32
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'\Windows\Caches\NavShExt.dll '}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|endswith': u'\AppData\Roaming\MICROS~1\Windows\Caches\NavShExt.dll,Setting'}}
title: Elise Backdoor

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of DLL side-loading malware used by threat group Emissary Panda aka APT27
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\svchost.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\sllauncher.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Emissary Panda Malware SLLauncher

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects EmpireMonkey APT reported Activity
detection: {u'selection_cutil': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cutil.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': u'/i:%APPDATA%\logs.txt scrobj.dll'}, u'selection_regsvr32': {u'CommandLine|endswith': u'/i:%APPDATA%\logs.txt scrobj.dll', u'Description': u'Microsoft(C) Registerserver'}, u'condition': u'1 of them'}
title: Empire Monkey

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a specific tool and export used by EquationGroup
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': u',dll_u'}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -export dll_u '}}
title: Equation Group DLL_U Load

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Golden Chickens deployment method as used by Evilnum in report published in July 2020
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'regsvr32', u'/s', u'/i', u'\AppData\Roaming\', u'.ocx']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: EvilNum Golden Chickens Deployment via OCX Files

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020
detection: {u'selection4': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\adobe\Adobe.exe', u'\oracle\local.exe', u'\revshell.exe', u'infopagesbackup\ncat.exe', u'CSIDL_SYSTEM\cmd.exe', u'\programdata\oracle\java.exe', u'CSIDL_COMMON_APPDATA\comms\comms.exe', u'\Programdata\VMware\Vmware.exe']}, u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\msf.ps1', u'8989 -e cmd.exe', u'system.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataAdapter($cmd); [void]$da.fill', u'-nop -w hidden -c $k=new-object', u'[Net.CredentialCache]::DefaultCredentials;IEX ', u' -nop -w hidden -c $m=new-object net.webclient;$m', u'-noninteractive -executionpolicy bypass whoami', u'-noninteractive -executionpolicy bypass netstat -a', u'L3NlcnZlcj1']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'bitsadmin', u'/transfer', u'CSIDL_APPDATA']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'CSIDL_SYSTEM_DRIVE']}}
tags: [attack.g0049, attack.execution, attack.t1059.001, attack.t1086, attack.command_and_control, attack.t1105, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1036, attack.t1036.005]
title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects activity observed by different researchers to be HAFNIUM group activity (or related) on Exchange servers
detection: {u'selection4': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'%TEMP%\execute.bat'}, u'selection5': {u'Image|endswith': u'Users\Public\opera\Opera_browser.exe'}, u'selection6': {u'Image|endswith': u'Opera_browser.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\services.exe', u'\svchost.exe']}, u'selection7': {u'Image|contains': u'\ProgramData\VSPerfMon\'}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'attrib', u' +h ', u' +s ', u' +r ', u'.aspx']}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'schtasks', u'VSPerfMon']}, u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'vssadmin list shadows', u'Temp\__output']}, u'selection8': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -t7z ', u'C:\Programdata\pst', u'\it.zip']}, u'selection9': {u'Image|endswith': u'\makecab.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Microsoft\Exchange Server\', u'inetpub\wwwroot']}, u'selection12': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'dsquery', u' -uco ', u'\inetpub\wwwroot']}, u'selection10': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\Temp\xx.bat', u'Windows\WwanSvcdcs', u'Windows\Temp\cw.exe']}, u'selection11': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\comsvcs.dll', u'Minidump', u'\inetpub\wwwroot']}, u'condition': u'1 of them'}
title: Exchange Exploitation Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Hurricane Panda Activity
detection: {u'selection': [{u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['localgroup', 'admin', '/add']}, {u'CommandLine|contains': ['\\Win64.exe']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Hurricane Panda Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Judgement Panda activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike
detection: {u'selection1': [{u'CommandLine|endswith': u'eprod.ldf'}, {u'CommandLine|contains': ['\\ldifde.exe -f -n ', '\\7za.exe a 1.7z ', '\\aaaa\\procdump64.exe', '\\aaaa\\netsess.exe', '\\aaaa\\7za.exe', 'copy .\\1.7z \\', 'copy \\\\client\\c$\\aaaa\\']}], u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'Image': u'C:\Users\Public\7za.exe'}}
tags: [attack.lateral_movement, attack.g0010, attack.credential_access, attack.t1003, attack.t1003.001, attack.exfiltration, attack.t1002, attack.t1560.001]
title: Judgement Panda Exfil Activity

author: Markus Neis, Swisscom
description: Detects Registry modifications performed by Ke3chang malware in campaigns running in 2019 and 2020
detection: {u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-Property DWORD -name DisableFirstRunCustomize -value 2 -Force', u'-Property String -name Check_Associations -value', u'-Property DWORD -name IEHarden -value 0 -Force']}, u'condition': u'selection1'}
falsepositives: [Will need to be looked for combinations of those processes]
title: Ke3chang Registry Key Modifications

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects different process creation events as described in Malwarebytes's threat report on Lazarus group activity
detection: {u'selection3': {u'ParentImage|contains': [u':\Users\Public\'], u'Image': [u'C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'mshta', u'.zip']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'Image': [u'C:\Windows\System32\mshta.exe'], u'ParentImage': [u'C:\Windows\System32\wbem\wmiprvse.exe']}}
title: Lazarus Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects different process creation events as described in various threat reports on Lazarus group activity
detection: {u'selection4': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.255 10 C:\ProgramData\']}, u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'netstat -aon | find ', u' > %temp%\~']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'reg.exe save hklm\sam %temp%\~reg_sam.save', u'1q2w3e4r@#$@#$@#$', u' -hp1q2w3e4 ', u'.dat data03 10000 -p ']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'process call create', u' > %temp%\~']}}
falsepositives: [Overlap with legitimate process activity in some cases (especially selection 3 and 4)]
title: Lazarus Activity

author: Florian Roth, wagga
description: Detects different loaders as described in various threat reports on Lazarus group activity
detection: {u'selection_rundll1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'rundll32.exe ', u'C:\ProgramData\']}, u'selection_rundll2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.bin,', u'.tmp,', u'.dat,', u'.io,', u'.ini,', u'.db,']}, u'selection_cmd1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'cmd.exe /c ', u' -p 0x']}, u'selection_cmd2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'C:\ProgramData\', u'C:\RECYCLER\']}, u'condition': u'( selection_cmd1 and selection_cmd2 ) or ( selection_rundll1 and selection_rundll2 )'}
title: Lazarus Loaders

author: Trent Liffick (@tliffick), Bartlomiej Czyz (@bczyz1)
description: Detects executables launched outside their default directories as used by Lazarus Group (Bluenoroff)
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\msdtc.exe', u'\gpvc.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Lazarus Session Highjacker

author: Florian Roth, oscd.community
description: Detects specific process parameters as used by Mustang Panda droppers
detection: {u'selection1': [{u'CommandLine|contains': ['Temp\\wtask.exe /create', '%windir:~-3,1%%PUBLIC:~-9,1%', '/tn "Security Script ', '%windir:~-1,1%']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['/E:vbscript', 'C:\\Users\\', '.txt', '/F']}], u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'Temp\winwsh.exe'}}
title: Mustang Panda Dropper

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects process command line patterns and locations used by REvil group in Kaseya incident (can also match on other malware)
