description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file
detection: {u'condition': u'(selection1 and susp_flag_2 and http_flag) or (selection1 and susp_flag_1) or selection2', u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\bitsadmin.exe']}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'copy bitsadmin.exe']}, u'http_flag': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'http']}, u'susp_flag_1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /transfer ']}, u'susp_flag_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /create ', u' /addfile ']}}
falsepositives: [Some legitimate apps use this, but limited.]
title: Bitsadmin Download

author: Cedric MAURUGEON
description: Detects a process memory dump performed by RdrLeakDiag.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'fullmemdmp', u'OriginalFileName': u'RdrLeakDiag.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Process Dump via RdrLeakDiag.exe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a process memory dump performed via ordinal function 24 in comsvcs.dll
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'comsvcs.dll,#24', u'comsvcs.dll,MiniDump', u'comsvcs.dll MiniDump']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unlikely, because no one should dump the process memory in that way]
title: Process Dump via Rundll32 and Comsvcs.dll

author: vburov
description: Detect suspicious parent processes of well-known Windows processes
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\svchost.exe', u'\taskhost.exe', u'\lsm.exe', u'\lsass.exe', u'\services.exe', u'\lsaiso.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\winlogon.exe']}, u'filter1': [{u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\SavService.exe'}, {u'ParentImage|contains': ['\\System32\\', '\\SysWOW64\\']}], u'filter_null': {u'ParentImage': None}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter1 and not filter2 and not filter_null', u'filter2': {u'ParentImage|contains': [u'\Windows Defender\', u'\Microsoft Security Client\'], u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\MsMpEng.exe'}}
falsepositives: [Some security products seem to spawn these]
title: Windows Processes Suspicious Parent Directory

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a PsExec service start
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': u'C:\Windows\PSEXESVC.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PsExec Service Start

author: Florian Roth
description: Detect
detection: {u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'xyz123456.exe', u'PurpleSharp']}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2', u'selection2': {u'OriginalFileName': [u'PurpleSharp.exe']}}
title: PurpleSharp Indicator

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\reg.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'query', u'save', u'export']}, u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'currentVersion\windows', u'currentVersion\runServicesOnce', u'currentVersion\runServices', u'winlogon\', u'currentVersion\shellServiceObjectDelayLoad', u'currentVersion\runOnce', u'currentVersion\runOnceEx', u'currentVersion\run', u'currentVersion\policies\explorer\run', u'currentcontrolset\services']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and selection_2'}
fields: [Image, CommandLine, User, LogonGuid, Hashes, ParentProcessGuid, ParentCommandLine]
title: Query Registry

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects using Rasautou.exe for loading arbitrary .DLL specified in -d option and executes the export specified in -p.
detection: {u'use_rasautou': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rasautou.exe'}, u'special_keys': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-d', u'-p']}, u'remaned_rasautou': {u'OriginalFileName': u'rasdlui.exe'}, u'condition': u'(use_rasautou or remaned_rasautou) and special_keys'}
logsource: {u'category': u'process_creation', u'definition': u'Since options '-d' and '-p' were removed in Windows 10 this rule is relevant only for Windows before 10. And as Windows 7 doesn't log command line in 4688 by default, to detect this attack you need Sysmon 1 configured or KB3004375 installed for command-line auditing (https://support.microsoft.com/en-au/help/3004375/microsoft-security-advisory-update-to-improve-windows-command-line-aud)', u'product': u'windows'}
title: DLL Execution via Rasautou.exe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'noconsentprompt', u'shadow:']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: MSTSC Shadowing

author: Alexander Rausch
description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': [u'rundll32.exe', u'cmd.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'gthread-3.6.dll', u'\Windows\Temp\tmp.bat', u'sigcmm-2.4.dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute

author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.
detection: {u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'hklm', u'hkey_local_machine']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regedit.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' /E '}, u'selection_3': {u'CommandLine|endswith': [u'\system', u'\sam', u'\security']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_2 and selection_3'}
falsepositives: [Dumping hives for legitimate purpouse i.e. backup or forensic investigation]
title: Exports Critical Registry Keys To a File

author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Detects the export of the target Registry key to a file.
detection: {u'filter_1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'hklm', u'hkey_local_machine']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regedit.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' /E '}, u'filter_2': {u'CommandLine|endswith': [u'\system', u'\sam', u'\security']}, u'condition': u'selection and not (filter_1 and filter_2)'}
title: Exports Registry Key To a File

author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Detects the import of the specified file to the registry with regedit.exe.
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /e ', u' /a ', u' /c ']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regedit.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /i ', u'.reg']}, u'filter_2': {u'CommandLine|re': u':[^ \\\\]'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter and not filter_2'}
title: Imports Registry Key From a File

author: Oddvar Moe, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /e ', u' /a ', u' /c ']}, u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|re': u':[^ \\\\]'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regedit.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /i ', u'.reg']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_2 and not filter'}
title: Imports Registry Key From an ADS

author: Eli Salem, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Detects the execution of regini.exe which can be used to modify registry keys, the changes are imported from one or more text files.
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|re': u':[^ \\\\]'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regini.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Modifies the Registry From a File

author: Eli Salem, Sander Wiebing, oscd.community
description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regini.exe', u'CommandLine|re': u':[^ \\\\]'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Modifies the Registry From a ADS

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'reg', u' ADD ', u'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Reg Add RUN Key

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Image|endswith': u'\wsmprovhost.exe'}, {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\wsmprovhost.exe'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate usage of remote Powershell, e.g. for monitoring purposes.]
title: Remote PowerShell Session Host Process (WinRM)

author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community
description: Identifies use of various commands to query a systems time. This technique may be used before executing a scheduled task or to discover the time zone of a target system.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Image|endswith': ['\\net.exe', '\\net1.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': u'time'}, {u'Image|endswith': u'\w32tm.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'tz'}, {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'Get-Date'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of the system utilities to discover system time for legitimate reason]
title: Discovery of a System Time

author: Matthew Green - @mgreen27, Ecco, James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, oscd.community (improvements), Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)
description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
detection:
{u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\powershell_ise.exe', u'\psexec.exe', u'\psexec64.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'egsvr32.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\certutil.exe', u'undll32.exe', u'\cmstp.exe', u'\msiexec.exe', u'\7z.exe', u'\winrar.exe', u'\wevtutil.exe', u'
et.exe', u'
et1.exe', u'
etsh.exe']}, u'selection': {u'OriginalFileName': [u'cmd.exe', u'powershell.exe', u'powershell_ise.exe', u'psexec.exe', u'psexec.c', u'cscript.exe', u'wscript.exe', u'mshta.exe', u'regsvr32.exe', u'wmic.exe', u'certutil.exe', u'rundll32.exe', u'cmstp.exe', u'msiexec.exe', u'7z.exe', u'winrar.exe', u'wevtutil.exe', u'net.exe', u'net1.exe', u'netsh.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Custom applications use renamed binaries adding slight change to binary name. Typically this is easy to spot and add to whitelist]
title: Renamed Binary

author: Matthew Green - @mgreen27, Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\powershell_ise.exe', u'\psexec.exe', u'\psexec64.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\certutil.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\cmstp.exe', u'\msiexec.exe']}, u'selection': {u'OriginalFileName': [u'powershell.exe', u'powershell_ise.exe', u'psexec.exe', u'psexec.c', u'cscript.exe', u'wscript.exe', u'mshta.exe', u'regsvr32.exe', u'wmic.exe', u'certutil.exe', u'rundll32.exe', u'cmstp.exe', u'msiexec.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Custom applications use renamed binaries adding slight change to binary name. Typically this is easy to spot and add to whitelist]
title: Highly Relevant Renamed Binary

author: Markus Neis, Swisscom
description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\jusched.exe']}, u'selection1': {u'Description': u'Java Update Scheduler'}, u'condition': u'(selection1 or selection2) and not filter', u'selection2': {u'Description': u'Java(TM) Update Scheduler'}}
title: Renamed jusched.exe

author: Sittikorn S
description: Detects the execution of a renamed meg.exe of MegaSync during incident response engagements associated with ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.
detection: {u'selection_orig': {u'OriginalFileName': u'meg.exe'}, u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\meg.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection_proc or ( selection_orig and not filter )', u'selection_proc': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\explorer.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'C:\Windows\Temp\meg.exe'}}
falsepositives: [Software that illegaly integrates MegaSync in a renamed form, Administrators that have renamed MegaSync]
title: Renamed MegaSync

author: Jason Lynch
description: Detects execution of renamed paexec via imphash and executable product string
detection: {u'filter1': {u'Image|contains': u'paexec'}, u'selection1': {u'Product|contains': [u'PAExec']}, u'condition': u'(selection1 and selection2) and not filter1', u'selection2': {u'Imphash': [u'11D40A7B7876288F919AB819CC2D9802', u'6444f8a34e99b8f7d9647de66aabe516', u'dfd6aa3f7b2b1035b76b718f1ddc689f', u'1a6cca4d5460b1710a12dea39e4a592c']}}
title: Execution of Renamed PaExec

author: Florian Roth, frack113
description: Detects the execution of a renamed PowerShell often used by attackers or malware
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\powershell_ise.exe', u'\pwsh.exe']}, u'selection': {u'Company': u'Microsoft Corporation', u'Description|startswith': [u'Windows PowerShell', u'pwsh']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Renamed PowerShell

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable often used by attackers or malware
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\procdump.exe', u'\procdump64.exe']}, u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -ma ', u'.dmp']}, u'selection1': {u'OriginalFileName': u'procdump'}, u'condition': u'( selection1 or selection2 or selection3 ) and not filter', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -ma ', u' -accepteula ']}}
falsepositives: [Procdump illegaly bundled with legitimate software, Weird admins who renamed binaries]
title: Renamed ProcDump

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of a renamed PsExec often used by attackers or malware
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\PsExec.exe', u'\PsExec64.exe']}, u'selection': {u'Product': u'Sysinternals PsExec', u'Description': u'Execute processes remotely'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Software that illegaly integrates PsExec in a renamed form, Administrators that have renamed PsExec and no one knows why]
title: Renamed PsExec

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\whoami.exe'}, u'selection': {u'OriginalFileName': u'whoami.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Renamed Whoami Execution

author: Bartlomiej Czyz, Relativity
description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': u'rundll32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Rundll32 Without Parameters

author: Sergey Soldatov, Kaspersky Lab, oscd.community
description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'Get-Content', u'-Stream']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Run PowerShell Script from ADS

author: Moriarty Meng (idea), Anton Kutepov (rule), oscd.community
description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect
detection: {u'redirect_to_input_stream': {u'CommandLine|re': u'\s-\s*<'}, u'condition': u'powershell_started and redirect_to_input_stream', u'powershell_started': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe'}}
title: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream

author: Janantha Marasinghe
description: Adversaries can carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection. This rule is built to detect the registration of the Virtualbox driver or start of a Virtualbox VM.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'VBoxRT.dll,RTR3Init', u'VBoxC.dll', u'VBoxDrv.sys']}, u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'startvm', u'controlvm']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 or selection_2'}
falsepositives: [This may have false positives on hosts where Virtualbox is legitimately being used for operations]
title: Detect Virtualbox Driver Installation OR Starting Of VMs

author: Sittikorn S
description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\svchost.exe', u'\dllhost.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\schtasks.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\msiexec.exe', u'\msbuild.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\scrcons.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe. A shim can be used to load malicious DLLs into applications.
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'iisexpressshim.sdb']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\sdbinst.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'.sdb'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Possible Shim Database Persistence via sdbinst.exe

author: Timur Zinniatullin, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects manual service execution (start) via system utilities.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\net.exe', u'\net1.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': u' start '}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate administrator or user executes a service for legitimate reasons.]
title: Service Execution

author: Jakob Weinzettl, oscd.community
description: Detects a windows service to be stopped
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\sc.exe', u'\net.exe', u'\net1.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': u'stop'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrator shutting down the service due to upgrade or removal purposes]
title: Stop Windows Service

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, oscd.community
description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'mklink', u'HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate administrator working with shadow copies, access for backup purposes]
title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\vssadmin.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'shadow', u'create']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate administrator working with shadow copies, access for backup purposes]
title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities

author: Florian Roth, Michael Haag, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)
description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\vssadmin.exe', u'\diskshadow.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'shadow', u'delete']}, u'condition': u'1 of selection*', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\wbadmin.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'delete', u'catalog', u'quiet']}}
falsepositives: [Legitimate Administrator deletes Shadow Copies using operating systems utilities for legitimate reason]
title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious child process of a mshta.exe process
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\cmd.exe', u'\WScript.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\mshta.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Mshta Spawning Windows Shell

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Windows shell
detection: {u'falsepositives': {u'CurrentDirectory|contains': u'\ccmcache\'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\schtasks.exe', u'\nslookup.exe', u'\certutil.exe', u'\bitsadmin.exe', u'\mshta.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\mshta.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\wmiprvse.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not falsepositives'}
title: Windows Shell Spawning Suspicious Program

author: Aleksey Potapov, oscd.community
description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use
detection: {u'selection': {u'Description|contains': u'st2stager'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution

author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community
description: Detect attacker collecting audio via SoundRecorder application.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\SoundRecorder.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'/FILE'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Audio Capture via SoundRecorder

author: Markus Neis, keepwatch
description: Detects Service Principal Name Enumeration used for Kerberoasting
detection: {u'cmd': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'-q'}, u'selection_desc': {u'Description|contains|all': [u'Query or reset the computer', u'SPN attribute']}, u'condition': u'(selection_image or selection_desc) and cmd', u'selection_image': {u'Image|endswith': u'\setspn.exe'}}
title: Possible SPN Enumeration

author: Sreeman
description: By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system. When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': [u'copy /y C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe C:\windows\system32\sethc.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Using Sticky-keys To Obtain Unauthenticated, Privileged Console Access

author: FPT.EagleEye Team, omkar72, oscd.community
description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for Active Directory enumeration
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\adfind.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'objectcategory', u'trustdmp', u'dcmodes', u'dclist', u'computers_pwdnotreqd']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious AdFind Execution

author: Mateusz Wydra, oscd.community
description: Atbroker executing non-deafualt Assistive Technology applications
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'animations', u'audiodescription', u'caretbrowsing', u'caretwidth', u'colorfiltering', u'cursorscheme', u'filterkeys', u'focusborderheight', u'focusborderwidth', u'highcontrast', u'keyboardcues', u'keyboardpref', u'magnifierpane', u'messageduration', u'minimumhitradius', u'mousekeys', u'Narrator', u'osk', u'overlappedcontent', u'showsounds', u'soundsentry', u'stickykeys', u'togglekeys', u'windowarranging', u'windowtracking', u'windowtrackingtimeout', u'windowtrackingzorder']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'AtBroker.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'start'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Atbroker Execution

author: @neu5ron
description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\bcdedit.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'delete', u'deletevalue', u'import', u'safeboot', u'network']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Execute VBscript code that is referenced within the *.bgi file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\bginfo.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/popup', u'/nolicprompt']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Bginfo

author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects transferring files from system on a server bitstransfer Powershell cmdlets
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\powershell_ise.exe', u'\pwsh.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Get-BitsTransfer', u'Add-BitsFile']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Bitstransfer via PowerShell

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious use of calc.exe with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion
detection: {u'filter2': {u'Image|contains': u'\Windows\Sys'}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'\calc.exe '}, u'condition': u'selection1 or ( selection2 and not filter2 )', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\calc.exe'}}
title: Suspicious Calculator Usage

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cdb.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'-cf'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Possible App Whitelisting Bypass via WinDbg/CDB as a Shellcode Runner

author: Florian Roth, juju4, keepwatch
description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like 'decode' sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility
detection: {u'certutil': {u'Image|endswith': u'\certutil.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'URL', u'ping']}, u'parameters': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -decode ', u' -decodehex ', u' -urlcache ', u' -verifyctl ', u' -encode ', u' /decode ', u' /decodehex ', u' /urlcache ', u' /verifyctl ', u' /encode ']}, u'condition': u'parameters or certutil'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
tags: [attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1140, attack.command_and_control, attack.t1105, attack.s0160, attack.g0007, attack.g0010, attack.g0045, attack.g0049, attack.g0075, attack.g0096]
title: Suspicious Certutil Command

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious a certutil command that used to encode files, which is sometimes used for data exfiltration
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\certutil.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-f', u'-encode']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Certutil Encode

author: juju4
description: Detects suspicious process that use escape characters
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'h^t^t^p', u'h"t"t"p']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious Commandline Escape

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'http', u'://', u'%AppData%']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings

author: Max Altgelt, Tobias Michalski
description: Detects a command used by conti to access volume shadow backups
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'copy \\\\\?\\GLOBALROOT\\Device\\HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Conti Volume Shadow Listing

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\chcp.com', u'CommandLine|endswith': [u' 936', u' 1258']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrative activity (adjust code pages according to your organisation's region)]
title: Suspicious Code Page Switch

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis
description: Detects a set of commands often used in recon stages by different attack groups
detection: {u'selection': [{u'CommandLine': ['tasklist', 'net time', 'systeminfo', 'whoami', 'nbtstat', 'net start', 'qprocess', 'nslookup', 'hostname.exe', 'netstat -an']}, {u'CommandLine|endswith': ['\\net1 start', '\\net1 user /domain', '\\net1 group /domain', '\\net1 group "domain admins" /domain', '\\net1 group "Exchange Trusted Subsystem" /domain', '\\net1 accounts /domain', '\\net1 user net localgroup administrators']}], u'condition': u'selection | count() by CommandLine > 4', u'timeframe': u'15s'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Reconnaissance Activity with Net Command

author: Florian Roth, Samir Bousseaden
description: Detects suspicious command line arguments of common data compression tools
detection: {u'falsepositive': {u'ParentImage|startswith': u'C:\Program'}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -p', u' -ta', u' -tb', u' -sdel', u' -dw', u' -hp'], u'OriginalFileName': [u'7z*.exe', u'*rar.exe', u'*Command*Line*RAR*']}, u'condition': u'selection and not falsepositive'}
title: Suspicious Compression Tool Parameters

author: Modexp (idea)
description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32
detection: {u'rundll_ofn': {u'OriginalFileName': u'RUNDLL32.EXE'}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'comsvcs', u'MiniDump', u'full']}, u'condition': u'(rundll_image or rundll_ofn) and selection', u'rundll_image': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe'}}
title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL

author: omkar72
description: Detects the conhost execution as parent process. Can be used to evaded defense mechanism.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\conhost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unlikely, conhost is a child less process]
title: Conhost Parent Process Executions

author: @neonprimetime, Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious process pattern found in CVE-2021-40444 exploitation
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|endswith': u'\control.exe input.dll'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\control.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\winword.exe', u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\excel.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: CVE-2021-40444 Process Pattern

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'Shell32.dll'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe ', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\System32\control.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load

author: Florian Roth, oscd.community, Teymur Kheirkhabarov @HeirhabarovT, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Detects a suspicious copy command to or from an Admin share
detection: {u'selection4': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\\\\', u'$']}, u'selection3': {u'Image|contains': u'\powershell', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'copy-item', u'copy', u'cpi ', u' cp ']}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\robocopy.exe', u'\xcopy.exe']}, u'condition': u'(selection1 or selection2 or selection3) and selection4', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'copy'}}
tags: [attack.lateral_movement, attack.collection, attack.exfiltration, attack.t1039, attack.t1105, attack.t1048, attack.t1021.002]
title: Copy from Admin Share

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis
description: Detects a suspicious copy command that copies a system program from System32 to another directory on disk - sometimes used to use LOLBINs like certutil or desktopimgdownldr to a different location with a different name
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /c copy', u'xcopy'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\System32\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment, Admin scripts like https://www.itexperience.net/sccm-batch-files-and-32-bits-processes-on-64-bits-os/]
title: Suspicious Copy From or To System32

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-Command', u'-EncodedCommand'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-Sta', u'-Nop', u'-Window', u'Hidden']}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'sv o (New-Object IO.MemorySteam);sv d ', u'mshta file.hta', u'GruntHTTP', u'-EncodedCommand cwB2ACAAbwAgA']}, u'condition': u'selection or selection2'}
title: Covenant Launcher Indicators

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'powershell.exe -exec bypass -noni -nop -w 1 -C "', u'powershell.exe -noni -nop -w 1 -enc '], u'CommandLine|endswith': [u'cmd.exe /Q /c * 1> \\\\*\\*\\* 2>&1', u'cmd.exe /C * > \\\\*\\*\\* 2>&1', u'cmd.exe /C * > *\\Temp\\* 2>&1']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.execution, attack.t1047, attack.t1053, attack.t1059.003, attack.t1059.001, attack.s0106, attack.t1086]
title: CrackMapExec Command Execution

author: Thomas Patzke
description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.
detection: {u'powershell_execution': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'powershell.exe'}, u'snippets': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'join*split', u'( $ShellId[1]+$ShellId[13]+'x')', u'( $PSHome[*]+$PSHOME[*]+', u'( $env:Public[13]+$env:Public[5]+'x')', u'( $env:ComSpec[4,*,25]-Join'')', u'[1,3]+'x'-Join'')']}, u'condition': u'powershell_execution and snippets'}
title: CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\csc.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\mshta.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
tags: [attack.execution, attack.t1059.005, attack.t1059.007, attack.defense_evasion, attack.t1500, attack.t1218.005, attack.t1027.004]
title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious execution of csc.exe, which uses a source in a suspicious folder (e.g. AppData)
detection: {u'filter': [{u'ParentImage|startswith': u'C:\Program Files'}, {u'ParentImage|endswith': ['\\sdiagnhost.exe', '\\w3wp.exe']}, {u'ParentCommandLine|contains': ['\\ProgramData\\Microsoft\\Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection']}], u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\csc.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\AppData\', u'\Windows\Temp\']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Csc.exe Source File Folder

author: Konstantin Grishchenko, oscd.community
description: Csi.exe is a signed binary from Microsoft that comes with Visual Studio and provides C# interactive capabilities. It can be used to run C# code from a file passed as a parameter in command line. Early version of this utility provided with Microsoft “Roslyn” Community Technology Preview was named 'rcsi.exe'
detection: {u'renamed': [{u'OriginalFileName': u'csi.exe'}, {u'OriginalFileName': u'rcsi.exe'}], u'selection': {u'Company': u'Microsoft Corporation'}, u'condition': u'(basic or renamed) and selection', u'basic': [{u'Image|endswith': u'\csi.exe'}, {u'Image|endswith': u'\rcsi.exe'}]}
title: Suspicious Csi.exe Usage

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file
detection: {u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -O '}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\curl.exe'}, u'condition': u'( selection1 or selection2 ) and selection3', u'selection2': {u'Product': u'The curl executable'}}
falsepositives: [Scripts created by developers and admins, Administrative activity]
title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\curl.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' -F '}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Curl File Upload

author: Sreeman
description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'curl', u' start ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Curl Start Combination

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious process injection using ZOHO's dctask64.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'DesktopCentral_Agent\agent']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\dctask64.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: ZOHO Dctask64 Process Injection

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet
detection: {u'selection_reg': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'reg delete', u'\PersonalizationCSP']}, u'selection1_filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.jpg', u'.jpeg', u'.png']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' /lockscreenurl:'}, u'condition': u'( selection1 and not selection1_filter ) or selection_reg'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community (rule), @_felamos (idea)
description: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\devtoolslauncher.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'LaunchForDeploy'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of devtoolslauncher.exe by legitimate user]
title: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary

author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\reg.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'add'}, u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnceEx', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServices', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServicesOnce', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Userinit', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Shell', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows', u'\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\User Shell Folders', u'\system\CurrentControlSet\Control\SafeBoot\AlternateShell']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and selection_2'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate software automatically (mostly, during installation) sets up autorun keys for legitimate reasons., Legitimate administrator sets up autorun keys for legitimate reasons.]
title: Direct Autorun Keys Modification

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects command that is used to disable or delete Windows eventlog via logman Windows utility
detection: {u'selection_tools': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'logman ']}, u'selection_service': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'EventLog-System']}, u'selection_action': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'stop ', u'delete ']}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate deactivation by administrative staff, Installer tools that disable services, e.g. before log collection agent installation]
title: Disable or Delete Windows Eventlog

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features
detection: {u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -name DisableFirstRunCustomize ', u' -value 2 ']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -name IEHarden ', u' -value 0 ']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -name DEPOff ', u' -value 1 ']}}
falsepositives: [Unknown, maybe some security software installer disables these features temporarily]
title: Disabled IE Security Features

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.
detection: {u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'schtasks', u'/DELETE', u'Raccine Rules Updater']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'taskkill ', u'RaccineSettings.exe']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'reg.exe', u'delete', u'Raccine Tray']}}
title: Raccine Uninstall

author: Ivan Dyachkov, oscd.community
description: Detects using Diskshadow.exe to execute arbitrary code in text file
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\diskshadow.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'/s', u'-s']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False postitve can be if administrators use diskshadow tool in their infrastructure as a main backup tool with scripts.]
logsource: {u'category': u'process_creation', u'definition': u'Requirements: Sysmon ProcessCreation logging must be activated and Windows audit must Include command line in process creation events', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Execution via Diskshadow.exe

author: Furkan Caliskan (@caliskanfurkan_)
description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool. Seems to be a tool for ransomware groups.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\ditsnap.exe']}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'ditsnap.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection or selection2'}
title: DIT Snapshot Viewer Use

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Execute C# code located in the consoleapp folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dnx.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of dnx.exe by legitimate user]
title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.exe

author: Florian Roth (rule), @blu3_team (idea)
description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'.doc.exe', u'.docx.exe', u'.xls.exe', u'.xlsx.exe', u'.ppt.exe', u'.pptx.exe', u'.rtf.exe', u'.pdf.exe', u'.txt.exe', u'      .exe', u'______.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Double Extension

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Detects execution of of Dxcap.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dxcap.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-c', u'.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate execution of dxcap.exe by legitimate user]
title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dxcap.exe

author: FPT.EagleEye
description: Detecting Emotet DLL loading by looking for rundll32.exe processes with command lines ending in ,RunDLL or ,#1
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\rundll32.exe'], u'CommandLine|endswith': [u',RunDLL']}, u'filter_ide': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\tracker.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter_ide'}
title: Emotet RunDLL32 Process Creation

author: Ecco, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects clearing or configuration of eventlogs using wevtutil, powershell and wmic. Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).
detection: {u'selection_other_ps': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Clear-EventLog', u'Remove-EventLog', u'Limit-EventLog']}, u'selection_other_wmic': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wmic.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' ClearEventLog '}, u'selection_wevtutil_binary': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wevtutil.exe'}, u'condition': u'1 of selection_other_* or (selection_wevtutil_binary and selection_wevtutil_command)', u'selection_wevtutil_command': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'clear-log', u' cl ', u'set-log', u' sl ']}}
falsepositives: [Admin activity, Scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious Eventlog Clear or Configuration Using Wevtutil

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious execution from an uncommon folder
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Image|contains': ['\\$Recycle.bin\\', '\\config\\systemprofile\\', '\\Intel\\Logs\\', '\\RSA\\MachineKeys\\', '\\Users\\All Users\\', '\\Users\\Default\\', '\\Users\\NetworkService\\', '\\Users\\Public\\', '\\Windows\\addins\\', '\\Windows\\debug\\', '\\Windows\\Fonts\\', '\\Windows\\Help\\', '\\Windows\\IME\\', '\\Windows\\Media\\', '\\Windows\\repair\\', '\\Windows\\security\\', '\\Windows\\system32\\config\\systemprofile\\', '\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\', '\\Windows\\Tasks\\']}, {u'Image|startswith': u'C:\Perflogs\'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Execution from Suspicious Folder

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious program execution in a web service root folder (filter out false positives)
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|contains': [u'bin\', u'\Tools\', u'\SMSComponent\'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\services.exe']}, u'selection': {u'Image|contains': [u'\wwwroot\', u'\wmpub\', u'\htdocs\']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Various applications, Tools that include ping or nslookup command invocations]
title: Execution in Webserver Root Folder

author: Furkan CALISKAN, @caliskanfurkan_, @oscd_initiative
description: Attackers can use explorer.exe for evading defense mechanisms
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\explorer.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'explorer.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Proxy Execution Via Explorer.exe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe /root, which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'explorer.exe', u' /root,']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unknown how many legitimate software products use that method]
title: Explorer Root Flag Process Tree Break

author: Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing
description: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe
detection: {u'folder': {u'Image|contains': u'\Downloads\'}, u'selection3': {u'Company': u'\?', u'Description': u'\?'}, u'selection1': {u'Description': u'\?', u'FileVersion': u'\?'}, u'condition': u'(selection1 or selection2 or selection3) and folder', u'selection2': {u'Product': u'\?', u'Description': u'\?'}}
title: Suspicious File Characteristics Due to Missing Fields

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects when GfxDownloadWrapper.exe downloads file from non standard URL
detection: {u'same_parent': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\GfxDownloadWrapper.exe'}, u'cmd_known_url': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'gameplayapi.intel.com'}, u'image_path': {u'Image|endswith': u'\GfxDownloadWrapper.exe'}, u'condition': u'image_path and not cmd_known_url and not same_parent'}
title: GfxDownloadWrapper.exe Downloads File from Suspicious URL

author: Furkan CALISKAN, @caliskanfurkan_, @oscd_initiative
description: Attackers can use findstr to hide their artifacts or search specific strings and evade defense mechanism
detection: {u'selection_V_L': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/V', u'/L']}, u'selectionFindstr': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'findstr']}, u'condition': u'selectionFindstr and (selection_V_L or selection_S_I)', u'selection_S_I': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/S', u'/I']}}
title: Abusing Findstr for Defense Evasion

author: Trent Liffick
description: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\findstr.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': u'.lnk'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Findstr Launching .lnk File

author: Florian Roth, omkar72, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious aged finger.exe tool execution often used in malware attacks nowadays
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\finger.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Admin activity (unclear what they do nowadays with finger.exe)]
title: Finger.exe Suspicious Invocation

author: Fatih Sirin
description: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': [u'netsh firewall set opmode mode=disable', u'netsh advfirewall set * state off']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Firewall Disabled via Netsh

author: Ecco, E.M. Anhaus, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size, etc). Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'deletejournal', u'createjournal']}, u'binary_2': {u'OriginalFileName': u'fsutil.exe'}, u'condition': u'(1 of binary_*) and selection', u'binary_1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\fsutil.exe'}}
falsepositives: [Admin activity, Scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Fsutil Suspicious Invocation

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects renamed ftp.exe, ftp.exe script execution and child processes ran by ftp.exe
detection: {u'parent_path': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'ftp.exe'}, u'ftp_path': {u'Image|endswith': u'ftp.exe'}, u'cmd_with_script_modifier': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'-s:'}, u'condition': u'(ftp_path and cmd_with_script_modifier) or (ftp_metadata and cmd_with_script_modifier) or (ftp_metadata and not ftp_path) or parent_path', u'ftp_metadata': {u'OriginalFileName|contains': u'ftp.exe'}}
title: Suspicious ftp.exe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\Users\\*\AppData\Local\Notepad++\updater\GUP.exe', u'\Users\\*\AppData\Roaming\Notepad++\updater\GUP.exe', u'\Program Files\Notepad++\updater\GUP.exe', u'\Program Files (x86)\Notepad++\updater\GUP.exe']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\GUP.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Execution of tools named GUP.exe and located in folders different than Notepad++\updater]
title: Suspicious GUP Usage

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\appcmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'install', u'module', u'/name:']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unknown as it may vary from organisation to arganisation how admins use to install IIS modules]
title: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation

author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\net1.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\net.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'share', u'/delete']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrators or Power users may remove their shares via cmd line]
title: Mounted Share Deleted

author: Matthew Matchen
description: Detect the use of Windows Defender to download payloads
detection: {u'selection1': [{u'CommandLine|contains': u'MpCmdRun.exe'}, {u'Description': u'Microsoft Malware Protection Command Line Utility'}], u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'DownloadFile', u'url']}}
title: Windows Defender Download Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious mshta process patterns
detection: {u'filter4': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.htm', u'.hta'], u'CommandLine|endswith': [u'mshta.exe', u'mshta']}, u'selection_base': {u'Image|endswith': u'\mshta.exe'}, u'selection1': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe']}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\AppData\Local', u'C:\Windows\Temp', u'C:\Users\Public']}, u'filter3': {u'Image|contains': [u'C:\Windows\System32', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64']}, u'condition': u'selection_base and ( selection1 or selection2 ) or ( selection_base and not filter3 ) or ( selection_base and not filter4 )'}
title: Suspicious MSHTA Process Patterns

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts in an uncommon directory
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\', u'C:\Windows\WinSxS\']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\msiexec.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious MsiExec Directory

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' msiexec', u'://']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: MsiExec Web Install

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: Downloads payload from remote server
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powerpnt.exe', u'\winword.exe', u'\excel.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': u'http'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Malicious Payload Download via Office Binaries

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects persitence via netsh helper
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\netsh.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'add', u'helper']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Netsh DLL Persistence

author: Michael Haag, Mark Woan (improvements), James Pemberton / @4A616D6573 / oscd.community (improvements)
description: Detects execution of Net.exe, whether suspicious or benign.
detection: {u'cmdline': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' group', u' localgroup', u' user', u' view', u' share', u' accounts', u' stop ']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\net.exe', u'\net1.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and cmdline'}
falsepositives: [Will need to be tuned. If using Splunk, I recommend | stats count by Computer,CommandLine following the search for easy hunting by computer/CommandLine.]
tags: [attack.discovery, attack.t1049, attack.t1018, attack.t1135, attack.t1201, attack.t1069.001, attack.t1069.002, attack.t1087.001, attack.t1087.002, attack.lateral_movement, attack.t1021.002, attack.t1077, attack.s0039]
title: Net.exe Execution

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available. Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.
detection: {u'selection3': {u'Image|endswith': [u'ngrok.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u' tcp ', u' http ', u' authtoken ']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' tcp 139', u' tcp 445', u' tcp 3389', u' tcp 5985', u' tcp 5986']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' start ', u'--all', u'--config', u'.yml']}}
falsepositives: [Another tool that uses the command line switches of Ngrok, ngrok http 3978 (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bot-service/bot-service-debug-channel-ngrok?view=azure-bot-service-4.0)]
title: Ngrok Usage

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\ntdsutil.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)

author: Kirill Kiryanov, Beyu Denis, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Detects defence evasion attempt via odbcconf.exe execution to load DLL
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\odbcconf.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-f', u'regsvr']}, u'selection_2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\odbcconf.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection_1 or selection_2'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of odbcconf.exe by legitimate user]
title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via DLL Loaded by odbcconf.exe

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community (rule), @harr0ey (idea)
description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\OpenWith.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'/c'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of OpenWith.exe by legitimate user]
title: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary

author: Markus Neis
description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook
detection: {u'clientMailRules': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'EnableUnsafeClientMailRules'}, u'outlookExec': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\outlook.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\\\\', u'\\', u'.exe']}, u'condition': u'clientMailRules or outlookExec'}
title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': u'\Temporary Internet Files\Content.Outlook\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Execution in Outlook Temp Folder

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects launch of executable by calling the LaunchApplication function from pcwutl.dll library.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'pcwutl', u'LaunchApplication']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Code Execution via Pcwutl.dll

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)
detection: {u'cmd_execution': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmd.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'pester', u';']}, u'get_help': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'help', u'?']}, u'condition': u'powershell_module or (cmd_execution and get_help)', u'powershell_module': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'Pester', u'Get-Help']}}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of Pester for writing tests for Powershell scripts and modules]
title: Execute Code with Pester.bat

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\ping.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'0x'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Unlikely, because no sane admin pings IP addresses in a hexadecimal form]
title: Ping Hex IP

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious powershell command line parameters used in Empire
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -NoP -sta -NonI -W Hidden -Enc ', u' -noP -sta -w 1 -enc ', u' -NoP -NonI -W Hidden -enc ', u' -noP -sta -w 1 -enc', u' -enc  SQB', u' -nop -exec bypass -EncodedCommand ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Other tools that incidentally use the same command line parameters]
title: Empire PowerShell Launch Parameters

author: Ecco
description: Detects some Empire PowerShell UAC bypass methods
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -NoP -NonI -w Hidden -c $x=$((gp HKCU:Software\\Microsoft\\Windows Update).Update)', u' -NoP -NonI -c $x=$((gp HKCU:Software\\Microsoft\\Windows Update).Update);']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Empire PowerShell UAC Bypass

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'(WCHAR)0x'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax

author: Florian Roth, Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
detection: {u'selection4': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' BA^J', u' SUVYI', u' SQBFAFgA', u' aQBlAHgA', u' aWV4I', u' IAA', u' IAB', u' UwB', u' cwB']}, u'selection5': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.exe -ENCOD ']}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -e'}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' JAB'}, u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -w', u' hidden ']}, u'falsepositive1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -ExecutionPolicy', u'remotesigned ']}, u'condition': u'((selection and selection2) or (selection and selection2 and selection3) or (selection and selection4) or selection5) and not falsepositive1'}
title: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a Get-Process command on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Get-Process lsass']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS

author: John Lambert (rule)
description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines
detection: {u'encoded': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' hidden '}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'AGkAdABzAGEAZABtAGkAbgAgAC8AdAByAGEAbgBzAGYAZQByA', u'aXRzYWRtaW4gL3RyYW5zZmVy', u'IAaQB0AHMAYQBkAG0AaQBuACAALwB0AHIAYQBuAHMAZgBlAHIA', u'JpdHNhZG1pbiAvdHJhbnNmZX', u'YgBpAHQAcwBhAGQAbQBpAG4AIAAvAHQAcgBhAG4AcwBmAGUAcg', u'Yml0c2FkbWluIC90cmFuc2Zlc', u'AGMAaAB1AG4AawBfAHMAaQB6AGUA', u'JABjAGgAdQBuAGsAXwBzAGkAegBlA', u'JGNodW5rX3Npem', u'QAYwBoAHUAbgBrAF8AcwBpAHoAZQ', u'RjaHVua19zaXpl', u'Y2h1bmtfc2l6Z', u'AE8ALgBDAG8AbQBwAHIAZQBzAHMAaQBvAG4A', u'kATwAuAEMAbwBtAHAAcgBlAHMAcwBpAG8Abg', u'lPLkNvbXByZXNzaW9u', u'SQBPAC4AQwBvAG0AcAByAGUAcwBzAGkAbwBuA', u'SU8uQ29tcHJlc3Npb2', u'Ty5Db21wcmVzc2lvb', u'AE8ALgBNAGUAbQBvAHIAeQBTAHQAcgBlAGEAbQ', u'kATwAuAE0AZQBtAG8AcgB5AFMAdAByAGUAYQBtA', u'lPLk1lbW9yeVN0cmVhb', u'SQBPAC4ATQBlAG0AbwByAHkAUwB0AHIAZQBhAG0A', u'SU8uTWVtb3J5U3RyZWFt', u'Ty5NZW1vcnlTdHJlYW', u'4ARwBlAHQAQwBoAHUAbgBrA', u'5HZXRDaHVua', u'AEcAZQB0AEMAaAB1AG4Aaw', u'LgBHAGUAdABDAGgAdQBuAGsA', u'LkdldENodW5r', u'R2V0Q2h1bm', u'AEgAUgBFAEEARABfAEkATgBGAE8ANgA0A', u'QASABSAEUAQQBEAF8ASQBOAEYATwA2ADQA', u'RIUkVBRF9JTkZPNj', u'SFJFQURfSU5GTzY0', u'VABIAFIARQBBAEQAXwBJAE4ARgBPADYANA', u'VEhSRUFEX0lORk82N', u'AHIAZQBhAHQAZQBSAGUAbQBvAHQAZQBUAGgAcgBlAGEAZA', u'cmVhdGVSZW1vdGVUaHJlYW', u'MAcgBlAGEAdABlAFIAZQBtAG8AdABlAFQAaAByAGUAYQBkA', u'NyZWF0ZVJlbW90ZVRocmVhZ', u'Q3JlYXRlUmVtb3RlVGhyZWFk', u'QwByAGUAYQB0AGUAUgBlAG0AbwB0AGUAVABoAHIAZQBhAGQA', u'0AZQBtAG0AbwB2AGUA', u'1lbW1vdm', u'AGUAbQBtAG8AdgBlA', u'bQBlAG0AbQBvAHYAZQ', u'bWVtbW92Z', u'ZW1tb3Zl']}, u'condition': u'encoded and selection'}
title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs
detection: {u'falsepositive': {u'CurrentDirectory|contains': u'\Health Service State\'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not falsepositive'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation Based on Parent Process

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Harish Segar (rule)
description: Detects a suspicious parents of powershell.exe
detection: {u'selection_image1': [{u'ParentImage|endswith': ['\\mshta.exe', '\\rundll32.exe', '\\regsvr32.exe', '\\services.exe', '\\winword.exe', '\\wmiprvse.exe', '\\powerpnt.exe', '\\excel.exe', '\\msaccess.exe', '\\mspub.exe', '\\visio.exe', '\\outlook.exe', '\\amigo.exe', '\\chrome.exe', '\\firefox.exe', '\\iexplore.exe', '\\microsoftedgecp.exe', '\\microsoftedge.exe', '\\browser.exe', '\\vivaldi.exe', '\\safari.exe', '\\sqlagent.exe', '\\sqlserver.exe', '\\sqlservr.exe', '\\w3wp.exe', '\\httpd.exe', '\\nginx.exe', '\\php-cgi.exe', '\\jbosssvc.exe', 'MicrosoftEdgeSH.exe']}, {u'ParentImage|contains': u'tomcat'}], u'selection_powershell': [{u'CommandLine|contains': ['powershell', 'pwsh']}, {u'Description': u'Windows PowerShell'}, {u'Product': u'PowerShell Core 6'}], u'condition': u'all of them'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Parent Process

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy', u'ystem32\config\sam']}, u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Copy-Item', u'cp $_.', u'cpi $_.', u'copy $_.', u'.File]::Copy(']}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
falsepositives: [Some rare backup scenarios, PowerShell scripts fixing HiveNightmare / SeriousSAM ACLs]
title: PowerShell SAM Copy

author: Furkan CALISKAN, @caliskanfurkan_, @oscd_initiative
description: Attackers can use print.exe for remote file copy
detection: {u'exeCondition': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.exe']}, u'cmdExclude': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'print.exe']}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\print.exe'], u'CommandLine|startswith': [u'print']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2 and exeCondition and not cmdExclude', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'/D']}}
title: Abusing Print Executable

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter ' -ma ' and ' -accepteula' in a single step. This way we're also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -ma ', u' -accepteula ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Another tool that uses the command line switches of Procdump, Legitimate use of procdump by a developer or administrator]
title: Suspicious Use of Procdump

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we're also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.
detection: {u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' -ma ', u' ls']}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' -ma '}, u'condition': u'( selection1 and selection2 ) or selection3', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' lsass'}}
falsepositives: [Unlikely, because no one should dump an lsass process memory, Another tool that uses the command line switches of Procdump]
title: Suspicious Use of Procdump on LSASS

author: omkar72 - https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2020/10/kegtap-and-singlemalt-with-a-ransomware-chaser.html
description: Detect ed user accept agreement execution in psexec commandline
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\psexec.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'accepteula'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Psexec Accepteula Condition

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious flags used by PsExec and PAExec but no usual program name in command line
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'paexec', u'PsExec']}, u'selection_flags_2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' /accepteula ', u'cmd /c ', u' -u ', u' -p ']}, u'condition': u'( selection_flags_1 or selection_flags_2 ) and not filter', u'selection_flags_1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\\127.0.0.1', u' -s ', u'cmd.exe']}}
falsepositives: [Weird admins that rename their tools, Software companies that bundle PsExec/PAExec with their software and rename it, so that it is less embarrassing]
title: PsExec/PAExec Flags

author: Beyu Denis, oscd.community
description: The psr.exe captures desktop screenshots and saves them on the local machine
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\Psr.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'/start'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Psr.exe Capture Screenshots

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Local\', u'Roaming\'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/c', u'powershell', u'\AppData\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell Script Run in AppData

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'powershell', u'.DownloadFile', u'System.Net.WebClient']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: PowerShell DownloadFile

author: @ROxPinTeddy
description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.
detection: {u'selection_other': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -m', u' a ']}, u'selection_password': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -hp']}, u'condition': u'selection_password and selection_other'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of Winrar command line version, Other command line tools, that use these flags]
title: Rar with Password or Compression Level

author: juju4
description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'rasdial.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious RASdial Activity

author: Florian Roth, Maxime Thiebaut
description: Detects a explorer.exe sub process of the RazerInstaller software which can be invoked from the installer to select a different installation folder but can also be exploited to escalate privileges to LOCAL SYSTEM
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|startswith': u'C:\Windows\Installer\Razer\Installer\'}, u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\RazerInstaller.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': u'System'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [User selecting a different installation folder (check for other sub processes of this explorer.exe process)]
title: Suspicious RazerInstaller Explorer Subprocess

author: Aaron Greetham (@beardofbinary) - NCC Group
description: Detects Rclone which is commonly used by ransomware groups for exfiltration
detection: {u'exec_selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rclone.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\PowerShell.exe', u'\cmd.exe']}, u'description_selection': {u'Description': u'Rsync for cloud storage'}, u'command_selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' pass ', u' user ', u' copy ', u' mega ', u' sync ', u' config ', u' lsd ', u' remote ', u' ls ']}, u'condition': u'command_selection and ( description_selection or exec_selection )'}
title: Rclone Execution via Command Line or PowerShell

author: Florian Roth, omkar72
description: Detects suspicious command line activity on Windows systems
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': [u'net group "domain admins" /dom', u'net localgroup administrators', u'net group "enterprise admins" /dom', u'net accounts /dom']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Inventory tool runs, Penetration tests, Administrative activity]
title: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity
analysis: {u'recommendation': u'Check if the user that executed the commands is suspicious (e.g. service accounts, LOCAL_SYSTEM)'}

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regedit.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\TrustedInstaller.exe', u'\ProcessHacker.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Regedit as Trusted Installer

author: Ivan Dyachkov, Yulia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects using register-cimprovider.exe to execute arbitrary dll file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\register-cimprovider.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-path', u'dll']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'process_creation', u'definition': u'Requirements: Sysmon ProcessCreation logging must be activated and Windows audit msut Include command line in process creation events', u'product': u'windows'}
title: DLL Execution Via Register-cimprovider.exe

author: Florian Roth, oscd.community
description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe
detection: {u'selection4': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'http', u'ftp'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/i:'], u'CommandLine|endswith': u'scrobj.dll'}, u'selection5': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wscript.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe'}, u'selection6': {u'Image|endswith': u'\EXCEL.EXE', u'CommandLine|contains': u'..\..\..\Windows\System32\regsvr32.exe '}, u'selection7': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\mshta.exe'}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'\Temp\'}, u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\powershell.exe'}, u'selection3': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\cmd.exe'}, u'selection8': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\AppData\Local', u'C:\Users\Public']}, u'condition': u'1 of them'}
title: Regsvr32 Anomaly

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' /n '}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' /i:'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Regsvr32 Flags Anomaly

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a regsvr.exe execution that doesn't contain a DLL in the command line
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.dll', u'.ocx', u'.cpl', u'.ax', u'.bav', u'.ppl']}, u'filter_null1_for_4688': {u'CommandLine': None}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\regsvr32.exe'}, u'filter_null2_for_4688': {u'CommandLine': u''}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter and not filter_null1_for_4688 and not filter_null2_for_4688'}
title: Regsvr32 Command Line Without DLL

author: Florian Roth, John Lambert (idea)
description: Detects a suspicious reg.exe invocation that looks as if it would disable an important security service
detection: {u'selection_reg': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'reg', u'add', u' /d 4', u' /v Start']}, u'condition': u'selection_reg and selection_services', u'selection_services': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\Sense ', u'\WinDefend', u'\MsMpSvc', u'\NisSrv', u'\WdBoot ', u'\WdNisDrv', u'\WdNisSvc', u'\wscsvc ', u'\SecurityHealthService', u'\wuauserv', u'\UsoSvc ']}}
title: Reg Disable Security Service

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dctask64.exe'}, u'selection': {u'Imphash': u'6834B1B94E49701D77CCB3C0895E1AFD'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\Dbgview.exe', u'OriginalFileName': u'Dbgview.exe'}, u'selection': {u'Product': [u'Sysinternals DebugView', u'Sysinternals Debugview']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Renamed SysInternals Debug View

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious renamed PAExec execution as often used by attackers
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\PAexec.exe', u'\paexec.exe']}, u'selection1': {u'Description': u'PAExec Application'}, u'condition': u'( selection1 or selection2 ) and not filter', u'selection2': {u'OriginalFileName': u'PAExec.exe'}}
falsepositives: [Weird admins that rename their tools, Software companies that bundle PAExec with their software and rename it, so that it is less embarrassing]
title: Renamed PAExec

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects using Rpcping.exe to send a RPC test connection to the target server (-s) and force the NTLM hash to be sent in the process.
detection: {u'use_rpcping': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rpcping.exe'}, u'remote_server': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'-s', u'/s']}, u'condition': u'use_rpcping and remote_server and ntlm_auth', u'ntlm_auth': [{u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['-u', 'NTLM']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['/u', 'NTLM']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['-t', 'ncacn_np']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['/t', 'ncacn_np']}]}
title: Capture Credentials with Rpcping.exe

author: juju4, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on arguments
detection: {u'selection': [{u'CommandLine|contains': ['javascript:', '.RegisterXLL']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['url.dll', 'OpenURL']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['url.dll', 'OpenURLA']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['url.dll', 'FileProtocolHandler']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['zipfldr.dll', 'RouteTheCall']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['shell32.dll', 'Control_RunDLL']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['shell32.dll', 'ShellExec_RunDLL']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['mshtml.dll', 'PrintHTML']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['advpack.dll', 'LaunchINFSection']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['advpack.dll', 'RegisterOCX']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['ieadvpack.dll', 'LaunchINFSection']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['ieadvpack.dll', 'RegisterOCX']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['ieframe.dll', 'OpenURL']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['shdocvw.dll', 'OpenURL']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['syssetup.dll', "SetupInfObjectInstallAction'"]}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['setupapi.dll', 'InstallHinfSection']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['pcwutl.dll', 'LaunchApplication']}, {u'CommandLine|contains|all': ['dfshim.dll', 'ShOpenVerbApplication']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious calls of DLLs in rundll32.dll exports by ordinal
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'EDGEHTML.dll', u'#141']}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\rundll32.exe', u',#']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment, Windows control panel elements have been identified as source (mmc)]
title: Suspicious Call by Ordinal

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'rundll32.exe', u'Execute', u'RegRead', u'window.close']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Rundll32 Invoking Inline VBScript

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe'}, u'filter1': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\svchost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter1 and not filter2', u'filter2': {u'ParentImage|contains': [u'\AppData\Local\', u'\Microsoft\Edge\']}}
title: Suspicious Rundll32 Without Any CommandLine Params

author: Konstantin Grishchenko, oscd.community
description: setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\runonce.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\rundll32.exe', u'ParentCommandLine|contains|all': [u'setupapi.dll', u'InstallHinfSection']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Scripts and administrative tools that use INF files for driver installation with setupapi.dll]
title: Suspicious Rundll32 Setupapi.dll Activity

author: Florian Roth
