description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452
detection: {u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'rundll32.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.sys,', u'.sys ']}}
title: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity Invoking Sys File

author: Avneet Singh @v3t0_, oscd.community
description: This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry
detection: {u'process_name': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\runonce.exe']}, u'process_description': {u'Description': [u'Run Once Wrapper']}, u'command_line': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /AlternateShellStartup']}, u'condition': u'(process_name or process_description) and command_line'}
title: Run Once Task Execution as Configured in Registry

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe
detection: {u'cmd': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'surfacecheck'}, u'image_path': {u'Image|endswith': u'\Runscripthelper.exe'}, u'condition': u'image_path and cmd'}
title: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe

author: juju4, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Image|contains': [':\\RECYCLER\\', ':\\SystemVolumeInformation\\']}, {u'Image|startswith': ['C:\\Windows\\Tasks\\', 'C:\\Windows\\debug\\', 'C:\\Windows\\fonts\\', 'C:\\Windows\\help\\', 'C:\\Windows\\drivers\\', 'C:\\Windows\\addins\\', 'C:\\Windows\\cursors\\', 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\tasks\\']}], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Suspicious Process Start Locations

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session
detection: {u'filter': {u'User|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', u'AUTORITE NT\Sys']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\schtasks.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' /create '}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
tags: [attack.execution, attack.persistence, attack.privilege_escalation, attack.t1053.005, attack.t1053, attack.s0111, car.2013-08-001]
title: Scheduled Task Creation

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\schtasks.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u' /create ', u' /sc once ', u'\Temp\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects ScreenConnect program starts that establish a remote access to that system (not meeting, not remote support)
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'e=Access&', u'y=Guest&', u'&p=', u'&c=', u'&k=']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: ScreenConnect Remote Access

author: frack113
description:
Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.
Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension
detection: {u'selection_option_1': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/v ScreenSaveActive', u'/t REG_SZ', u'/d 1', u'/f']}, u'selection_option_3': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/v ScreenSaverIsSecure', u'/t REG_SZ', u'/d 0', u'/f']}, u'selection_option_2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/v ScreenSaveTimeout', u'/t REG_SZ', u'/d ', u'/f']}, u'selection_option_4': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/v SCRNSAVE.EXE', u'/t REG_SZ', u'/d ', u'.scr', u'/f']}, u'selection_reg': {u'Image|endswith': u'reg.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop', u'HKCU\Control Panel\Desktop']}, u'condition': u'selection_reg and 1 of selection_option_*'}
title: Suspicious ScreenSave Change by Reg.exe

author: Michael Haag
description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.jse', u'.vbe', u'.js', u'.vba']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Will need to be tuned. I recommend adding the user profile path in CommandLine if it is getting too noisy.]
title: WSF/JSE/JS/VBA/VBE File Execution

author: Florian Roth, Max Altgelt
description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' >', u'Out-File', u'ConvertTo-Json']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\Windows\Temp', u'\Temporary Internet', u'\AppData\Local\Temp', u'\AppData\Roaming\Temp', u'%TEMP%', u'%TMP%', u'%LocalAppData%\Temp']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder

author: Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications that can  be used to hide services or make them unstopable
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\sc.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'sdset', u'D;;']}, u'sids': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u';;;IU', u';;;SU', u';;;BA', u';;;SY', u';;;WD']}, u'condition': u'selection and sids'}
title: Suspicious Service DACL Modification

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a service binary running in a suspicious directory
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': [u'\Users\Public\', u'\$Recycle.bin', u'\Users\All Users\', u'\Users\Default\', u'\Users\Contacts\', u'\Users\Searches\', u'C:\Perflogs\', u'\config\systemprofile\', u'\Windows\Fonts\', u'\Windows\IME\', u'\Windows\addins\'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\services.exe', u'\svchost.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Service Binary Directory

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects service path modification to PowerShell or cmd.
detection: {u'selection_1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\sc.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'config', u'binpath']}, u'selection_2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'powershell', u'cmd']}, u'condition': u'selection_1 and selection_2'}
title: Suspicious Service Path Modification

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Serv-U CVE-2021-35211 vulnerability by threat group DEV-0322
detection: {u'selection3': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'C:\Windows\Temp\Serv-U.bat'}, u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'whoami'}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2 or selection3', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'./Client/Common/', u'.\Client\Common\']}}
title: Serv-U Exploitation CVE-2021-35211 by DEV-0322

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\wscript.exe', u'\cscript.exe', u'\sh.exe', u'\bash.exe', u'\schtasks.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'\mshta.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\msiexec.exe', u'\forfiles.exe', u'\scriptrunner.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\Serv-U.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate uses in which users or programs use the SSH service of Serv-U for remote command execution]
title: Suspicious Serv-U Process Pattern

author: FPT.EagleEye Team, wagga
description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from MSSQL process, this might be sight of RCE or SQL Injection
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\sh.exe', u'\bash.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\bitsadmin.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\sqlservr.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by SQL Server

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence
detection: {u'selection2a': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'rundll32', u'kernel32.dll']}, u'selection1b': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'ShimFlushCache', u'#250']}, u'selection2b': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'BaseFlushAppcompatCache', u'#46']}, u'condition': u'( selection1a and selection1b ) or ( selection2a and selection2b )', u'selection1a': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'rundll32', u'apphelp.dll']}}
title: ShimCache Flush

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|endswith': u'splwow64.exe'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\splwow64.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious Splwow64 Without Params

author: Justin C. (@endisphotic), @dreadphones (detection), Thomas Patzke (Sigma rule)
description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.
detection:
{u'suspicious_net_filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'start'}, u'suspicious_netsh_filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'add portopening', u'rule name']}, u'suspicious_powershell': {u'Image|endswith': u'\powershell.exe'}, u'suspicious_powershell_filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'.spl'}, u'suspicious_cmd': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmd.exe'}, u'suspicious_cmd_filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'.spl', u'route add', u'program files']}, u'spoolsv': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\spoolsv.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': u'System'}, u'suspicious_net': {u'Image|endswith': u'
et.exe'}, u'suspicious_netsh': {u'Image|endswith': u'
etsh.exe'}, u'suspicious_unrestricted': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\gpupdate.exe', u'\whoami.exe', u'
ltest.exe', u'	askkill.exe', u'\wmic.exe', u'	askmgr.exe', u'\sc.exe', u' indstr.exe', u'\curl.exe', u'\wget.exe', u'\certutil.exe', u' itsadmin.exe', u'\accesschk.exe', u'\wevtutil.exe', u' cdedit.exe', u' sutil.exe', u'\cipher.exe', u'\schtasks.exe', u'\write.exe', u'\wuauclt.exe']}, u'condition': u'spoolsv and ( suspicious_unrestricted or (suspicious_net and not suspicious_net_filter) or (suspicious_cmd and not suspicious_cmd_filter) or (suspicious_netsh and not suspicious_netsh_filter) or (suspicious_powershell and not suspicious_powershell_filter) or suspicious_rundll32 )', u'suspicious_rundll32': {u'Image|endswith': u'undll32.exe', u'CommandLine|endswith': u'rundll32.exe'}}
title: Suspicious Spool Service Child Process

author: Kirill Kiryanov, oscd.community
description: Detects process dump via legitimate sqldumper.exe binary
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\sqldumper.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'0x0110', u'0x01100:40']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Dumping Process via Sqldumper.exe

author: Karneades / Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\update.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'--processStart', u'--processStartAndWait', u'--createShortcut'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [1Clipboard, Beaker Browser, Caret, Collectie, Discord, Figma, Flow, Ghost, GitHub Desktop, GitKraken, Hyper, Insomnia, JIBO, Kap, Kitematic, Now Desktop, Postman, PostmanCanary, Rambox, Simplenote, Skype, Slack, SourceTree, Stride, Svgsus, WebTorrent, WhatsApp, WordPress.com, atom, gitkraken, slack, teams]
title: Squirrel Lolbin

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious svchost process start
detection: {u'filter': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\services.exe', u'\MsMpEng.exe', u'\Mrt.exe', u'\rpcnet.exe', u'\svchost.exe']}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\svchost.exe'}, u'filter_null': {u'ParentImage': None}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter and not filter_null'}
title: Suspicious Svchost Process

author: David Burkett
description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.
detection: {u'filter': [{u'ParentImage|endswith': ['\\rpcnet.exe', '\\rpcnetp.exe']}, {u'CommandLine': None}], u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|endswith': u'svchost.exe'}, u'condition': u'(selection1 and selection2) and not filter', u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\svchost.exe'}}
falsepositives: [rpcnet.exe / rpcnetp.exe which is a lojack style software. https://www.blackhat.com/docs/us-14/materials/us-14-Kamlyuk-Kamluk-Computrace-Backdoor-Revisited.pdf]
title: Suspect Svchost Activity

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\sysprep.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\AppData\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment]
title: Sysprep on AppData Folder

author: Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community
description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'\SYSVOL\', u'\policies\']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\taskmgr.exe', u'User|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', u'AUTORITE NT\Sys']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Taskmgr as LOCAL_SYSTEM

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the creation of a process from Windows task manager
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\resmon.exe', u'\mmc.exe', u'\taskmgr.exe']}, u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\taskmgr.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Taskmgr as Parent

author: Avneet Singh @v3t0_, oscd.community
description: This rule detects DLL injection and execution via LOLBAS - Tracker.exe
detection: {u'process_name': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\tracker.exe']}, u'process_description': {u'Description': [u'Tracker']}, u'commandline_param2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /c ']}, u'condition': u'(process_name or process_description) and commandline_param1 and commandline_param2', u'commandline_param1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' /d ']}}
title: DLL Injection with Tracker.exe

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\tscon.exe', u'User|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', u'AUTORITE NT\Sys']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious TSCON Start

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' /dest:rdp-tcp:'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects indicators of a UAC bypass method by mocking directories
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': u'C:\Windows \System32\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: TrustedPath UAC Bypass Pattern

author: Florian Roth (rule), Samir Bousseaden (idea)
description: Detects a suspicious child process of userinit
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\userinit.exe'}, u'filter1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'\netlogon\'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter1 and not filter2', u'filter2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\explorer.exe'}}
title: Suspicious Userinit Child Process

author: Michael R. (@nahamike01)
description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\csi.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\powershell.exe', u'OriginalFileName': u'csi.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Possible depending on environment. Pair with other factors such as net connections, command-line args, etc.]
title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console

author: Agro (@agro_sev) oscd.community
description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.
detection: {u'reduction': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\sqlagent.exe'}, u'selection3': {u'OriginalFileName': u'\sqlps.exe'}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\sqlps.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2 or selection3 and not reduction', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\sqlps.exe'}}
falsepositives: [Direct PS command execution through SQLPS.exe is uncommon, childprocess sqlps.exe spawned by sqlagent.exe is a legitimate action.]
title: Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe

author: Agro (@agro_sev) oscd.communitly
description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.
detection: {u'reduction': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\smss.exe'}, u'selection3': {u'OriginalFileName': u'\sqltoolsps.exe'}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\sqltoolsps.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2 or selection3 and not reduction', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\sqltoolsps.exe'}}
falsepositives: [Direct PS command execution through SQLToolsPS.exe is uncommon, childprocess sqltoolsps.exe spawned by smss.exe is a legitimate action.]
title: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection

author: Agro (@agro_sev) oscd.community
description: Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces). Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe
detection: {u'selection3': {u'OriginalFileName': u'\te.exe'}, u'selection1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\te.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection1 or selection2 or selection3', u'selection2': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\te.exe'}}
falsepositives: [It's not an uncommon to use te.exe directly to execute legal TAEF tests]
title: Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection

author: Agro (@agro_sev), Ensar Şamil (@sblmsrsn), oscd.community
description: There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger. This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary. The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.
detection: {u'reduction2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\devenv.exe'}, u'reduction1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\vsimmersiveactivatehelper*.exe'}, u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\vsjitdebugger.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not (reduction1 or reduction2)'}
falsepositives: [the process spawned by vsjitdebugger.exe is uncommon.]
title: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger

author: Konstantin Grishchenko, oscd.community
description: Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run with parameters allowing processing INF file. This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers. For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\VBoxDrvInst.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'driver', u'executeinf']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of VBoxDrvInst.exe utility by VirtualBox Guest Additions installation process]
title: Suspicious VBoxDrvInst.exe Parameters

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious inline VBScript keywords as used by UNC2452
detection: {u'filter': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run']}, u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'Execute', u'CreateObject', u'RegRead', u'window.close', u'\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Suspicious VBScript UN2452 Pattern

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'reg', u' add ', u'\Services\VSS\Diag', u'/d Disabled']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Disabled Volume Snapshots

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exloitation / privilege escalation but rarely used by administrators
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\whoami.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Admin activity, Scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment, Monitoring activity]
title: Whoami Execution

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects the execution of whoami with suspicious parents or parameters
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\whoami.exe'}, u'filter1': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\powershell.exe']}, u'filter3': {u'ParentImage': None}, u'filter2': {u'ParentImage': [u'C:\Program Files\Microsoft Monitoring Agent\Agent\MonitoringHost.exe', u'']}, u'condition': u'( selection and not filter1 and not filter2 and not filter3 ) or selection_special', u'selection_special': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'whoami -all', u'whoami /all', u'whoami.exe -all', u'whoami.exe /all']}}
falsepositives: [Admin activity, Scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment, Monitoring activity]
title: Whoami Execution Anomaly

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)
detection: {u'contains_format_pretty_arg': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'format:pretty', u'format:"pretty"', u'format:"text"', u'format:text']}, u'image_from_system_folder': {u'Image|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\']}, u'condition': u'contains_winrm and (contains_format_pretty_arg and not image_from_system_folder)', u'contains_winrm': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'winrm'}}
title: AWL Bypass with Winrm.vbs and Malicious WsmPty.xsl/WsmTxt.xsl

author: Julia Fomina, oscd.community
description: Detects an attempt to execute code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cscript.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'winrm', u'invoke Create wmicimv2/Win32_', u'-r:http']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Remote Code Execute via Winrm.vbs

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects WMIC executions in which a event consumer gets created in order to establish persistence
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'ActiveScriptEventConsumer', u' CREATE ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious WMIC ActiveScriptEventConsumer Creation

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects WMI executing rundll32
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'process call create', u'rundll32']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious WMI Execution Using Rundll32

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects deinstallation of security products using WMIC utility
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'wmic', u'product where name=', u'call uninstall', u'/nointeractive']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection_product', u'selection_product': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Antivirus', u'AVG ', u'Crowdstrike Sensor', u'DLP Endpoint', u'Endpoint Detection', u'Endpoint Protection', u'Endpoint Security', u'Endpoint Sensor', u'ESET File Security', u'Malwarebytes', u'McAfee Agent', u'Microsoft Security Client', u'Threat Protection', u'VirusScan', u'Webroot SecureAnywhere', u'Windows Defender']}}
title: Wmic Uninstall Security Product

author: Michael Haag, Florian Roth, juju4, oscd.community
description: Detects WMI executing suspicious commands
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wmic.exe'}, u'recon_part2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'AntiVirus', u'Firewall'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'Product', u' get ']}, u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'process', u'call', u'create ']}, u'condition': u'(selection and selection2) or (selection and recon_part1 and recon_part2)', u'recon_part1': {u'CommandLine|contains': u' path '}}
falsepositives: [If using Splunk, we recommend | stats count by Computer,CommandLine following for easy hunting by Computer/CommandLine]
title: Suspicious WMI Execution

author: Maxime Thiebaut (@0xThiebaut)
description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\System32\control.exe'}, u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\control.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\WorkFolders.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate usage of the uncommon Windows Work Folders feature.]
logsource: {u'category': u'process_creation', u'definition': u'Requirements: Sysmon ProcessCreation logging must be activated', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Execution via WorkFolders.exe

author: oscd.community, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\wsl.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u' -e ', u' --exec ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Automation and orchestration scripts may use this method execute scripts etc]
title: WSL Execution

author: FPT.EagleEye Team
description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\wuauclt.exe'], u'ProcessCommandLine|contains|all': [u'/UpdateDeploymentProvider', u'/RunHandlerComServer']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Update Client LOLBIN

author: Janantha Marasinghe (https://github.com/blueteam0ps)
description: Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability. This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.
detection: {u'selection_auditpol_binary': {u'Image|endswith': u'\auditpol.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection_auditpol_binary and selection_auditpol_command', u'selection_auditpol_command': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'disable', u'clear', u'remove', u'restore']}}
title: Suspicious Auditpol Usage

author: Kirill Kiryanov, oscd.community
description: Detect possible Sysmon driver unload
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\fltmc.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'unload', u'sys']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Sysmon Driver Unload

author: Florian Roth, Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community
description: Detects a Windows program executable started in a suspicious folder
detection: {u'filter': [{u'Image|startswith': ['C:\\Windows\\System32\\', 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\', 'C:\\Windows\\SysWow64\\', 'C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\', 'C:\\Windows\\winsxs\\', 'C:\\Windows\\WinSxS\\', 'C:\\avast! sandbox']}, {u'Image|contains': u'\SystemRoot\System32\'}, {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\explorer.exe'}], u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\svchost.exe', u'\rundll32.exe', u'\services.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\regsvr32.exe', u'\spoolsv.exe', u'\lsass.exe', u'\smss.exe', u'\csrss.exe', u'\conhost.exe', u'\wininit.exe', u'\lsm.exe', u'\winlogon.exe', u'\explorer.exe', u'\taskhost.exe', u'\Taskmgr.exe', u'\sihost.exe', u'\RuntimeBroker.exe', u'\smartscreen.exe', u'\dllhost.exe', u'\audiodg.exe', u'\wlanext.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: System File Execution Location Anomaly

author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Ian Davis, oscd.community
description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\tapinstall.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Tap Installer Execution

author: Sreeman
description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr
detection: {u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'echo ', u'copy ', u'type ', u'file createnew']}, u'condition': u'selection1 and selection2', u'selection2': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' C:\Windows\System32\Tasks\', u' C:\Windows\SysWow64\Tasks\']}}
title: Tasks Folder Evasion

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\rdpclip.exe'}, u'selection': {u'ParentCommandLine|contains|all': [u'\svchost.exe', u'termsvcs']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Terminal Service Process Spawn

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects different hacktools used for relay attacks on Windows for privilege escalation
detection: {u'selection_pe': {u'Image|contains': [u'PetitPotam', u'RottenPotato', u'HotPotato', u'JuicyPotato', u'\just_dce_', u'Juicy Potato', u'\temp\rot.exe', u'\Potato.exe', u'\SpoolSample.exe', u'\Responder.exe', u'\smbrelayx', u'\ntlmrelayx']}, u'selection_script': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'Invoke-Tater', u' smbrelay', u' ntlmrelay', u'cme smb ', u' /ntlm:NTLMhash ', u'Invoke-PetitPotam']}, u'condition': u'selection_pe or selection_script'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate files with these rare hacktool names]
title: SMB Relay Attack Tools

author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Tony Lambert), oscd.community, omkar72
description: Identifies execution of nltest.exe and dsquery.exe for domain trust discovery. This technique is used by attackers to enumerate Active Directory trusts.
detection: {u'selection_dsquery_v2': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dsquery.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'-filter', u'trustedDomain']}, u'selection_dsquery_v1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dsquery.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'trustedDomain'}, u'selection_nltest_v1': {u'Image|endswith': u'\nltest.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'domain_trusts', u'all_trusts', u'/trusted_domains', u'/dclist']}, u'condition': u'1 of them'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of the utilities by legitimate user for legitimate reason]
title: Domain Trust Discovery

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects an UAC bypass that uses changepk.exe and slui.exe (UACMe 61)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\changepk.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\slui.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using ChangePK and SLUI

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using scheduled tasks and variable expansion of cleanmgr.exe (UACMe 34)
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentCommandLine': u'C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k netsvcs -p -s Schedule', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System'], u'CommandLine|endswith': u'"\system32\cleanmgr.exe /autoclean /d C:'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using Disk Cleanup

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using computerdefaults.exe (UACMe 59)
detection: {u'filter': {u'ParentImage|contains': [u':\Windows\System32', u':\Program Files']}, u'selection': {u'Image': u'C:\Windows\System32\ComputerDefaults.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: UAC Bypass Using ComputerDefaults

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\werfault.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\consent.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - Process

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using DismHost DLL hijacking (UACMe 63)
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|contains|all': [u'C:\Users\', u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'\DismHost.exe'], u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using DismHost

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|contains': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'Image|endswith': u'consent.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\ieinstal.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using IEInstal - Process

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine': u'"C:\Windows\system32\msconfig.exe" -5', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\pkgmgr.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - Process

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)
detection: {u'selection1': {u'CommandLine|startswith': u'"C:\Windows\system32\wusa.exe"  /quiet C:\Users\', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System'], u'CommandLine|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\update.msu'}, u'condition': u'1 of selection*', u'selection2': {u'ParentCommandLine': u'"C:\Windows\system32\dism.exe" /online /quiet /norestart /add-package /packagepath:"C:\Windows\system32\pe386" /ignorecheck', u'Image|endswith': u'\DismHost.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System'], u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'C:\Users\', u'\AppData\Local\Temp\', u'\dismhost.exe {']}}
title: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - Process

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using pkgmgr.exe and dism.exe (UACMe 23)
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\dism.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\pkgmgr.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Using PkgMgr and DISM

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentCommandLine|contains': u'C:\Windows \system32\winsat.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\AppData\Local\Temp\system32\winsat.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Process

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)
detection: {u'selection1': {u'Image': u'C:\Program Files\Windows Media Player\osk.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'1 of selection*', u'selection2': {u'ParentCommandLine': u'"C:\Windows\system32\mmc.exe" "C:\Windows\system32\eventvwr.msc" /s', u'Image': u'C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}}
title: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Process

author: Christian Burkard
description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass via WSReset usable by default sysmon-config
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wsreset.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': [u'High', u'System']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: UAC Bypass WSReset

author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community
description: Detect child processes of automatically elevated instances of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe).
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cmstp.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': [u'/s', u'/au']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of cmstp.exe utility by legitimate user]
title: Bypass UAC via CMSTP

author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Tony Lambert), oscd.community
description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\fodhelper.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate use of fodhelper.exe utility by legitimate user]
title: Bypass UAC via Fodhelper.exe

author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Tony Lambert), oscd.community
description: Identifies use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.
detection: {u'filter': {u'Image|endswith': u'\conhost.exe'}, u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\wsreset.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter'}
title: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov
description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand
detection: {u'binpath': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'config', u'binPath']}, u'scbynonadmin': {u'Image|endswith': u'\sc.exe', u'IntegrityLevel': u'Medium'}, u'condition': u'scbynonadmin and (binpath or failurecommand)', u'failurecommand': {u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'failure', u'command']}}
title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions

author: Anton Kutepov, oscd.community
description: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary
detection: {u'parent_is_settingsynchost': {u'ParentCommandLine|contains|all': [u'cmd.exe /c', u'RoamDiag.cmd', u'-outputpath']}, u'system_utility': {u'Image|startswith': [u'C:\Windows\System32\', u'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\']}, u'condition': u'not system_utility and parent_is_settingsynchost'}
title: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID
detection: {u'cmd_s': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'/S'}, u'cmd_c': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'/C'}, u'image_path': {u'Image|endswith': u'\verclsid.exe'}, u'condition': u'image_path and cmd_c and cmd_s'}
title: Verclsid.exe Runs COM Object

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, @oscd_initiative
description: Detects successful code compilation via Visual Basic Command Line Compiler that utilizes Windows Resource to Object Converter.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\cvtres.exe', u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\vbc.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Utilization of this tool should not be seen in enterprise environment]
title: Visual Basic Command Line Compiler Usage

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a JAVA process running with remote debugging allowing more than just localhost to connect
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'transport=dt_socket,address='}, u'exclusion': [{u'CommandLine|contains': u'address=127.0.0.1'}, {u'CommandLine|contains': u'address=localhost'}], u'condition': u'selection and not exclusion'}
title: Java Running with Remote Debugging

author: Florian Roth, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community
description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells
detection:
{u'wmic_utility': {u'Image|endswith': u'\wmic.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' /node:'}, u'misc_discovery_binaries': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\whoami.exe', u'\systeminfo.exe', u'\quser.exe', u'\ipconfig.exe', u'\pathping.exe', u'	racert.exe', u'
etstat.exe', u'\schtasks.exe', u'\vssadmin.exe', u'\wevtutil.exe', u'	asklist.exe']}, u'change_dir': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u'&cd&echo', u'cd /d ']}, u'parent_is_web_server_process': [{u'ParentImage|endswith': ['\w3wp.exe', '\php-cgi.exe', '\nginx.exe', '\httpd.exe']}, {u'ParentImage|contains': ['\apache', '\tomcat']}], u'ping_utility': {u'Image|endswith': u'\ping.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u' -n '}, u'misc_discovery_commands': {u'CommandLine|contains': [u' Test-NetConnection ', u'dir ']}, u'condition': u'parent_is_web_server_process and (net_utility or ping_utility or change_dir or wmic_utility or misc_discovery_binaries or misc_discovery_commands)', u'net_utility': {u'Image|endswith': [u'
et.exe', u'
et1.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u' user ', u' use ', u' group ']}}
tags: [attack.persistence, attack.t1505.003, attack.t1018, attack.t1033, attack.t1087, attack.privilege_escalation, attack.t1100]
title: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords

author: Cian Heasley
description: Looking for processes spawned by web server components that indicate reconnaissance by popular public domain webshells for whether perl, python or wget are installed.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'ParentImage|contains': ['\\apache', '\\tomcat']}, {u'ParentImage|endswith': ['\\w3wp.exe', '\\php-cgi.exe', '\\nginx.exe', '\\httpd.exe']}], u'selection2': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe'], u'CommandLine|contains': [u'perl --help', u'python --help', u'wget --help', u'perl -h']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
title: Webshell Recon Detection Via CommandLine & Processes

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Web servers that spawn shell processes could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or an other attack
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\cmd.exe', u'\sh.exe', u'\bash.exe', u'\powershell.exe', u'\bitsadmin.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\w3wp.exe', u'\httpd.exe', u'\nginx.exe', u'\php-cgi.exe', u'\tomcat.exe', u'\UMWorkerProcess.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Particular web applications may spawn a shell process legitimately]
title: Shells Spawned by Web Servers

author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov
description: Detects a whoami.exe executed by LOCAL SYSTEM. This may be a sign of a successful local privilege escalation.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\whoami.exe', u'User|startswith': [u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM', u'AUTORITE NT\Sys']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Run Whoami as SYSTEM

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privieleges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\whoami.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'/priv'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Run Whoami Showing Privileges

author: Olaf Hartong
description: Detects Task Scheduler .job import arbitrary DACL write\par
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\schtasks.exe', u'CommandLine|contains|all': [u'/change', u'/TN', u'/RU', u'/RP']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows 10 Scheduled Task SandboxEscaper 0-day

author: Victor Sergeev, oscd.community
description: Detects Winword.exe loading of custmom dll via /l cmd switch
detection: {u'cmd': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'/l'}, u'image_path': {u'Image|endswith': u'\winword.exe'}, u'condition': u'image_path and cmd'}
title: Winword.exe Loads Suspicious DLL

author: Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g
description: Detects wmiprvse spawning processes
detection: {u'filter': [{u'LogonId': ['0x3e7', 'null']}, {u'SubjectLogonId': ['0x3e7', 'null']}, {u'User|startswith': ['NT AUTHORITY\\SYSTEM', 'AUTORITE NT\\Sys']}, {u'Image|endswith': ['\\WmiPrvSE.exe', '\\WerFault.exe']}], u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\WmiPrvSe.exe'}, u'filter_null2': {u'SubjectLogonId': None}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter and not filter_null1 and not filter_null2', u'filter_null1': {u'LogonId': None}}
title: Wmiprvse Spawning Process

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': u'\EdgeTransport.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent

author: Thomas Patzke
description: Detects WMI script event consumers
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image': u'C:\WINDOWS\system32\wbem\scrcons.exe', u'ParentImage': u'C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer

author: Markus Neis / @Karneades
description: Detects WMI spawning PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': [u'\powershell.exe'], u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\wmiprvse.exe']}, u'filter_null2': {u'CommandLine': None}, u'condition': u'selection and not filter_null1 and not filter_null2', u'filter_null1': {u'CommandLine': u'null'}}
title: WMI Spawning Windows PowerShell

author: Nik Seetharaman, frack113
description: Detects invocation of Microsoft Workflow Compiler, which may permit the execution of arbitrary unsigned code.
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'\Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe'}, u'selection_t1218': {u'CommandLine|contains': u'.xml', u'OriginalFileName': u'Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection or selection_t1218'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate MWC use (unlikely in modern enterprise environments)]
title: Microsoft Workflow Compiler

author: Sreeman
description: Looks for changes to registry to disable any write-protect property for storage devices. This could be a precursor to a ransomware attack and has been an observed technique used by cypherpunk group.
detection: {u'selection': {u'CommandLine|re': u'(?i).*reg add.*hklm\\\\system\\\\currentcontrolset\\\\control.*(storage|storagedevicepolicies).*write protection.*0.*'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Write Protect For Storage Disabled

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a method that uses Wsreset.exe tool that can be used to reset the Windows Store to bypass UAC
detection: {u'selection': {u'ParentImage|endswith': [u'\WSreset.exe']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Wsreset UAC Bypass

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files. Rule detects when adversaries abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.
detection: {u'selection': [{u'Image|endswith': u'\wmic.exe', u'CommandLine|contains': u'/format'}, {u'Image|endswith': u'\msxsl.exe'}], u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [WMIC.exe FP depend on scripts and administrative methods used in the monitored environment., msxsl.exe is not installed by default, so unlikely.]
title: XSL Script Processing

author: Cedric MAURUGEON
description: Detects the deletion of a prefetch file (AntiForensic)
detection: {u'exception': {u'Image': u'C:\windows\system32\svchost.exe', u'User': u'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'}, u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|startswith': u'C:\Windows\Prefetch\', u'TargetFilename|endswith': u'.pf'}, u'condition': u'selection and not exception'}
title: Prefetch File Deletion

author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research)
description: A General detection to trigger for the deletion of files by Sysinternals SDelete. It looks for the common name pattern used to rename files.
detection: {u'selection': {u'TargetFilename|endswith': [u'.AAA', u'.ZZZ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Sysinternals SDelete File Deletion

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detect DLL deletions from Spooler Service driver folder
detection: {u'selection': {u'Image|endswith': u'spoolsv.exe', u'TargetFilename|contains': u'C:\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\x64\3\'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious File Deletion

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detecting use WinAPI Functions in PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'WaitForSingleObject', u'QueueUserApc', u'RtlCreateUserThread', u'OpenProcess', u'VirtualAlloc', u'VirtualFree', u'WriteProcessMemory', u'CreateUserThread', u'CloseHandle', u'GetDelegateForFunctionPointer', u'CreateThread', u'memcpy', u'LoadLibrary', u'GetModuleHandle', u'GetProcAddress', u'VirtualProtect', u'FreeLibrary', u'ReadProcessMemory', u'CreateRemoteThread', u'AdjustTokenPrivileges', u'WriteByte', u'WriteInt32', u'OpenThreadToken', u'PtrToString', u'FreeHGlobal', u'ZeroFreeGlobalAllocUnicode', u'OpenProcessToken', u'GetTokenInformation', u'SetThreadToken', u'ImpersonateLoggedOnUser', u'RevertToSelf', u'GetLogonSessionData', u'CreateProcessWithToken', u'DuplicateTokenEx', u'OpenWindowStation', u'OpenDesktop', u'MiniDumpWriteDump', u'AddSecurityPackage', u'EnumerateSecurityPackages', u'GetProcessHandle', u'DangerousGetHandle', u'kernel32', u'Advapi32', u'msvcrt', u'ntdll', u'user32', u'secur32']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Accessing WinAPI in PowerShell

author: Bhabesh Raj
description: Detects execution of ADRecon.ps1 for AD reconnaissance which has been reported to be actively used by FIN7
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Function Get-ADRExcelComOb', u'ADRecon-Report.xlsx']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell ADRecon Execution

author: frack113
description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.
detection: {u'selection_cmd': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Get-ChildItem', u' -Recurse ', u' -Include ']}, u'condition': u'all of them', u'selection_ext': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'.doc', u'.docx', u'.xls', u'.xlsx', u'.ppt', u'.pptx', u'.rtf', u'.pdf', u'.txt']}}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Automated Collection Command PowerShell

author: Austin Songer (@austinsonger)
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Invoke-AzureHound']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script Block Logging must be enable', u'product': u'windows'}
tags: [attack.discovery, attack.t1482, attack.t1087, attack.t1087.001, attack.t1087.002, attack.t1069.001, attack.t1069.002, attack.t1069]
title: AzureHound PowerShell Commands

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects Execution via SyncInvoke in CL_Invocation.ps1 module
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'CL_Invocation.ps1', u'SyncInvoke']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Execution via CL_Invocation.ps1

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects Execution via SyncInvoke in CL_Invocation.ps1 module
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'CL_Invocation.ps1', u'SyncInvoke']}, u'condition': u'selection | count(ScriptBlockText) by Computer > 2'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Execution via CL_Invocation.ps1 (2 Lines)

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects Execution via runAfterCancelProcess in CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1 module
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1', u'runAfterCancelProcess']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Execution via CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1

author: oscd.community, Natalia Shornikova
description: Detects Execution via runAfterCancelProcess in CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1 module
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1', u'runAfterCancelProcess']}, u'condition': u'selection | count(ScriptBlockText) by Computer > 2'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Execution via CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1 (2 Lines)

author: @ROxPinTeddy
description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'New-LocalUser'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Create Local User

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'-Recurse', u'|', u'Compress-Archive']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Highly likely if archive operations are done via PowerShell.]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Data Compressed - PowerShell

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may employ various system checks to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments. This may include changing behaviors based on the results of checks for the presence of artifacts indicative of a virtual machine environment (VME) or sandbox
detection: {u'selection_action': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Get-WmiObject'}, u'selection_module': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'MSAcpi_ThermalZoneTemperature', u'Win32_ComputerSystem']}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Detect Virtualization Environment

author: Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community
description: Dnscat exfiltration tool execution
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Start-Dnscat2'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate usage of PowerShell Dnscat2 — DNS Exfiltration tool (unlikely)]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Dnscat Execution

author: Bartlomiej Czyz @bczyz1, oscd.community
description: Detects Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol - ICMP. Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'New-Object', u'System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping', u'.Send(']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell ICMP Exfiltration

author: Max Altgelt, Tobias Michalski
description: Detects Commandlet name for PrintNightmare exploitation.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Invoke-Nightmare'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script Block Logging must be enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PrintNightmare Powershell Exploitation

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+clip(?:\.exe)?.{0,4}&&.+clipboard]::\(\s\\\"\{\d\}.+\-f.+\"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher

author: Daniel Bohannon (@Mandiant/@FireEye), oscd.community
description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block — https://github.com/danielbohannon/Invoke-Obfuscation/blob/master/Out-ObfuscatedStringCommand.ps1#L873-L888
detection: {u'selection_iex': [{u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\$PSHome\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$PSHome\['}, {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\$ShellId\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$ShellId\['}, {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\$env:Public\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$env:Public\['}, {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\$env:ComSpec\[(\s*\d{1,3}\s*,){2}'}, {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\\\\*mdr\\\\*\W\s*\)\.Name'}, {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\$VerbosePreference\.ToString\('}, {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'\String\]\s*\$VerbosePreference'}], u'condition': u'selection_iex'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'.*cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+powershell.+(?:\$\{?input\}?|noexit).+\"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher

author: Jonathan Cheong, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*new-object.*(?:system\.io\.compression\.deflatestream|system\.io\.streamreader).*text\.encoding\]::ascii.*readtoend'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*rundll32(?:\.exe)?(?:\s+)?shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*powershell.*\"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*(set).*&&\s?set.*(environment|invoke|\${?input).*&&.*"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*?echo.*clip.*&&.*(Clipboard|i`?n`?v`?o`?k`?e`?).*'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*(set).*(&&).*(mshta).*(vbscript:createobject).*(\.run).*\(window\.close\).*"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA

author: Nikita Nazarov, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*&&.*rundll32.*shell32\.dll.*shellexec_rundll.*(value|invoke|comspec|iex).*"'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|re': u'(?i).*&&set.*(\{\d\}){2,}\\\"\s+?\-f.*&&.*cmd.*\/c'}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may log user keystrokes to intercept credentials as the user types them.
detection: {u'selection_high': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Get-ProcAddress user32.dll GetAsyncKeyState', u'Get-ProcAddress user32.dll GetForegroundWindow']}, u'selection_basic': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Get-Keystrokes'}, u'condition': u'selection_basic or selection_high'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Keylogging

[u'Invoke-DllInjection', u'Invoke-Shellcode', u'Invoke-WmiCommand', u'Get-GPPPassword', u'Get-Keystrokes', u'Get-TimedScreenshot', u'Get-VaultCredential', u'Invoke-CredentialInjection', author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks
detection: {u'Malicious': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'AdjustTokenPrivileges', u'IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR64_MAGIC', u'Microsoft.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods', u'ReadProcessMemory.Invoke', u'SE_PRIVILEGE_ENABLED', u'LSA_UNICODE_STRING', u'MiniDumpWriteDump', u'PAGE_EXECUTE_READ', u'SECURITY_DELEGATION', u'TOKEN_ADJUST_PRIVILEGES', u'TOKEN_ALL_ACCESS', u'TOKEN_ASSIGN_PRIMARY', u'TOKEN_DUPLICATE', u'TOKEN_ELEVATION', u'TOKEN_IMPERSONATE', u'TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS', u'TOKEN_PRIVILEGES', u'TOKEN_QUERY', u'Metasploit', u'Mimikatz']}, u'condition': u'Malicious'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'It is recommended to use the new "Script Block Logging" of PowerShell v5 https://adsecurity.org/?p=2277', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Malicious PowerShell Keywords

author: Max Altgelt
description: Detects usage of a PowerShell command to dump the live memory of a Windows machine
detection: {u'dump': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Get-StorageDiagnosticInfo', u'-IncludeLiveDump']}, u'condition': u'dump'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Live Memory Dump Using Powershell

author: Alec Costello
description: Detects Commandlet names and arguments from the Nishang exploitation framework
detection: {u'Nishang': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Add-ConstrainedDelegationBackdoor', u'Set-DCShadowPermissions', u'DNS_TXT_Pwnage', u'Execute-OnTime', u'HTTP-Backdoor', u'Set-RemotePSRemoting', u'Set-RemoteWMI', u'Invoke-AmsiBypass', u'Out-CHM', u'Out-HTA', u'Out-SCF', u'Out-SCT', u'Out-Shortcut', u'Out-WebQuery', u'Out-Word', u'Enable-Duplication', u'Remove-Update', u'Download-Execute-PS', u'Download_Execute', u'Execute-Command-MSSQL', u'Execute-DNSTXT-Code', u'Out-RundllCommand', u'Copy-VSS', u'FireBuster', u'FireListener', u'Get-Information', u'Get-PassHints', u'Get-WLAN-Keys', u'Get-Web-Credentials', u'Invoke-CredentialsPhish', u'Invoke-MimikatzWDigestDowngrade', u'Invoke-SSIDExfil', u'Invoke-SessionGopher', u'Keylogger', u'Invoke-Interceptor', u'Create-MultipleSessions', u'Invoke-NetworkRelay', u'Run-EXEonRemote', u'Invoke-Prasadhak', u'Invoke-BruteForce', u'Password-List', u'Invoke-JSRatRegsvr', u'Invoke-JSRatRundll', u'Invoke-PoshRatHttps', u'Invoke-PowerShellIcmp', u'Invoke-PowerShellUdp', u'Invoke-PSGcat', u'Invoke-PsGcatAgent', u'Remove-PoshRat', u'Add-Persistance', u'ExetoText', u'Invoke-Decode', u'Invoke-Encode', u'Parse_Keys', u'Remove-Persistence', u'StringtoBase64', u'TexttoExe', u'Powerpreter', u'Nishang', u'DataToEncode', u'LoggedKeys', u'OUT-DNSTXT', u'ExfilOption', u'DumpCerts', u'DumpCreds', u'Shellcode32', u'Shellcode64', u'NotAllNameSpaces', u'exfill', u'FakeDC']}, u'condition': u'Nishang'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Malicious Nishang PowerShell Commandlets

author: Sami Ruohonen
description: Detects writing data into NTFS alternate data streams from powershell. Needs Script Block Logging.
detection: {u'content': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'set-content', u'add-content']}, u'stream': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'-stream']}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: NTFS Alternate Data Stream

author: John Lambert (idea), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects PowerShell calling a credential prompt
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'PromptForCredential'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Credential Prompt

author: Sean Metcalf (source), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects the use of PSAttack PowerShell hack tool
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'PS ATTACK!!!'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell PSAttack

author: frack113
description: Detects use of Set-ExecutionPolicy to set a unsecure policies
detection: {u'cmdlet': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Set-ExecutionPolicy'}, u'option': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Unrestricted', u'bypass', u'RemoteSigned']}, u'condition': u'cmdlet and option'}
title: Change PowerShell Policies to a Unsecure Level

author: David Ledbetter (shellcode), Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects Base64 encoded Shellcode
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'AAAAYInlM'}, u'selection2': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'OiCAAAAYInlM', u'OiJAAAAYInlM']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell ShellCode

author: Max Altgelt, Tobias Michalski
description: Detects Commandlet names from ShellIntel exploitation scripts.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Invoke-SMBAutoBrute', u'Invoke-GPOLinks', u'Out-Minidump', u'Invoke-Potato']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script Block Logging must be enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Malicious ShellIntel PowerShell Commandlets

author: frack113
description: Storing files in Alternate Data Stream (ADS) similar to Astaroth malware.
detection: {u'selection_compspec': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Start-Process', u'-FilePath "$env:comspec" ', u'-ArgumentList ', u'>']}, u'condition': u'selection_compspec'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Store File In Alternate Data Stream

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command
detection: {u'download': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'.DownloadFile(', u'.DownloadString(']}, u'webclient': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'System.Net.WebClient'}, u'condition': u'webclient and download'}
falsepositives: [PowerShell scripts that download content from the Internet]
title: Suspicious PowerShell Download

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects Commandlet that is used to export certificates from the local certificate store and sometimes used by threat actors to steal private keys from compromised machines
detection: {u'PfxCertificate': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Export-PfxCertificate'}, u'condition': u'PfxCertificate'}
falsepositives: [Legitimate certificate exports invoked by administrators or users (depends on processes in the environment - filter if unusable)]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script Block Logging must be enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious Export-PfxCertificate

author: Florian Roth
description: Detects a Get-Process command on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity
detection: {u'condition': u'select_LSASS', u'select_LSASS': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Get-Process lsass'}}
falsepositives: [Legitimate certificate exports invoked by administrators or users (depends on processes in the environment - filter if unusable)]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script Block Logging must be enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS in ScriptBlock

author: Florian Roth (rule)
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
detection: {u'encoded': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u' -enc ', u' -EncodedCommand ']}, u'hidden': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u' -w hidden ', u' -window hidden ', u' -windowstyle hidden ']}, u'condition': u'all of them', u'noninteractive': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u' -noni ', u' -noninteractive ']}}
falsepositives: [Penetration tests, Very special / sneaky PowerShell scripts]
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic

author: Florian Roth (rule), Jonhnathan Ribeiro
description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters
detection: {u'iex_webclient': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'iex', u'New-Object', u'Net.WebClient', u'.Download']}, u'enc_selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u' -w ', u'hidden', u'-ep', u'bypass', u'-Enc']}, u'reg_selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'powershell', u'reg', u'add', u'HKCU\software\microsoft\windows\currentversion\run']}, u'iex_selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u' -w ', u'hidden', u'-noni', u'-nop', u' -c ', u'iex', u'New-Object']}, u'webclient_selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'bypass', u'-noprofile', u'-windowstyle', u'hidden', u'new-object', u'system.net.webclient', u'.download']}, u'condition': u'1 of them', u'convert_b64': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'-nop', u' -w ', u'hidden', u' -c ', u'[Convert]::FromBase64String']}}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific

author: Florian Roth, Perez Diego (@darkquassar)
description: Detects keywords that could indicate the use of some PowerShell exploitation framework
detection: {u'framework': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'System.Reflection.Assembly.Load($', u'[System.Reflection.Assembly]::Load($', u'[Reflection.Assembly]::Load($', u'System.Reflection.AssemblyName', u'Reflection.Emit.AssemblyBuilderAccess', u'Runtime.InteropServices.DllImportAttribute', u'SuspendThread', u'rundll32', u'Invoke-WMIMethod', u'http://127.0.0.1']}, u'condition': u'framework'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled for 4104', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell Keywords

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may target user email on local systems to collect sensitive information. Files containing email data can be acquired from a user’s local system, such as Outlook storage or cache files.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Get-Inbox.ps1', u'Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook', u'Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.olDefaultFolders', u'-comobject outlook.application']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Local Email Collection

author: oscd.community, @redcanary, Zach Stanford @svch0st
description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Remove-SmbShare', u'Remove-FileShare']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrators or Power users may remove their shares via cmd line]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: PowerShell Deleted Mounted Share

author: frack113
description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data
detection: {u'selection_action': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Get-Service ', u'Get-ChildItem ', u'Get-Process ']}, u'selection_redirect': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'> $env:TEMP\'}, u'condition': u'all of them'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Recon Information for Export with PowerShell

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may attempt to gather information about attached peripheral devices and components connected to a computer system.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'Win32_PnPEntity'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Suspicious Win32_PnPEntity

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users. In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'powershell', u'WindowStyle', u'Hidden']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Suspicious PowerShell WindowStyle Option

author: frack113
description: Use living off the land tools to zip a file and stage it in the Windows temporary folder for later exfiltration
detection: {u'selection_4104': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Compress-Archive ', u' -Path ', u' -DestinationPath ', u'$env:TEMP\']}, u'condition': u'selection_4104'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script Block Logging must be enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Zip A Folder With PowerShell For Staging In Temp

author: Ensar Şamil, @sblmsrsn, OSCD Community
description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe'}, u'condition': u'selection'}
related: [{u'type': u'derived', u'id': u'fde7929d-8beb-4a4c-b922-be9974671667'}, {u'type': u'derived', u'id': u'9f7aa113-9da6-4a8d-907c-5f1a4b908299'}]
title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may modify file time attributes to hide new or changes to existing files. Timestomping is a technique that modifies the timestamps of a file (the modify, access, create, and change times), often to mimic files that are in the same folder.
detection: {u'selection_ioc': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'.CreationTime =', u'.LastWriteTime =', u'.LastAccessTime =', u'[IO.File]::SetCreationTime', u'[IO.File]::SetLastAccessTime', u'[IO.File]::SetLastWriteTime']}, u'condition': u'selection_ioc'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Timestomp

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may gain persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by PowerShell profiles.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Start-Process', u'""'], u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Add-Content', u'$profile', u'-Value']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell Trigger Profiles by Add_Content

author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573
description: Detects the use of various web request methods (including aliases) via Windows PowerShell command
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Invoke-WebRequest', u'iwr ', u'wget ', u'curl ', u'Net.WebClient', u'Start-BitsTransfer']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Use of Get-Command and Get-Help modules to reference Invoke-WebRequest and Start-BitsTransfer.]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Windows PowerShell Web Request

author: Austin Songer @austinsonger
description: Detects when a user disables the Windows Firewall via a Profile to help evade defense.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': [u'Set-NetFirewallProfile', u'-Profile', u'-Enabled', u'False']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
title: Windows Firewall Profile Disabled

author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community
description: Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete. Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': u'CurrentVersion\Winlogon'}, u'selection2': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'Set-ItemProperty', u'New-Item']}, u'condition': u'selection and selection2'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Winlogon Helper DLL

author: NVISO
description: Detects parameters used by WMImplant
detection: {u'selection': {u'ScriptBlockText|contains': [u'WMImplant', u' change_user ', u' gen_cli ', u' command_exec ', u' disable_wdigest ', u' disable_winrm ', u' enable_wdigest ', u' enable_winrm ', u' registry_mod ', u' remote_posh ', u' sched_job ', u' service_mod ', u' process_kill ', u' active_users ', u' basic_info ', u' power_off ', u' vacant_system ', u' logon_events ']}, u'condition': u'selection'}
falsepositives: [Administrative scripts that use the same keywords.]
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'Script block logging must be enabled', u'product': u'windows'}
title: WMImplant Hack Tool

author: frack113
description: Adversaries may establish persistence and elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event subscription.
detection: {u'selection_ioc': [{u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': ['New-CimInstance ', '-Namespace root/subscription ', '-ClassName __EventFilter ', '-Property ']}, {u'ScriptBlockText|contains|all': ['New-CimInstance ', '-Namespace root/subscription ', '-ClassName CommandLineEventConsumer ', '-Property ']}], u'condition': u'selection_ioc'}
logsource: {u'category': u'ps_script', u'definition': u'EnableScriptBlockLogging must be set to enable', u'product': u'windows'}
title: Powershell WMI Persistence
